Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a passionate and meticulous engineer who thrives on ensuring that engineering software products exceed the highest standards of quality and reliability. With a foundation in mechanical, civil, or materials engineering—and a solid grasp of computational mechanics—you are keenly analytical, detail-oriented, and comfortable working in fast-paced, collaborative environments. You bring hands-on experience or strong academic exposure to FEA and CAE tools, and you have a genuine interest in developing robust test cases that push technological boundaries.
You have a strong programming background, with proficiency in languages such as Python, C++, C#, or JavaScript, and you are eager to apply these skills to automate and streamline testing processes. Your curiosity drives you to investigate root causes and simplify complex systems, while your organizational abilities ensure that your work is thorough and well-documented. You communicate clearly and proactively with cross-functional teams, and you’re comfortable navigating both Linux and Windows environments.
You are a lifelong learner, always seeking out new knowledge—especially in areas like structural dynamics, advanced numerical methods, and the latest simulation technologies. You value collaboration, thrive in diverse teams, and are committed to building strong working relationships with your peers in development, testing, and support. Above all, you are driven by the desire to make a tangible impact on the performance and usability of world-class engineering simulation software.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Planning and executing comprehensive testing and verification activities for engineering simulation software, in alignment with established development and testing processes.
Analyzing requirements and designing innovative tests for new features across various engineering domains.
Participating in design and code reviews, providing critical input to improve product quality and functionality.
Developing, specifying, and maintaining both automated and manual test cases—including writing and refining test scripts.
Testing products at multiple levels: workflow, unit, application, and performance, to ensure robust and reliable releases.
Investigating and troubleshooting issues, identifying root causes, and collaborating with development teams to resolve defects swiftly.
Creating and managing metrics and monitoring systems for early detection of defects and continuous quality improvement.
Coordinating with technical support and cross-functional teams to address dependencies and ensure seamless product delivery.
The Impact You Will Have:
Enhancing the reliability and accuracy of engineering simulation products, directly influencing customer satisfaction and trust.
Ensuring new features meet rigorous quality standards, supporting the continued leadership of Synopsys in engineering software innovation.
Reducing time-to-market for new releases through efficient and effective verification practices.
Contributing to the usability and performance of software tools critical to industries such as aerospace, automotive, energy, and manufacturing.
Driving continuous improvement by identifying process enhancements and introducing new testing methodologies.
Supporting the overall product lifecycle by collaborating with development, support, and quality teams to resolve issues and implement best practices.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Materials Science, Structural Engineering, or related field with 2+ years of relevant experience, or a Master’s degree.
Strong knowledge of structural and computational mechanics.
Experience or academic exposure to FEA and CAE tools, with a solid understanding of finite element methods.
Proficiency in programming or scripting languages such as Python, C++, C#, or JavaScript for test automation and tool development.
Experience in both Linux and Windows environments, with the ability to adapt to various computing platforms and clusters.
Who You Are:
Detail-oriented and thorough, with a commitment to delivering high-quality results.
Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
Collaborative team player who builds effective relationships across disciplines.
Excellent communicator, able to articulate technical concepts clearly in both written and verbal forms.
Organized, proactive, and adaptable—able to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic environment.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a dynamic R&D team focused on advancing the capabilities of the Ansys Mechanical suite of applications. The team is composed of passionate engineers and software developers who value collaboration, innovation, and quality. Together, you’ll work closely with product management, technical support, and other cross-functional teams to deliver high-impact solutions that set industry standards for engineering simulation.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.
In addition to the base salary, this role may be eligible for an annual bonus, equity, and other discretionary bonuses. Synopsys offers comprehensive health, wellness, and financial benefits as part of a competitive total rewards package. The actual compensation offered will be based on a number of job-related factors, including location, skills, experience, and education. Your recruiter can share more specific details on the total rewards package upon request. The base salary range for this role is across the U.S.
Back to job list
Apply

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a seasoned ASIC Design Engineer with a robust background in design automation and a keen understanding of the intricate challenges in advanced semiconductor development. Your commitment to excellence is matched by your passion for leveraging technology to solve real-world problems, and you thrive in environments that encourage collaboration, continuous learning, and innovation. With a strong foundation in electronic engineering and advanced programming skills—especially in Python, Perl, and TCL—you are adept at architecting resilient solutions within UNIX/Linux environments. Your experience extends to Agile software methodologies, enabling you to adapt quickly to evolving project requirements and deliver high-quality results.
Your curiosity propels you to stay abreast of the latest tools and AI frameworks, and you excel at integrating emerging technologies into complex workflows. You have a proven history of leading and executing multifaceted projects, demonstrating initiative and fostering a culture of mentorship and knowledge sharing. Your analytical mindset, clear communication, and adaptability make you a trusted advisor and resource within teams. Above all, you are driven by the desire to make a tangible impact in the world of chip design and automation, eager to contribute to innovative projects that set new industry standards.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Developing and applying Agile software engineering methods, theories, and research techniques to solve complex technical problems within the ASIC design automation domain.
Planning, executing, and overseeing technical projects related to the architecture and development of advanced application software for design automation.
Defining and selecting innovative approaches for implementing software engineering applications and ASIC design specifications.
Preparing detailed design specifications, conducting comprehensive technical investigations, and presenting findings to stakeholders.
Collaborating closely with team members on task-oriented projects and cross-functional initiatives to accelerate design workflows.
Networking with senior internal and external experts to share knowledge and best practices in design automation and software development.
Mentoring and guiding junior peers, fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment that encourages continuous learning.
The Impact You Will Have:
Accelerating and automating design activities across R&D and circuit design teams, improving overall productivity and innovation velocity.
Enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of design communities through the deployment of advanced software tools and automation frameworks.
Driving innovation in chip design and verification by implementing state-of-the-art solutions that push the boundaries of what’s possible.
Contributing directly to the development and integration of high-performance silicon chips and software content used in leading-edge applications.
Facilitating seamless integration of IP across various projects, ensuring robust and scalable design automation tools are in place.
Enabling teams to deliver reliable, high-quality results by establishing best practices in design automation and software engineering.
What You’ll Need:
MS or PhD in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering with at least 10+ years of direct industry experience.
Expertise in programming languages such as Python, Perl, and TCL, with a demonstrated ability to develop robust automation solutions.
Hands-on experience with Custom Compiler/Virtuoso, circuit and layout automation, and version control systems such as Git and Perforce.
Strong familiarity with test-driven development, unit testing, and functional testing methodologies.
Advanced proficiency in UNIX/Linux environments, with the ability to optimize workflows and troubleshoot complex issues.
Working knowledge of a major AI framework or demonstrated experience using AI to accelerate software development processes.
Who You Are:
A proactive learner with a keen interest in exploring new technologies and methodologies.
An excellent problem solver with strong analytical and investigative skills.
A collaborative team player who builds productive working relationships and communicates effectively.
A self-starter capable of executing projects from start to completion with minimal supervision.
A sophisticated professional with advanced knowledge and wide-ranging experience in design automation and software engineering.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join the Design Automation Team, which provides the design community with software tools to accelerate and automate design activities. This team is integral to our R&D and circuit design efforts, working on cutting-edge projects that push the boundaries of technology. You’ll collaborate with leading experts, contribute to impactful solutions, and be part of a culture that values innovation, diversity, and continuous improvement.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

Descriptions & Requirements
Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a passionate and detail-oriented professional with a strong foundation in optics, electrical engineering, computer science, or a related field. You thrive in collaborative, cross-functional environments, and are driven by a desire to ensure that advanced software solutions are robust, reliable, and deliver exceptional value to end-users. Your curiosity fuels your eagerness to learn new technologies and continuously improve processes. With a keen analytical mind, you are adept at identifying issues, proposing solutions, and ensuring that every product release meets the highest standards of quality and usability.
You bring hands-on experience in software testing, validation, and verification, and are comfortable working with modern programming and scripting languages such as Python, C++, and MATLAB. Your communication skills enable you to clearly articulate technical issues and collaborate effectively with geographically distributed teams. You approach challenges with creativity and resilience, embracing feedback and using it to refine your work. Your attention to detail and commitment to excellence ensure that you consistently deliver results that exceed expectations, making you a trusted partner in the pursuit of innovation.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Designing, specifying, and writing comprehensive test cases for Ansys part of Synopsys - Optics applications, including Lumerical, Speos, and Zemax.
Creating, modifying, and maintaining manual and automated test scripts to ensure thorough functional, regression, and performance testing.
Developing and executing test plans, participating in defect management, and contributing to testing metrics and reporting.
Investigating and reproducing defects, collaborating with R&D teams to verify fixes and drive continuous product improvement.
Contributing to the development and enhancement of internal tools used for automated testing and quality assurance processes.
Working across diverse computing environments, including Windows, Linux, virtual machines, compute clusters, and cloud platforms such as Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure.
Communicating technical findings and collaborating with technical specialists, product managers, and developers to address product issues.
The Impact You Will Have:
Ensuring that Synopsys’ optical simulation products meet and exceed customer expectations for functionality and usability.
Enhancing product reliability and performance through rigorous validation and verification processes.
Enabling rapid and robust product releases by automating testing and quality assurance workflows.
Contributing to continuous improvement in development and testing methodologies, raising the bar for product quality.
Facilitating effective cross-team communication to resolve complex technical issues and implement innovative solutions.
Supporting the adoption of agile practices and modern development tools, positioning Synopsys as a leader in high-performance optical simulation software.
What You’ll Need:
MS in Optics, Electrical Engineering, Physics, Computer Science, or a related field, with at least 2 years of relevant experience.
Proficiency in programming and scripting languages such as Python, C++, and MATLAB.
Experience in software quality assurance, test case development, and defect management.
Familiarity with automated testing frameworks (e.g., Squish, Selenium) and continuous integration systems (e.g., Bamboo, Jenkins).
Experience with revision control tools (e.g., Git, Bitbucket) and defect tracking systems (e.g., Jira, Bugzilla, ADO/TFS).
Ability to work in diverse computing environments including Windows, Linux, and cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure).
Exposure to electromagnetics simulation tools and Ansys Lumerical or similar products is a strong asset.
Who You Are:
Meticulous and attentive to detail, ensuring high-quality outcomes in all tasks.
Effective communicator adept at explaining complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.
Collaborative team player who thrives in geographically distributed, multicultural teams.
Quick learner who adapts to new technologies and methodologies with ease.
Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation.
Self-motivated, proactive, and committed to continuous personal and professional growth.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join the Electronics and Optics team, a dynamic group of engineers and scientists dedicated to advancing the capabilities of Synopsys’ optical simulation software. The team collaborates closely with R&D, product management, and support teams to deliver innovative solutions for customers in fields such as photonics, electronics, and optical design. With a focus on quality, usability, and technical excellence, the team plays a critical role in ensuring that Synopsys’ products remain at the forefront of technological innovation.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
This position is a long term contract until the end of November 2026.
Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. We are committed to provide access & opportunity to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals throughout the recruitment and employment process. Should you require an accommodation, please contact
hr-help-canada@synopsys.com

Descriptions & Requirements
Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a highly skilled and motivated verification engineer with a deep passion for technology and innovation. You thrive in fast-paced, collaborative environments and are excited to solve the toughest challenges in silicon design. With a strong background in SystemVerilog and UVM, you bring proven experience developing robust, scalable verification environments for complex digital systems. You are adept at understanding and interpreting technical specifications, and you excel in creating comprehensive testplans and functional coverage models that ensure product quality and performance.
Your attention to detail, analytical mindset, and creative problem-solving abilities set you apart. You are comfortable working with both local and remote teams, leveraging your excellent communication skills to share your knowledge and mentor others. You value diversity and inclusion, and you are committed to continuous learning and professional growth. Whether independently or as part of a dynamic group, you bring precision, innovation, and leadership to every project. If you are eager to contribute to the development of cutting-edge memory interface IP and make a tangible impact on next-generation technologies, we want you on our team.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Developing detailed verification testplans and comprehensive functional coverage models for complex memory interface IP.
Implementing scalable UVM testbench infrastructure and designing robust test cases to verify training firmware functionality on RTL PHY models.
Collaborating with architecture and implementation teams through technical reviews, ensuring alignment and clarity across project phases.
Diagnosing and resolving complex, abstract verification and debugging challenges using advanced tools and methodologies.
Interpreting standard and functional specifications to develop success path, corner case, and negative test scenarios that ensure product robustness.
Researching and integrating emerging technologies in virtual prototyping and emulation to enhance verification efficiency and quality.
Mentoring junior engineers, contributing to team knowledge sharing and leadership development.
The Impact You Will Have:
Elevate the quality and reliability of Synopsys memory interface IP, directly impacting the success and reputation of our products in the global market.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a seasoned engineering professional with a deep passion for advancing semiconductor technology. With at least a decade of experience in ASIC design, verification, or applications engineering, you bring a robust understanding of both front-end and back-end development. Your expertise extends to integrating cutting-edge Interface IP (IIP) within complex SoC environments, and you thrive on collaborating with customers to solve intricate technical challenges.
Your background is rooted in electrical engineering, computer engineering, or computer science, and you have a proven track record of working with advanced technology nodes such as 10nm, 7nm, 5nm, or 3nm. Your methodical approach, attention to detail, and high degree of self-motivation set you apart. You communicate complex ideas with clarity, whether you’re leading a customer workshop, participating in a technical review, or contributing application notes for the broader engineering community.
You are excited by the prospect of supporting the integration of Synopsys’ industry-leading UCIe (Universal Chiplet Interconnect Express) IP into next-generation products. You are comfortable navigating the latest EDA tools, supporting both simulation and silicon bring-up phases, and you’re eager to provide hands-on guidance at every stage of the SoC development lifecycle. You value inclusion and diversity, and bring a collaborative spirit to every team you join, believing that the best solutions emerge from diverse perspectives and experiences.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Guiding customers through the integration of Synopsys UCIe IP into their ASIC SoC and systems, addressing both technical and process challenges.
Providing expert advice on IIP configuration, simulation, synthesis, floorplanning, static timing analysis (STA), and design-for-test (DFT) strategies.
Conducting in-depth integration reviews at key SoC development milestones to ensure optimal IP performance and compatibility.
Delivering comprehensive training and workshops to customer engineering teams on the latest UCIe specifications and integration best practices.
Collaborating with Synopsys R&D to develop application notes and technical collateral on advanced integration topics.
Supporting pre-sales activities, including technical demos, conference presentations, and responding to technical inquiries from prospective clients.
Providing feedback and insights to R&D for continuous improvement of Synopsys IIP products based on customer experiences and emerging industry trends.
Participating in internal design reviews to align product development with evolving customer needs and market demands.
The Impact You Will Have:
Accelerating customer success by ensuring seamless integration of Synopsys UCIe IP, reducing time-to-market for innovative SoC solutions.
Enhancing the reliability and performance of next-generation semiconductor products across diverse market segments.
Driving adoption of the latest chiplet interconnect standards through effective customer education and support.
Contributing to the evolution of Synopsys’ IP portfolio by relaying critical customer feedback and identifying opportunities for product enhancement.
Influencing the direction of industry standards and best practices through thought leadership and technical collaboration.
Representing Synopsys at industry events, reinforcing our leadership position in IP integration and semiconductor innovation.
Building long-term partnerships with key customers, fostering trust and collaboration across the semiconductor ecosystem.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum 10 years of experience in ASIC design, verification, or applications engineering within advanced technology nodes (10nm/7nm/5nm/3nm).
Hands-on expertise in mixed-signal and high-speed interface design and integration, ASIC front-end and/or back-end implementation, including simulation, synthesis, floorplanning, and DFT.
Strong knowledge of EDA tools and methodologies, with additional experience in P&R, Physical Verification, and Signal/Power Integrity highly valued.
Proven ability to debug and troubleshoot silicon and/or FPGA/hardware, with familiarity in Die-to-Die and PCIe/CXL protocols considered a significant advantage.
Who You Are:
Detail-oriented, self-motivated, and committed to delivering high-quality results.
Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, with a methodical approach to complex challenges.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, able to convey technical concepts clearly to diverse audiences.
Collaborative team player who thrives in cross-functional environments and values diversity of thought.
Adaptable and eager to continuously learn about new technologies and industry trends.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are an inquisitive and collaborative engineering professional with a passion for solving complex technical challenges in the world of electronics and thermal analysis. You thrive in dynamic, fast-paced environments and are eager to support customers at the cutting edge of technology. With a strong academic background in mechanical engineering or physics, you combine analytical rigor with a practical, hands-on approach to problem-solving.
Your experience with thermal simulation tools—such as Ansys Icepak, Ansys Mechanical, HeatDesigner, or FloTHERM—enables you to quickly diagnose issues and propose optimal solutions for customers across the electronics, PCB, and semiconductor packaging industries. You are comfortable working in both Japanese and English, and you communicate technical information clearly and persuasively to a variety of stakeholders.
You are proactive, always looking to deepen your technical expertise and stay ahead of industry trends. Whether automating workflows with Python, C#, or JavaScript, or creating technical documentation, you take pride in delivering high-quality results. With a willingness to travel and an eagerness to contribute to both customer success and product innovation, you embody a growth mindset and a drive for excellence.

Provide expert technical support for Ansys thermal analysis software to customers and channel partners, focusing on electronics, PCBs, and semiconductor packages.
Apply configuration, integration, and troubleshooting techniques to resolve customer issues efficiently and effectively.
Adhere to established support processes to ensure high-quality, timely responses and maximize customer satisfaction.
Develop deep technical expertise in configuring and deploying simulation software across multiple engineering domains.
Collaborate with engineering and product teams by submitting product enhancement requests, defect reports, and participating in field testing of new releases.
Support sales and marketing efforts by delivering product demonstrations, webinars, and training sessions to facilitate customer adoption and engagement.
Contribute to the development of best practices and technical documentation for internal and external stakeholders.
Participate in strategic team and company initiatives, including continuous improvement projects and cross-functional collaborations.
The Impact You Will Have:
Accelerate customer innovation in electronics and semiconductor design through timely and effective technical support.
Enhance the value and adoption of Ansys simulation tools, leading to increased customer satisfaction and loyalty.
Drive product quality improvements by channeling customer feedback and field insights to development teams.
Empower customers to automate and optimize engineering workflows, reducing time-to-market for new products.
Strengthen Synopsys’ reputation as a trusted partner for advanced simulation and design solutions in the APAC region.
Support the broader sales and marketing strategy by enabling successful customer demonstrations and technical enablement activities.
Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and technical excellence within the support engineering team.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or Physics; Ph.D. a plus.
Minimum 1 year of hands-on experience with thermal simulation tools such as Ansys Icepak, Ansys Mechanical, HeatDesigner, or FloTHERM (industry or academic).
Strong communication skills in both Japanese and English, with the ability to explain technical concepts clearly.
Proficiency in automating engineering workflows using Python, C#, JavaScript, or similar programming languages.
Demonstrated experience in technical writing and presentation, particularly in an engineering or software context.
Ability to travel up to 25% domestically and internationally as required.
Familiarity with integrated circuits, semiconductor packages, printed circuit boards, and electronic assemblies is preferred.
Experience with debugging software and creating macros for workflow efficiency is an advantage.
Who You Are:
Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Effective communicator, able to collaborate cross-functionally and with customers at all technical levels.
Self-motivated learner, eager to acquire new knowledge and adapt to evolving technologies.
Highly organized, with strong time management and a sense of urgency in delivering results.
Professional demeanor and a commitment to customer success and continuous improvement.
Demonstrates initiative and ownership in driving tasks to completion and pursuing innovative solutions.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a dedicated and diverse team of technical support engineers specializing in simulation and electronic design automation. The team is passionate about leveraging cutting-edge software to solve real-world engineering challenges for leading technology companies across Japan and the APAC region. Collaboration, mentorship, and technical excellence are at the core of the team’s culture, ensuring an environment where you can develop your skills, share expertise, and make a tangible impact on both customer success and product innovation.

We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a passionate and driven technologist eager to launch your career in a fast-paced, innovative environment. You thrive on solving complex problems and collaborating with diverse teams to deliver impactful solutions. Adaptable and resilient, you are comfortable navigating ambiguity and learning new technologies quickly. Your attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to communicate effectively set you apart. With a foundational background in engineering, computer science, or a related field, you are ready to contribute to enterprise-level software solutions and support world-class clients. You possess a growth mindset, demonstrate initiative, and take pride in delivering high-quality work. You value continuous learning, take ownership of your professional development, and are excited by opportunities to contribute to strategic initiatives. Integrity, professionalism, and a commitment to excellence guide your interactions. You bring a collaborative spirit, a willingness to listen and learn from others, and a genuine desire to make a positive impact on your team and the wider organization. Whether working independently or as part of a geographically distributed team, you maintain focus and drive results, always keeping the customer experience at the forefront.
If you are ready to elevate your career and help shape the future of technology, we invite you to join our team in Pune/Bangalore.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Collaborating with experienced professionals to develop, implement, and maintain enterprise software solutions tailored to customer needs.
Participating in the documentation, testing, and user acceptance of new software modules and subsystems.
Ensuring compliance with data privacy and security regulations by coordinating with cybersecurity teams.
Identifying, logging, and escalating infrastructure defects in both development and live environments.
Evaluating, coordinating, and assigning defect tickets to ensure timely resolution.
Translating process flows and developer instructions into functional development code and validating business requirements against implemented functionality.
Supporting team members in the implementation and maintenance of software modules and subsystems.
Developing technical proficiency and staying up-to-date on new technologies and best practices.
Participating in strategic team and company-wide initiatives as needed.
The Impact You Will Have:
Enhancing customer satisfaction by delivering reliable, high-quality technical support and solutions.
Driving continuous improvement in platform stability, security, and performance.
Accelerating the resolution of technical issues, minimizing downtime for our clients.
Contributing to the successful rollout of new software features and platform enhancements.
Supporting the development and adoption of best practices within the team and organization.
Enabling the business to scale and innovate by ensuring robust infrastructure and seamless user experiences.
Strengthening Synopsys’ reputation for exceptional customer service and technical excellence.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field (BS+0 required; BS+3 or MS+0 preferred).
Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and jQuery, with experience converting wireframes and layouts into working web pages.
Understanding of PHP frameworks (Laravel, Symfony) and JavaScript frameworks (React, Angular, Vue.js).
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git and debugging tools like Firebug or Chrome Inspector.
Working knowledge of SQL queries, database structure, and management.
Familiarity with RESTful APIs and data formats (JSON, XML).
Exposure to WordPress development, including hooks, themes, custom post types, and taxonomies.
Experience with Linux systems (user and administrator) and AWS Cloud platforms, Docker.
Who You Are:
Logical, analytical problem-solver with a strong attention to detail.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; fluent in written and spoken English.
Highly organized and able to manage multiple priorities with a sense of urgency.
Professional, business-minded, and driven to succeed.
Self-starter capable of working independently and collaboratively in a diverse, fast-paced environment.
Quick learner, adaptable to evolving technologies and business needs
Team player who values collaboration and knowledge sharing.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join the Ansys Customer Excellence team, a dynamic group of technical experts dedicated to partnering with clients and delivering innovative enterprise software solutions. The team emphasizes collaboration, knowledge sharing, and continuous improvement, ensuring that every member has the support and resources needed to excel. Together, you will contribute to solution development objectives and strategic initiatives, fostering a culture of growth, inclusion, and technical excellence.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

You Are:
You are an accomplished and dynamic project/program management professional with a passion for operational excellence in high-tech environments. With a strong background in managing large-scale project development or production releases within the EDA or software industry, you thrive in fast-paced, complex, and cross-functional settings. You bring a strategic mindset and a hands-on approach to problem solving, leveraging your technical expertise to streamline processes and drive continuous improvement.
Your experience spans the full lifecycle of program management—from planning and execution to monitoring, validation, and post-release optimization. You are adept at using scripting languages to automate workflows, develop dashboards, and enhance team productivity. Your communication skills enable you to build trusted relationships across engineering, product validation, and production teams, ensuring alignment and transparency at every stage.
You are detail-oriented, adaptable, and resilient in the face of changing priorities. You find satisfaction in optimizing operational processes and delivering quality releases that exceed customer expectations. As a proactive leader, you inspire those around you, championing collaboration and innovation to achieve shared goals. If you are ready to make a strategic impact on the future of silicon and software, we want to hear from you.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Overseeing end-to-end production release management, ensuring smooth and timely delivery of software and feature releases.
Leading content feature planning and tracking project execution, including PV validation status monitoring, change management, and risk control.
Driving release quality convergence to meet or exceed baseline criteria and customer requirements.
Managing onsite testing (OST) and feature OST, including gating issue tracking and resolution.
Coordinating post-ECS B4 (hot patch) releases to expedite critical deployments to customers.
Partnering with Product Validation teams to improve nightly breakage triaging systems, rapidly identifying and addressing culprit changes.
Developing and refining operational workflows, process improvements, and release methodologies (cycle, milestones, branching strategies, dependency analysis, and handoff/interoperability planning).
Designing and implementing dashboards, webpages, and automations to enhance operational productivity and efficiency across production teams.
Tracking daily quality metrics and following up on key indicators to drive continuous improvement in development streams.
The Impact You Will Have:
Ensuring high-quality, reliable, and timely software releases that are critical to Synopsys’ product delivery and customer satisfaction.
Elevating operational efficiency and productivity for production teams through process optimization and automation.
Reducing release-related risks by implementing robust change management and validation tracking systems.
Accelerating issue identification and resolution, minimizing downtime and improving overall release stability.
Facilitating cross-functional collaboration for seamless handoffs and integration across product lines.
Driving innovation in release methodologies that set industry standards and enhance Synopsys’ competitive edge.
What You’ll Need:
Proven program management experience in the EDA or software industry, managing large-scale project development or production releases.
Expertise in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Perl, C-shell) for developing databases, webpages, and operational automations.
Demonstrated ability to track, analyze, and improve quality metrics in complex engineering environments.
Experience implementing and enhancing release methodologies, including cycle planning, branching strategies, and dependency analysis.
Strong understanding of cross-functional workflows in engineering, validation, and production settings.
Who You Are:
Exceptional communicator who excels at collaborating with diverse, cross-functional teams.
Analytical and detail-oriented, with a data-driven approach to problem solving and process optimization.
Adaptable leader who thrives in dynamic, fast-paced environments and embraces change.
Proactive, resourceful, and results-oriented with a passion for operational excellence.
Trusted partner, able to build consensus and drive initiatives to successful completion.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join a high-performing technical program management team based in Sunnyvale, California. The team is dedicated to delivering world-class software and silicon solutions through operational excellence, continuous improvement, and seamless cross-functional collaboration. Together, you will innovate and transform release management processes, delivering exceptional value to Synopsys and its global customers.

We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

:
Actively participate in customer use case discussions to gather and analyze requirements, translating them into new security solutions based on our security IP modules.

:

for new products through efficient system design and integration.

as an industry leader in innovation and technical excellence.

that attracts, retains, and develops top engineering talent.

PhD or advanced MS degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field, with extensive relevant experience.
AMBA based infrastructure knowledge and IC design knowledge
Extensive knowledge and proven experience in digital hardware design and verification. Security is a pre.
Previous experience in security engineering and design of IP in hardware including SW driver, including requirements management
Experience with processor-based subsystems including functional partitioning into hardware and software.
Ability to create technical product specifications and translate those into leading edge implementations
Desirable: modern verification techniques like System Verilog/UVM or formal verification, Jama/Doors, Perl, Javascript, tcl and Linux shell scripting.
Knowledge of Security Architectures and Cryptographic Protocols is an asset

Good knowledge about IC Design flows
Strategic thinker with exceptional problem-solving and debugging skills
Adaptable and effective in fast-paced, dynamic evolving environments.
Innovative mindset, always seeking new solutions and improvements.
Excellent communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills
Collaborative leader with a commitment to mentoring and knowledge sharing.

description_text:
General Information
Job Title
Staff/ Sr Staff RTL Design Engineer
Job ID
13976
Country

Date Posted
09-Jan-2026
Job Category
Engineering
Job Subcategory
R&D Engineering
Hire Type
Employee
Remote Eligible
No
Descriptions & Requirements
Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
As a global leader in semiconductor design and verification solutions, we enable the world’s most advanced technology companies to deliver cutting-edge SoCs and systems. Our mission is to accelerate innovation through state-of-the-art verification IP, methodologies, and strategic consulting. Join us to shape the future of Test and SLM (Silicon Lifecycle Monitors) architectures, high-performance computing, and next-generation connectivity standards.
You Are:
You are a passionate and analytical engineer with a proven track record in digital design and verification, ready to embrace the challenge of developing advanced embedded memory test and SLM architectures. You thrive in dynamic, collaborative environments where your technical expertise and innovative mindset can drive significant impact. Your experience spans RTL logic design, functional verification, and automation at both block and SoC levels, and you are eager to apply your skills to industry-leading protocols such as IEEE1500, IEEE1687, and AMBA standards.
You are detail-oriented, always seeking to ensure design integrity and optimal performance through rigorous validation, debugging, and synthesis. Your hands-on approach extends to scripting and automation, enhancing productivity and accelerating development cycles. You communicate effectively with cross-functional teams, translating complex technical concepts for diverse stakeholders, and you enjoy mentoring and guiding others to achieve shared goals. Your motivation comes from building robust, scalable solutions that enable global technology leaders to innovate at the highest level.
With a growth mindset, you are constantly learning—exploring new methodologies, tools, and industry trends. You are proactive, adaptable, and always willing to step up when challenges arise. Your commitment to excellence, customer-centric attitude, and enthusiasm for continuous improvement make you a valuable contributor to any high-performing engineering team.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Developing and modeling RTL logic in Verilog for embedded memory test and SLM IP blocks.
Performing digital design validation and functional verification at both block and SoC levels.
Executing logic synthesis, static timing analysis, and generating fault coverage reports to ensure robust designs.
Applying DFT (Design-for-Test) expertise for comprehensive memory and logic testing.
Identifying and troubleshooting design timing and DFT functional issues to optimize chip performance.
Utilizing and scripting in languages such as Tcl to automate design and verification workflows.
Defining architecture, logic, test bench designs, and embedded software functions for advanced test and analytics.
Developing and maintaining technical collateral including test suites, protocol documentation, and debug guides.
Collaborating with R&D and marketing teams to define new features, drive enhancements, and align product roadmaps.
Delivering product training, managing customer support cases, and ensuring turnaround time (TAT) metrics are met or exceeded.
The Impact You Will Have:
Accelerate the delivery of reliable, high-performance SoCs for industry-leading technology companies.
Shape the evolution of embedded memory test and SLM architectures that power next-generation devices.
Drive innovation in simulation, emulation, and verification methodologies for advanced semiconductor products.
Enhance customer satisfaction by delivering robust, easy-to-use IP and responsive technical support.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of Synopsys’ design and verification solutions, setting new industry benchmarks.
Mentor and elevate team capabilities, fostering a culture of excellence, knowledge sharing, and mutual growth.
Influence the adoption of best practices in DFT, protocol compliance, and subsystem integration across the organization.
Support strategic decision-making by providing technical insights and market-driven recommendations.
What You’ll Need:
3-5 years of relevant experience in ASIC digital design and verification.
Proficiency in RTL simulation, logic synthesis, and timing verification tools.
Deep expertise in UVM, SystemVerilog, and protocol verification (e.g., IEEE1500, IEEE1687, AXI, AMBA).
Hands-on experience with VIPs and transactors in simulation and emulation environments.
Strong understanding of DFT architectures, interconnects, and cache coherency protocols.
Familiarity with debug tools such as Verdi and workflows for performance analysis.
Programming skills in SystemVerilog, UVM, Verilog, C/C++, Python, and scripting languages like Tcl.
Experience with EDA tools such as VCS, Verdi, and DC, and methodologies including VC Auto-Testbench and protocol compliance checking.
Who You Are:
Analytical thinker with exceptional problem-solving skills.
Effective communicator, able to collaborate across disciplines and with external partners.
Proactive, self-motivated, and adaptable in fast-paced environments.
Committed to quality, detail, and continuous learning.
Team player who values diversity, inclusion, and mentorship.
Customer-focused, dedicated to delivering timely and effective solutions.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a highly collaborative and innovative team of digital design and verification experts, working at the forefront of embedded memory test and SLM architecture development. The team bridges R&D, marketing, and customer engagement, driving the roadmap for advanced SoC solutions. With a culture of knowledge sharing, technical excellence, and mutual support, you’ll thrive in an environment that values creativity, initiative, and a shared commitment to shaping the future of semiconductor technology.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are an accomplished software engineer with a passion for innovation and a drive to solve challenging problems. With a minimum of 5 years of experience in software development, you possess deep expertise in C/C++ and a thorough understanding of data structures and algorithms. You’re familiar with operating systems, compilers, networks, and internet-related tools, and have hands-on experience in developing complex software projects. Your background includes working with Hierarchical DFT, 1687, Pattern Porting, and CAD tool development, and you are keen to expand your knowledge in these areas. You approach issues with creativity, exercise independent judgment, and thrive in collaborative environments where you can guide and mentor junior peers. You embody a growth mindset, always eager to learn new technologies and refine your skills. Your analytical acumen and problem-solving abilities enable you to navigate ambiguity and deliver robust solutions. You value diversity, inclusivity, and teamwork, believing that the best results are achieved through open communication and shared expertise. You are proactive, adaptable, and committed to excellence, ready to make a significant impact within a forward-thinking organization.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Designing, developing, troubleshooting, and debugging sophisticated software programs and tools.
Building and enhancing software solutions including operating systems, compilers, routers, networking utilities, databases, and internet-related applications.
Determining hardware compatibility and influencing hardware design to optimize software performance.
Creating robust algorithms and data structures to solve complex engineering problems.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to execute projects from conception to completion.
Guiding and mentoring junior team members, sharing expertise and fostering a collaborative learning environment.
Analyzing, diagnosing, and resolving technical issues with creative and effective solutions.
The Impact You Will Have:
Driving innovation in chip design and verification through advanced software development.
Enhancing the performance, efficiency, and reliability of Synopsys tools and solutions.
Contributing to the successful delivery of high-performance silicon chips for global customers.
Empowering teams with technical leadership, knowledge sharing, and mentorship.
Influencing hardware and software integration for optimal system outcomes.
Helping Synopsys maintain its leadership in the semiconductor and software industry through continuous improvement and creative problem-solving.
What You’ll Need:
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in software development, preferably in high-tech or semiconductor domains.
Expertise in C/C++ programming and a strong foundation in data structures and algorithms.
Hands-on experience with operating systems, compilers, networks, and internet-related tools.
Prior knowledge and experience in Hierarchical DFT, 1687, Pattern Porting, and CAD tool development.
Ability to resolve complex technical issues independently and creatively.
Familiarity with hardware-software integration and performance optimization.
Who You Are:
Analytical thinker with exceptional problem-solving skills.
Effective communicator and collaborative team player.
Proactive learner with a growth mindset and adaptability to new technologies.
Mentor and guide for junior engineers, fostering inclusion and knowledge sharing.
Independent decision-maker who thrives in dynamic, fast-paced environments.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a talented and diverse engineering team at Synopsys, focused on driving the next generation of software tools for chip design and verification. The team collaborates closely across disciplines, blending expertise in software and hardware to deliver industry-leading solutions. You’ll work alongside passionate engineers dedicated to continuous learning, innovation, and excellence.

Proposing micro-architecture of design/design updates based on customer requirements, analog requirements, system performance improvements, Link layer interface changes, or overall robustness of design.
Implementing RTL in Verilog and running Spyglass CDC/RDC/Lint.
Collaborating with verification teams to test desired functionality and corner cases.
Developing timing constraints, DFT insertion, and test coverage, and closing timing with physical design teams.
Well versed in Micro-Architecture and Block Ownership, Design from scratch.
The Impact You Will Have:
Enhancing the performance and reliability of high-speed serial interface PHY IPs.
Contributing to the development of cutting-edge technologies that power modern electronics.
Driving innovation in digital design and influencing the future of semiconductor technology.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver robust and high-quality designs.
Ensuring that Synopsys remains a leader in the semiconductor industry through continuous improvement and excellence.
Supporting customers by providing high-performance and reliable IP solutions that meet their needs.
What You’ll Need:
5-8 years of relevant experience in digital design for ASICs.
Strong knowledge of Verilog RTL design and microarchitecture.
Experience with timing constraints development and synthesis flow.
Proficiency in using Spyglass or similar tools for Lint/CDC/RDC.
Proficiency in scripting and automation using TCL, PERL, or Python.
Excellent debugging skills and attention to detail.
Who You Are:
A collaborative team player with strong communication skills.
A problem solver with a proactive approach to challenges.
A detail-oriented professional with a passion for innovation.
A self-motivated individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment.
An adaptable engineer who can handle multiple tasks and priorities.

You will be part of the High-Speed SerDes Digital Design Team, a group of talented engineers dedicated to developing high-performance serial link PHY IPs. With 4 to 10 years of hands-on software development experience, you have honed your skills in C++, data structures, and algorithms, and possess a strong foundation in electronic design automation (EDA) flows. Designing, developing, and troubleshooting the core VC-Static engine at the parser level, ensuring robustness and scalability.
Architecting and implementing object models for Verilog, SystemVerilog, and VHDL constructs to support advanced EDA tool capabilities.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams locally and globally to deliver seamless product integration and innovative features.
Developing state-of-the-art EDA tools by creating new and innovative algorithms focused on electronic design automation.
Contributing to the evolution of HDL parsers and maintaining high-quality production code on Unix/Linux platforms.
Leveraging your expertise in C++, data structures, and algorithm analysis to solve performance and scalability challenges.
Applying scripting skills in Tcl/Perl to automate workflows and enhance tool usability.

Enhance the capabilities and performance of Synopsys’ VC Platform, directly influencing industry-leading verification solutions.
Empower semiconductor companies to deliver high-quality products through improved static verification and analysis.
Facilitate the adoption of innovative methodologies and automation, reducing design errors and time-to-market.
Contribute to the global reputation of Synopsys as a leader in EDA innovation and customer satisfaction.
Mentor and collaborate with peers, fostering a culture of technical excellence and continuous learning.

4 to 10 years of software development experience with a strong emphasis on C++ programming.
Proficiency in data structures, algorithm analysis, and object-oriented design.
Solid understanding of ASIC design flow and EDA tools/methodologies.
Experience with Verilog, SystemVerilog, and VHDL hardware description languages.
Hands-on experience with scripting languages such as Tcl and Perl in Unix/Linux environments.
Familiarity with HDL parser development and production code deployment.
Knowledge of GenAI concepts is a plus.
Who You Are:
Self-motivated and self-disciplined, with a strong drive to achieve personal and team goals.
Quality-focused, with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to delivering robust software solutions.
Excellent problem-solving skills, able to tackle complex technical challenges with creativity and rigor.
Collaborative and communicative, thriving in diverse, global teams and open to feedback and learning.
Adaptable, proactive, and resilient in dynamic, fast-paced environments.

Job Description and Requirements
Alternate Job Titles:
Staff EDA Applications Engineer
Senior ASIC Application Consultant
AI-Enabled Design Solutions Engineer
Physical Design Application Specialist
Customer Success Engineer – Semiconductor
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are an accomplished and forward-thinking engineering professional with a deep passion for the intersection of artificial intelligence and semiconductor design. Your expertise spans RTL-to-GDSII flows, and you have hands-on experience with industry-leading EDA tools, especially those driving the next generation of AI and high-performance compute silicon. Analytical by nature, you dissect complex design challenges and architect robust, scalable solutions that address both immediate and future technology needs. You thrive in customer-facing roles, translating requirements into actionable methodologies and championing innovation every step of the way.
Dynamic and adaptable, you excel in fast-paced environments and communicate complex ideas with clarity and confidence. You bring a collaborative spirit and a strong command of English, facilitating seamless engagement with global teams and customers. Your educational background in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science is complemented by deep hands-on experience with EDA tools such as Design Compiler, IC Compiler II, and Fusion Compiler. You are motivated by technical excellence, customer success, and continuous learning. Your never-give-up attitude and global mindset empower you to support engagements across diverse geographies and technological domains. If you're passionate about pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in chip design and AI-driven innovation, Synopsys Bangalore is the ideal place to grow your impact.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Creating and optimizing design flows and solutions to meet aggressive PPA targets for high-frequency cores, automotive, and high-capacity AI/compute designs.
Collaborating cross-functionally with customers, R&D, and internal teams to drive innovative solution and feature development that anticipates and addresses real-world design challenges.
Utilizing scripting languages such as Perl and Tcl for automation and optimization tasks.
Staying updated with the latest advancements in ASIC design flow, VLSI, and CAD development to continually improve processes.
Delivering technical presentations, application notes, and best practices to both internal and external stakeholders, supporting knowledge-sharing and customer enablement.
Diagnosing customer issues, providing hands-on support, and ensuring successful deployment of Synopsys solutions in complex design environments.
The Impact You Will Have:
Driving innovations that contribute to the success of Synopsys' cutting-edge technologies.
Providing critical support that helps key customers overcome their PPA challenges.
Contributing to the development of new features that keep Synopsys at the forefront of the industry.
Improving the overall quality and reliability of our products through meticulous design and optimization.
Fostering strong relationships with global customers, reinforcing Synopsys' reputation as a leader in chip design and software security.
Driving Synopsys’ leadership in AI-powered EDA solutions, further differentiating our offerings in a competitive market.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field with 5+ years of relevant experience.
Deep understanding of RTL-to-GDSII flows and hands-on experience with backend P&R tools (Fusion Compiler, ICC2, or similar).
Expertise in physical synthesis, timing closure, clock tree synthesis (CTS), and routing at advanced technology nodes.
Proficiency in Tcl and Python scripting for automating EDA workflows and optimizing design methodologies.
Strong understanding of ASIC design flow, VLSI, and CAD development.
Who You Are:
Analytical thinker with a problem-solving mindset and a passion for continuous improvement.
Adaptable and eager to learn new technologies and methodologies.
Strong organizational skills, able to manage multiple projects and priorities with poise.
Detail-oriented with a focus on quality and performance.
Highly motivated and self-driven.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a dynamic and diverse Application Engineering team at Synopsys Bangalore, dedicated to driving customer success and innovation in AI-enabled design automation. The team partners closely with global customers, R&D, and product management to deliver state-of-the-art solutions for the most advanced silicon on the planet. We are passionate about pushing the boundaries of what's possible in chip design and software security, and we are looking for like-minded individuals to join us on this exciting journey.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a passionate and detail-oriented ASIC Digital Design professional who thrives in high-tech, fast-paced environments. With a strong foundation in Design-for-Testability (DFT) methodologies, you enjoy taking ownership of complex challenges and delivering reliable, high-quality results. You are eager to collaborate with diverse, global teams and are driven by a desire to continuously learn and grow within the semiconductor industry. Your expertise in scan insertion, ATPG, and scan STA is matched by your ability to adapt to new tools and technologies. You value open communication, inclusivity, and knowledge sharing, and you excel at translating intricate technical concepts into actionable solutions. As a proactive problem solver, you are comfortable navigating ambiguity and take pride in mentoring junior engineers while contributing to collective team success. You are committed to upholding Synopsys' culture of innovation, integrity, and excellence, and you are excited about building next-generation semiconductor products that fuel advances in AI, automotive, and beyond.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Lead and execute scan insertion and ATPG (Automatic Test Pattern Generation) flows for complex ASIC designs.
Work closely with RTL and Verification teams to ensure DFT requirements are integrated early in the design cycle.
Analyze and resolve DFT-related issues using tools such as Spyglass DFT, ensuring robust test coverage and manufacturability.
Perform scan STA (Static Timing Analysis) to validate timing closure and optimize testability paths.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement best practices for DFT methodologies and flows.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of automation scripts and design flows to boost efficiency and reduce turnaround time.
The Impact You Will Have:
Enhance the testability and reliability of cutting-edge ASIC products, reducing defect rates and improving time-to-market.
Drive innovation in DFT flows, setting new standards for quality and efficiency within the organization.
Enable successful silicon validation and ramp-up, directly contributing to customer satisfaction and business growth.
Represent Synopsys as a technical leader in the industry, influencing best practices and future technology directions.
Empower cross-functional teams by sharing expertise, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and collaboration.
Contribute to the development of next-generation technologies in AI, automotive, and other high-impact sectors.
What You’ll Need:
Extensive hands-on experience with DFT methodologies, including scan insertion and ATPG for complex ASIC designs.
Proficiency with industry-standard EDA tools such as Spyglass DFT and scan STA analysis suites.
Strong understanding of digital logic design, RTL coding, and verification principles.
Demonstrated ability to debug and resolve DFT-related issues across multiple project phases.
Solid scripting skills (e.g., TCL, Perl, Python) to automate design and test flows.
Who You Are:
Collaborative team player who communicates effectively across functions and cultures.
Proactive problem solver, comfortable with ambiguity and rapid change.
Detail-oriented and highly organized, with a commitment to delivering high-quality results.
Inclusive and open-minded, eager to share knowledge and mentor others.
Self-motivated and driven by curiosity, with a continuous learning mindset.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join a dynamic and innovative DFT team within Synopsys’ Engineering organization in Bangalore. The team is dedicated to advancing ASIC testability and reliability, working collaboratively with design, verification, and software groups across the globe. Our culture values technical excellence, mentorship, and cross-disciplinary innovation, providing opportunities to work on industry-leading products that power the next wave of intelligent systems.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

Job Description and Requirements
This is a 12-to-18-month contract position to be hired in our Markham or Nepean facilities working in the office 3 days weekly.
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a passionate analog/mixed-signal IC designer with strong academic credentials and hands-on experience in high-speed circuit development. You enjoy collaborating with diverse teams, thrive on technical challenges, and are eager to contribute to cutting-edge PAM4 SERDES IP. Detail-oriented and innovative, you value clear communication, rigorous design, and continuous learning in a fast-paced R&D environment.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Developing analog sub-block specs based on SerDes standards.
Refining circuit architectures for optimal power, area, and performance.
Designing and verifying circuits using advanced simulation tools.
Collaborating on physical layout to minimize parasitics and variation.
Presenting simulation data to peers and customers.
Documenting design features and test plans.
The Impact You Will Have:
Advance high-speed PAM4 SERDES IP for next-gen communication systems.
Contribute to Synopsys’ leadership in analog/mixed-signal IC technology.
Drive innovation in circuit design and architecture.
Deliver robust, reliable, and high-quality IP to customers.
Support a collaborative and knowledge-sharing team culture.
Ensure customer satisfaction through quality and documentation.
What You’ll Need:
MSc with 5+ years in analog IC design.
Expertise in transistor-level CMOS design and SerDes sub-circuits.
Experience with schematic, layout, and verification tools.
SPICE simulation and scripting (TCL, Python, MATLAB, etc.).
Strong communication and documentation abilities.
Who You Are:
Analytical, detail-oriented, and collaborative.
Excellent communicator and proactive learner.
Organized and quality focused.

A world-class R&D group specializing in high-speed analog and mixed-signal ICs, working with top tools and a diverse, supportive team.

Descriptions & Requirements
Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a seasoned analog design professional with a passion for pushing technology boundaries. With over a decade of hands-on experience in analog IC design, you thrive in fast-paced, collaborative environments and are motivated by technical challenges. Your expertise in Multi-Gbps NRZ & PAM4 SERDES IP and familiarity with the latest FinFET and gate-all-around process nodes set you apart as a leader in the field. You are adept at translating complex SerDes standards into innovative, high-performance circuit architectures and are comfortable navigating the intricacies of transistor-level design, system-level budgeting, and analog/digital co-design.
You excel at mentoring peers, sharing knowledge, and advocating for design excellence. Your strong analytical skills allow you to quickly identify architectural bottlenecks and propose effective solutions. You are detail-oriented, balancing deep technical focus with a strategic view of project goals and timelines. Communication is one of your strengths—whether presenting simulation data, documenting design features, or collaborating across multidisciplinary teams, you articulate complex ideas clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Beyond your technical expertise, you are committed to continuous learning and growth, staying abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies. You value diversity and inclusion, recognizing that great ideas come from a variety of perspectives. Your proactive and adaptable approach ensures you thrive in dynamic, innovative environments where your contributions drive meaningful impact.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Reviewing SerDes standards to develop novel transceiver architectures and detailed sub-block specifications.
Investigating and architecting circuit solutions that address performance bottlenecks, enabling significant improvements in power, area, and speed.
Collaborating with cross-functional analog and digital design teams to streamline design and verification processes for optimal efficiency and quality.
Overseeing and guiding the physical layout to minimize parasitics, device stress, and process variations, ensuring robust silicon performance.
Presenting and reviewing simulation data with internal teams and external stakeholders, including industry panels and customer reviews.
Documenting design features, test plans, and results, and consulting on electrical characterization and post-silicon analysis for product enhancements.
Analyzing customer silicon data to identify design improvement opportunities and proposing solutions for post-silicon updates.
The Impact You Will Have:
Drive innovation in high-speed analog/mixed-signal design, enabling next-generation connectivity solutions.
Shape the architectural direction of SERDES IP, influencing industry standards and future product offerings.
Enhance the performance, power efficiency, and reliability of Synopsys’ silicon IP portfolio.
Mentor and elevate the technical capabilities of team members, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous learning.
Directly contribute to successful customer deployments by addressing post-silicon challenges and ensuring robust field performance.
Strengthen Synopsys’ market leadership in advanced process nodes and high-speed communication technologies.
What You’ll Need:
MTech/MS with 4+ years or BTech/BS with 5+ years of practical analog IC design experience in Electrical or Computer Engineering (or related field).
Proven expertise with FinFET technologies and CMOS tape-outs.
Deep understanding of Multi-Gbps high-speed designs (PAM4, NRZ) and SERDES architectures.
Extensive design experience with SERDES sub-circuits (e.g., TX, RX, adaptive equalizers, PLL, DLL, BGR, regulators, oscillators, ADC/DAC).
Skilled in analog/digital co-design, calibration, adaptation, and timing handoff for optimized circuit performance.
Familiarity with ESD protection, custom digital design, and design for reliability (EM, IR, aging, self-heating).
Proficient with schematic entry, physical layout, design verification tools, and SPICE simulators.
Experience with scripting languages (TCL, PERL, MATLAB) for post-processing simulation results.
Understanding of system-level budgeting (jitter, amplitude, noise) and signal integrity (packaging, parasitics, crosstalk).
Excellent communication and documentation skills.
Who You Are:
Collaborative and open-minded, eager to share knowledge and learn from others.
Detail-oriented and thorough, with a commitment to delivering high-quality results.
Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving abilities and a proactive approach.
Excellent communicator, able to convey complex technical concepts clearly.
Adaptable and resilient in fast-paced, dynamic environments.
Committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative, and supportive workplace.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a world-class analog and mixed-signal R&D team at Synopsys, working alongside experts in high-speed IC design, verification, and CAD tool development. The team is collaborative, diverse, and passionate about innovation, with a focus on developing cutting-edge SERDES IP for advanced process nodes. You’ll have access to best-in-class design tools, mentorship, and opportunities for professional growth as you help shape the future of connectivity technology.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.
