Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a highly skilled and passionate engineer with extensive experience in quality management and manufacturing of high-speed digital and high-density electrical interconnect products. You thrive in environments where the stakes are high and the pace is fast, leveraging your expertise in connectors, cables, and PCBs to deliver robust solutions. Your background encompasses the full product lifecycle—from design concept and supplier selection to volume production and end-of-support. You bring a deep understanding of manufacturing processes such as stamping, injection molding, and electroplating, and are adept at driving supplier quality and industrialization initiatives.
You excel in cross-functional engineering teams, building strong relationships with suppliers and internal stakeholders to ensure consistent quality and process efficiency. Your analytical prowess allows you to swiftly identify trends and prioritize actions using engineering and data-driven methodologies like DOE and Lean 6 Sigma. You are detail-oriented, resourceful, and proactive, always seeking opportunities for improvement and innovation. Your communication skills enable you to bridge technical and business perspectives, ensuring that quality goals are understood and achieved across all levels of the organization and supply chain. You are excited by the opportunity to travel, collaborate globally, and make a tangible impact on the reliability and performance of Synopsys hardware systems.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Owning interconnect supplier quality and supply industrialization from initial design concept through volume production and end-of-support.
Leading DFx reviews and driving actions across multidisciplinary engineering teams and contract manufacturers/suppliers.
Driving suppliers to complete comprehensive part qualification deliverables, including FAIR, PFD, dFMEA, pFMEA, special process validations, Cpk studies, DFx, operational metrics, PPAP submission/approval, and capacity analysis.
Managing supplier industrialization processes—evaluating, selecting, qualifying, and certifying suppliers for volume production readiness.
Identifying and tracking quality KPIs, leveraging engineering and data-based processes like DOE and Lean 6 Sigma for continual improvement.
Rapidly identifying and managing quality excursions, ensuring clear communication and technical management within Synopsys and across the supply chain.
Analyzing complex quality data sets to detect trends, prioritize corrective actions, and collaborate with suppliers on improvements.
Overseeing supplier changes, including process optimization, facility updates, and new equipment qualification, ensuring compliance with PCN and PPAP approval processes.
Managing product specification changes and effective implementation at suppliers through the ECO change order process.
Disposing of discrepant material and driving CAPA initiatives, leading supplier improvement efforts in quality, cost, and production scalability.
Developing, implementing, and maintaining the Supplier Quality roadmap in partnership with the Global Commodity Management team.
Leading supplier audits and following up to ensure audit findings are resolved.
Traveling domestically and internationally (up to 50%) as required to support supplier and manufacturing operations.
Establishing and maintaining product specifications and quality standards.
The Impact You Will Have:
Guaranteeing the quality and reliability of Synopsys’ hardware systems through rigorous oversight of manufacturing and supplier quality processes.
Driving successful industrialization of supplier processes to achieve volume production, cost efficiency, and high product quality.
Facilitating effective cross-functional communication and collaboration, enabling smooth supply chain operations and rapid issue resolution.
Championing continuous improvement in supplier performance, fostering innovation, and elevating product reliability.
Supporting Synopsys’ mission to deliver cutting-edge technology by ensuring that interconnect products meet the highest standards of excellence.
Building strategic supplier partnerships that enhance cost, quality, and on-time delivery (OTD) metrics.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Industrial, Manufacturing, Mechanical, or Quality Engineering (Master’s degree preferred).
5+ years of experience in design, manufacturing, or supplier/product quality of complex high-speed interconnects.
Ability to read and interpret detailed mechanical drawings with GD&T and communicate technical information effectively.
Hands-on experience in mechanical assembly, fabrication, custom cable manufacturing, and quality assurance, including stamping, injection molding, assembly, and electroplating.
Expertise in data collection, data analysis, quality action plan presentation, 8D root cause analysis, and metric-driven improvement.
Proven proficiency with statistical improvement techniques such as DOE, Lean 6 Sigma, Cp, and CpK.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office suite, PLM software, statistical analysis tools, and other enterprise software platforms.
Who You Are:
Meticulous and detail-oriented, with a passion for solving complex problems.
Exceptional communicator, skilled at conveying technical information to diverse audiences.
Adaptable and resilient, thriving in dynamic and fast-paced environments.
Proactive and organized, able to juggle multiple priorities and projects.
Collaborative team player, fostering positive relationships within and outside the organization.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join a dedicated team responsible for the manufacturing, quality, and reliability of Synopsys’ hardware systems. The team’s mission is to uphold the highest standards of quality and efficiency in the production of interconnect products. Working closely with component suppliers, contract manufacturers, and distribution partners, you’ll help drive continuous improvement and innovation across manufacturing processes, contributing to Synopsys’ leadership in the industry.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

Sr. Staff Engineer-High Speed Interface Pre-Silicon Validation/Verification
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a driven and insightful Emulation Expert, passionate about pushing the boundaries of what's possible in ASIC digital design. With a deep understanding of IP interfaces--especially PCIe and DDR--you are skilled in leveraging advanced emulation platforms like Zebu to accelerate verification and product development. Your career is marked by a proven ability to deliver robust, production-ready IP through rigorous emulation and verification cycles. You thrive in highly collaborative, matrixed, and international environments, bringing together diverse teams and perspectives to solve complex challenges.
Your hands-on approach and proactive attitude make you a go-to resource for bridging gaps between Emulation IP and Design IP, ensuring seamless integration and verification of both Controller and PHY components. You have a keen eye for detail and are committed to right-first-time development, always ensuring traceability and completeness across verification requirements. You stay ahead of industry trends, standards, and evolving technologies, and are adept at translating these into actionable insights for your teams. As an excellent communicator and natural collaborator, you are comfortable working with multiple stakeholders and driving change within the organization. Your adaptability, resilience, and commitment to continuous learning set you apart as a leader in your field.
What You'll Be Doing:
* Bridging and closing gaps between the available or required Emulation IP feature set and the Design IP verification for all functions, spanning both Controller and PHY domains.
* Reporting key metrics and driving continuous improvement initiatives in Emulation IP quality and performance.
* Providing technical leadership and expertise to define requirements for Emulation IP, ensuring its correct implementation and deployment within verification strategies.
* Staying ahead of evolving industry standards, interpreting future changes, ECNs, and specification errata, and integrating this knowledge into Emulation and Design IP teams.
* Reviewing and validating test plans for both Emulation IP and Design IP, guaranteeing best-in-class function, feature coverage, and product quality.
* Collaborating cross-functionally to optimize workflows, standardize methodologies, and ensure compliance with organizational goals.
* Mentoring and guiding junior engineers, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.
The Impact You Will Have:
* Enhancing cross-functional collaboration to elevate product quality and end-customer satisfaction.
* Transforming the approach to Emulation IP usage in validating cutting-edge digital designs and system architectures.
* Driving innovation by defining and refining requirements for IP product development, particularly in emulation contexts.
* Championing the adoption of best-in-class verification methodologies across the organization.
* Standardizing and optimizing verification workflows to boost efficiency, traceability, and compliance.
* Influencing the next generation of emulation and verification solutions, positioning Synopsys as an industry leader.
* Accelerating time-to-market for high-performance silicon solutions through advanced emulation strategies.
What You'll Need:
* 8+ years of relevant experience in emulation, verification, or IP product development.
* Expert-level knowledge of PCIe/ DDR/ Ethernet interfaces, including protocol and verification strategies.
* Extensive hands-on experience with Zebu or similar emulation platforms, particularly for IP verification.
* Demonstrated track record in leading IP product development initiatives with a focus on emulation.
* Strong background in cross-functional collaboration, with an ability to drive consensus and deliver results.
* Outstanding communication skills, with the ability to influence and inspire change across diverse teams.
* Adaptability and comfort working in a fast-paced, matrixed, and international environment.
Who You Are:
* A proactive and collaborative problem-solver with a passion for excellence.
* Innovative thinker who embraces change and seeks out opportunities for continuous improvement.
* Strong communicator, able to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.
* Resilient and adaptable, thriving in dynamic environments and embracing new challenges.
* Committed to mentoring others and fostering an inclusive, team-oriented culture.
The Team You'll Be a Part Of:
You will join a dynamic, high-performing engineering team focused on IP development, emulation, and verification at the forefront of semiconductor innovation. Our team is collaborative, cross-functional, and globally distributed, working together to solve complex challenges and deliver industry-leading solutions. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with experts across multiple domains, drive impactful initiatives, and shape the future of digital design and verification at Synopsys.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, system verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
What You Will Be Doing
Responsible for modeling, simulating, analyzing signal and power integrity (SIPI), troubleshooting, and reviewing interfaces interconnect. This encompasses all aspects of physical interconnect in a system context, including silicon, package, pcb, connectors and components on multi-signal transmission line interfaces.
Performs, verifies, and documents interface SIPI analysis outcome as part of global chip design team.
Carry out experiments to validate modeling and methodologies.
Develop and document signal and power integrity requirements and flows for internal and external customer use.
What You Will Need
Possesses excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
Familiarity with both Windows and Linux operating system is required.
An understanding of basic circuit and transmission line theory is essential, as is familiarity with and a working knowledge of concurrent time and frequency-domain methods of analysis and characterization.
Knowledge on interface such as DDR (e.g. DDR5/4, LPDDR6/5X/5) is a plus, though PCIe (e.g. gen 6/5), UCIE, Ethernet, SATA, for example, can be leveraged.
Some experience in programming languages such as Python, TCL and Matlab is desired.
A working knowledge of circuit simulation tools such as Synopsys HSPICE is required. Experience with Ansys AEDT, Keysight ADS, etc. is a plus.
Practical experience with package and pcb design 3D electro-magnetic field solvers such as Ansys SiWave/HFSS, with proven ability to create models of usable bandwidth up-to 20GHz is preferred.
Has strong desires to learn and explore new technologies and demonstrates good analysis and problem-solving skills.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical or Electronics Engineering, with a minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in supporting interface IP product development (preferably DDR), system integration and Signal and Power verifications flow/methodologies.
The Impact You Will Have
You’ll use your ability to work across a multi-site team to communicate ideas, understand problems, and find solutions to create a leading-edge design.
You’ll collaborate on the development of advanced SI/PI modeling flows and system‑level verification methodologies, contributing to Synopsys’ leadership in high‑speed DDR interface IP.
You’ll strengthen the customer experience by ensuring functional correctness, physical feasibility, and seamless MSIP IP PHY integration.
You’ll proficiently support generating documentation, through discussions and written specifications within the team.
The Team You Will Be A Part Of
You will be joining a group of highly skilled, supportive, and globally spread-out team. Our team is dedicated to pushing the boundaries of technology, collaborating to develop high performance interface IP, defining SI/PI requirements and methodologies, and delivering innovative solutions to our customers. Together, we strive to achieve excellence in everything we do, fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment.

We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a visionary engineering leader with a passion for analog and mixed-signal integrated circuit design. You thrive in high-performance environments and are adept at inspiring, mentoring, and guiding talented teams. With a strong technical background in transistor-level circuit design and a deep understanding of advanced CMOS processes such as FinFET and GAA, you balance theoretical rigor with practical experience. Your expertise encompasses timing analysis, modeling, simulation, and verification, and you are comfortable navigating the complexities of high-speed SERDES IP development.
You are a collaborative communicator, able to translate complex technical concepts into actionable plans and clear recommendations for both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Your leadership style fosters inclusion, growth, and accountability, and you are committed to developing your team’s potential while ensuring the highest standards of design quality. You bring a hands-on approach, are familiar with industry-leading EDA tools, and are always looking to refine methodologies for greater efficiency and innovation. You embrace diversity, encourage open dialogue, and thrive in cross-functional, globally distributed teams. Your commitment to continuous learning and process improvement helps you and those around you stay at the forefront of technology. If you’re ready to lead, inspire, and deliver world-class analog solutions, we’d love to connect with you.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Direct and guide a team of engineers in characterizing timing, analyzing timing results, and generating timing models for high-speed SERDES IP.
Develop and continuously improve timing flow and methodologies to ensure exceptional efficiency and quality in deliverables.
Conduct thorough design reviews and evaluate final timing views and reports, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Present results of timing assessments and critical issue investigations, offering clear recommendations and actionable solutions.

We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
We develop complex soft IP across the HPC Controller space. With the standards evolving fast, each iteration doubling in IO speed, we need to invent new architectures to support the throughput increases of each new generation.
It is imperative that we release soft IP designs that are physically feasible. For this we run through real P&R projects for complex configurations and the design-implementation team iterate with the design team to drive improvements and ensure optimal customer experience while mapping our soft IP to ASIC technology
So physical DI feasibility needs to be part of production QA checks.
You Are:
You are a seasoned leader with a proven track record in hardening complex designs ready for tape-out. You are extremely experienced in driving timing closure, power optimizations, hierarchical flows, floor planning, clock tree strategies etc with Synopsys tool flows such as Fusion Compiler. You are skilled in project management and engagement with R&D to drive design and structural improvements to enable physical success. You are experienced in customer support to support customers implementing designs to their chosen tech nodes. You communicate with influence, foster accountability, and adapt quickly to change. Your expertise empowers teams to deliver impactful results.
What You’ll Be Doing
Leading a team of DI engineering executing several P&R projects on our HPC controller library
Ultimately accountable for physical feasibility sign-off of our HPC controllers
Developing with your team physical user guides
Supporting customers in their floorplan development and P&R
Building and evolving the team structure to match the capacity needs to successfully sign-off physical feasibility across HPC controllers
Assertively providing directions to design teams on design improvements required
Development of physical user guides for each product vertical following common template
Develop flows and sign-off criteria across the configuration space
Interfacing with methodology and EDA tooling teams to drive flow and methodology improvements
The Impact You Will Have:
Ensure all soft IP releases are physically feasibly with acceptable run times.
Improve the design readiness for DI targets.
Improve our customer experience around P&R of our soft IP.
Ensure that our delivered constraints are of high quality.
Foster a culture of collaboration between design and design-implementation teams.
Improving productivity across our development flows.
Build a culture of accountability and teamwork.
Provide actionable insights for leadership decisions.
What You’ll Need:
10+ years in leadership roles.
15+ years in P&R roles.
Proven operational and project management experience.
Outstanding communication and presentation skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Background in ASIC development.
Who You Are:
Strategic, proactive, and adaptable.
Collaborative and ethical.
Resilient and results oriented.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll work with a high-impact High-Performance-Compute leadership team focused on delivery of complex IP to the marketplace. You will lead a horizontal team across the HPC product verticals, with resources reporting to you inserted into each of these verticals.

Fluency in English, with strong verbal and written communication skills.

description_text:

Sr. Cybersecurity Engineer – Generative AI

Descriptions & Requirements
Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a seasoned cybersecurity professional with a passion for protecting cutting-edge AI technologies. Your expertise bridges deep technical security skills with a nuanced understanding of generative AI (GenAI) systems, architectures, and ethical frameworks. You thrive in dynamic, high-impact environments and are well-versed in emerging threats such as prompt injections, adversarial attacks, and data leakage in AI/ML infrastructures. You possess a strategic mindset, always looking ahead to anticipate risks and proactively design solutions that secure both corporate and customer-facing applications. Collaboration comes naturally to you; you work effectively with multidisciplinary teams, from AI researchers to cloud architects, and communicate complex concepts clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders alike. You are a mentor, dedicated to fostering a culture of responsible AI development and security awareness throughout the organization. As an adaptable and innovative thinker, you are motivated by the challenge of evolving threat landscapes and are relentless in your pursuit of excellence. If you are ready to make a tangible impact on the future of secure AI, Synopsys offers you a platform to lead, inspire, and grow.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Design and implement advanced security controls for AI/ML systems, focusing on threats unique to generative AI such as adversarial examples, prompt injections, and jailbreaks.
Conduct thorough threat modeling, vulnerability assessments, and red teaming exercises tailored to AI models, data pipelines, and supporting infrastructure.
Integrate security into every stage of the GenAI lifecycle, from data ingestion and model training to deployment and inference.
Monitor, detect, and respond to AI-specific security incidents including model inversion, membership inference, and supply chain vulnerabilities.
Collaborate closely with AI architecture, research, and engineering teams to evaluate new features and mitigate security risks in real-time.
Research and track emerging AI threats, contributing to the development of internal security tools, policies, and governance for responsible AI use.
Assist in shaping the enterprise AI strategy, ensuring robust security alignment with business objectives.
Create and document reusable AI security patterns, and develop AI-driven use cases to strengthen cybersecurity operations.
Evaluate, recommend, and implement best-in-class AI security tools and frameworks for Synopsys’ AI infrastructure.
Drive comprehensive threat modeling for AI/ML systems, addressing adversarial risks and emerging attack vectors.
The Impact You Will Have:
Significantly reduce risk exposure and strengthen resilience against AI-specific threats across Synopsys’ platforms.
Safeguard both corporate and customer-facing applications from sophisticated AI-driven attacks.
Enable business growth by ensuring compliance with industry and regulatory security standards throughout all AI initiatives.
Drive innovation by developing and deploying AI-driven security use cases that enhance Synopsys’ overall cybersecurity capabilities.
Influence the strategic direction of Synopsys’ enterprise AI security, shaping future investments and technology adoption.
Foster a security-minded culture through mentorship, training, and advocacy for responsible AI development practices.
What You’ll Need:
Advanced degree in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
Relevant industry certifications such as CISSP, CCSP, CEH, or specialized AI/ML security credentials.
Strong knowledge of product security concepts—data security and privacy, security engineering, open-source software security, and security assurance.
Deep understanding of security architecture, threat modeling, secure coding practices, and incident response for AI/ML environments.
Hands-on experience with machine learning algorithms, model training, data preprocessing, and end-to-end AI/ML pipelines.
Expertise in AI-specific threats: adversarial machine learning, model inversion, data poisoning, and evasion attacks.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, with experience in scripting for vulnerability scanning and security automation.
Strong familiarity with cloud security (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerized environments (Kubernetes, Docker).
Experience with security frameworks and standards relevant to AI (e.g., OWASP Top 10 for LLMs, NIST AI Risk Management Framework).
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills to convey technical concepts to diverse audiences.
Who You Are:
Strategic, forward-thinking, and innovative in approaching AI and security challenges.
Collaborative and effective working across multidisciplinary teams and with stakeholders at all levels.
Mentor and motivator, dedicated to developing high-performing teams and fostering a security-minded culture.
Critical thinker with strong analytical abilities and “outside the box” problem-solving skills.
Adaptable, independent, and proactive in addressing new and evolving risks.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join a pioneering team at the forefront of AI and cybersecurity innovation, dedicated to safeguarding Synopsys’ GenAI systems and infrastructure. The team’s core focus is to protect critical AI assets, drive secure AI development practices, and enable responsible and ethical AI adoption. Collaboration and knowledge sharing are integral to the team's culture, as is the commitment to continuous learning and advancement in the rapidly evolving field of AI security.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.
In addition to the base salary, this role may be eligible for an annual bonus, equity, and other discretionary bonuses. Synopsys offers comprehensive health, wellness, and financial benefits as part of a competitive total rewards package. The actual compensation offered will be based on a number of job-related factors, including location, skills, experience, and education. Your recruiter can share more specific details on the total rewards package upon request. The base salary range for this role is across the U.S.

BS, MS, or PhD in Electrical Engineering or related field.
Minimum 5 years (BS), 3 years (MS), or 0 years (PhD) of professional experience in an engineering software environment.
At least 2 years of hands-on experience with electromagnetic simulation tools such as Ansys Motor-CAD, Ansys Maxwell, or equivalent low-frequency electromagnetic finite element tools.
Expertise in optimization and design workflows for electric machines, including electromagnetic, thermal, and NVH analysis in high-tech sectors.
Knowledge of control integration and system modeling for e-motors and drivetrains.
Strong foundation in physics phenomena and simulation methods related to magnetic design, power loss, and efficiency.
Proficiency in scripting and workflow automation; Python experience highly preferred.
Logical problem-solving skills, excellent interpersonal and communication abilities, fluent in English.
Ability to travel domestically up to 10% of the time.

Collaborative and able to work effectively across multidisciplinary teams.
Strong communicator, able to translate technical concepts for diverse audiences.
Organized, detail-oriented, and adept at managing multiple projects simultaneously.
Customer-focused, with a professional image and strong business acumen.

Adaptable, enthusiastic about learning new technologies and sharing knowledge.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a seasoned engineering professional with deep expertise in timing signoff, design closure, and advanced semiconductor technologies. You thrive on solving technical challenges and have a strong history of hands-on experience with the latest technology nodes. Your background includes leading complex silicon chip projects, optimizing Power, Performance, and Area (PPA), and working collaboratively across teams to deliver innovative solutions. You’re passionate about enabling customer success, adept at diagnosing and resolving intricate issues, and have a talent for translating technical concepts for both engineering and management audiences. Your proactive approach, attention to detail, and strong scripting skills allow you to streamline workflows and drive faster design closure. You are excited by new product introductions and the opportunity to be a key technical partner from early release through customer adoption. Your communication and training abilities empower teams and clients to leverage best practices and maximize the value of Synopsys solutions. You’re driven by continuous learning, and you excel in dynamic, fast-paced environments where your ideas and expertise make a real impact.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Reviewing and analyzing customer and partner feedback to enhance product and solution performance.
Collaborating with R&D to shape technical roadmaps, specifications, and validation processes for product improvements.
Diagnosing, troubleshooting, and resolving complex technical issues on-site and remotely for customer installations.
Deploying product best practices and delivering technical training to internal and external stakeholders.
Supporting customer project execution using Synopsys STA, ECO, and design implementation solutions.
Partnering with customer technical managers and Sales to identify business challenges and deliver effective technical solutions.
Communicating product value and technical messaging at both engineering and management levels, including engaging product demos.
The Impact You Will Have:
Accelerate adoption and usability of Synopsys products by driving technical excellence and customer support.
Enable customers to achieve aggressive PPA targets and faster design closure in multi-die environments.
Reduce turnaround times for customer projects through innovative engineering techniques and best practices.
Enhance Synopsys’ reputation as a trusted partner in timing signoff and design closure across the industry.
Influence product development and roadmap by providing actionable feedback from real-world customer engagements.
Empower global teams and customers through knowledge sharing, training, and technical leadership.
What You’ll Need:
BS or MS in Electrical or Computer Engineering.
6-8 years of relevant experience in the semiconductor industry.
Hands-on expertise with Place & Route (P&R), extraction, Static Timing Analysis (STA), and Engineering Change Order (ECO) tools.
In-depth understanding of timing and physical constraint methodologies, parasitic annotation, and timing analysis for IC designs.
Experience with silicon chip project execution, physical design, timing closure, and optimizing PPA targets, especially on advanced technology nodes.
Strong scripting skills in TCL, Perl, and other relevant languages.
Comprehensive understanding of ASIC design flow, VLSI, and/or CAD engineering principles.
Who You Are:
Excellent communicator, able to convey complex ideas to technical and non-technical audiences.
Proactive and resourceful problem solver with a customer-first mindset.
Collaborative team player who thrives on innovation and knowledge sharing.
Detail-oriented, organized, and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Adaptable and eager to learn new technologies and methodologies.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join the ECO Field team at Synopsys in Bangalore, a highly skilled group focused on enabling customer success in timing signoff and design closure. The team partners with R&D, Sales, and technical managers to deliver industry-leading solutions, drive new product adoption, and address complex technical challenges. Together, you’ll foster innovation, build expertise, and help customers achieve their design goals faster and more efficiently.

With more than a decade of hands-on experience in package and interposer design, you possess a deep understanding of the latest advancements in 3DIC and multi-physics analysis. Your expertise spans across multiple advanced packaging technologies, and you are enthusiastic about pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in high-performance, energy-efficient chip design.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a passionate and innovative software developer driven by curiosity and a desire to solve complex real-world problems. With a strong background in Electro-Optical InfraRed (EO/IR) systems and a keen interest in simulation and mission modeling, you thrive in dynamic, collaborative environments where you can make a tangible impact. Your expertise in C++ and Visual Studio is complemented by a solid understanding of computer graphics, physics (especially radiometry), and mathematical principles. You have hands-on experience in the commercial software development lifecycle, ideally within aerospace and defense domains, and are comfortable working with advanced imaging systems, optics, and image processing.
Your approach to work is analytical and detail-oriented, always seeking out best practices and innovative solutions to technical challenges. You are a fast learner, eager to engage with subject matter experts and cross-functional teams, and value open communication and knowledge sharing. Your commitment to quality, reliability, and continuous improvement ensures that the products you help develop meet the highest standards. You are excited by the opportunity to support a globally recognized product like STK, contributing to projects that enable customers to achieve extraordinary feats, from satellite navigation to lunar exploration. Most importantly, you are motivated by a sense of purpose and a desire to be part of a company that values diversity, collaboration, and personal growth.
This position is based in Exton, PA and it is not eligible for immigration sponsorship.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Contributing as a core member of the capability development team, designing, developing, testing, and documenting new features for the STK software platform.
Investigating and resolving complex technical issues discovered by QA or product support, ensuring a robust and reliable user experience.
Championing and implementing best practices in commercial software development, with a focus on maintainability, scalability, and performance.
Working to reduce the backlog of existing bugs and driving architecture improvements for long-term product evolution.
Collaborating closely with multidisciplinary teams, including PhD-level experts in aerospace, imaging, radar, and related fields, to deliver innovative solutions.
Engaging in continuous learning and knowledge sharing, staying up-to-date with advancements in EO/IR systems, simulation techniques, and software engineering methodologies.
The Impact You Will Have:
Enhancing the capabilities and reliability of STK, a mission-critical tool used by thousands of organizations worldwide in aerospace, defense, and research.
Enabling customers to solve complex challenges such as communication link analysis, mission planning, and celestial navigation.
Accelerating the development of new features that expand the range of STK’s applications, from Earth observation to deep space missions.
Improving the user experience and confidence in STK through timely resolution of issues and proactive product improvements.
Contributing to a culture of technical excellence, innovation, and knowledge sharing within the team and across the organization.
Empowering future advancements in simulation and modeling that drive the next generation of aerospace and defense technologies.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field with 2 years' experience or Master's degree.
Strong proficiency in C++ and experience with Visual Studio development environments.
Solid understanding of computer graphics, physics (with an emphasis on radiometry), and mathematical modeling.
Experience with the commercial software development lifecycle, including design, implementation, testing, and documentation.
Familiarity with imaging systems, optics, detectors, electronics, and image processing techniques.
Simulation experience, particularly in aerospace and defense applications, is highly desirable.
Who You Are:
A collaborative team player who communicates effectively and values diverse perspectives.
Analytical, detail-oriented, and committed to delivering high-quality work.
Adaptable and eager to learn new technologies and methodologies quickly.
Proactive in seeking feedback and continuously improving both technical and interpersonal skills.
Motivated by curiosity, creativity, and a desire to make a real-world impact.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a dynamic, multidisciplinary team of engineers and scientists dedicated to advancing the capabilities of STK, Synopsys’ flagship mission modeling and simulation product. Our team thrives on collaboration, innovation, and a shared commitment to solving some of the most challenging problems in aerospace, defense, and research. Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
Our mission is to power innovation that drives human advancement. For over 50 years, our predictive simulation software has enabled companies to push the boundaries of technology in fields ranging from sustainable transportation and advanced semiconductors to satellite systems and life-saving medical devices. Join us and help power the next leap in human progress.
You Are:
You are a passionate and resourceful engineer, eager to make a measurable impact through technology. With a solid foundation in computer science or engineering, you thrive in collaborative, multidisciplinary environments and excel at transforming complex problems into elegant solutions. You bring hands-on experience in C++ and C#, and are comfortable navigating challenging codebases. Your curiosity drives you to keep pace with the latest in software engineering, especially as it relates to physical modeling and simulation.
You have a keen eye for detail and a relentless commitment to quality, always seeking ways to optimize, debug, and refine your code. You understand the importance of teamwork, open communication, and mutual respect, and are motivated by the opportunity to learn from and contribute to a talented group of peers. You value inclusivity and recognize that diverse perspectives drive better outcomes.
As someone who enjoys tackling moderate-to-complex development tasks, you know how to balance independent problem-solving with collaborative solution-building. You are enthusiastic about developing software that supports real-world applications such as thermal and fluids analysis, and are comfortable working remotely while staying connected to a global team. Your adaptability and drive for continuous improvement make you an ideal fit for Synopsys’ innovative culture.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Designing, implementing, and maintaining capabilities for Thermal Desktop product focused on system-level thermal and fluids analysis.
Engaging in moderate-to-complex development tasks, including coding, testing, documentation, and integration.
Troubleshooting, debugging, and optimizing code to ensure performance, scalability, and maintainability.
Collaborating with managers, technical leads, and fellow engineers to refine solutions and ensure seamless integration across teams.
Delivering efficient, readable code that meets project timelines and quality standards.
Staying current with best practices in software engineering and continually expanding expertise in thermal and fluids modeling.
Contributing to engineering simulation applications, such as Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and thermal/fluids network modeling.
The Impact You Will Have:
Accelerate the development of advanced simulation tools used across industries, from aerospace to healthcare.
Enable customers to optimize product designs for efficiency, safety, and sustainability.
Support the creation of innovative solutions that power next-generation technologies.
Help Synopsys maintain its leadership in engineering simulation and predictive modeling.
Drive improvements in software performance, scalability, and reliability that benefit users worldwide.
Foster a culture of technical excellence and collaboration within a globally distributed team.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field (with 2+ years of relevant experience), or a Master’s degree in a related field.
2+ years of hands-on experience in C++ and C#, with strong proficiency in these languages.
Familiarity with the Fortran programming language.
Solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and debugging techniques.
Ability to quickly grasp complex systems and work effectively within a team environment.
Proven track record of delivering high-quality work within deadlines.
Preferred: Experience with distributed processing systems, optimization, and .NET framework.
Preferred: Development experience with physical design or analysis tools, multi-physics modeling, computer graphics, and geometry processing.
Who You Are:
Analytical and detail-oriented, with a passion for solving complex technical problems.
Collaborative team player who values open communication and diverse perspectives.
Adaptable and eager to learn new technologies and approaches.
Self-motivated, proactive, and committed to continuous improvement.
Inclusive, respectful, and supportive of colleagues from all backgrounds.
Effective at managing time, priorities, and multiple tasks in a remote work environment.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a dynamic, innovative Research & Development team at Synopsys, focused on building world-class engineering simulation software. Our team brings together talented engineers, technical leads, and managers who collaborate across disciplines to deliver high-impact solutions for customers worldwide. We foster a culture of technical excellence, creativity, and continuous learning, supporting each other to achieve our shared mission of powering innovation and human advancement.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings, such as an annual bonus, equity, and other discretionary bonuses. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
Synopsys is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace where talented people of every background can thrive. We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

As the #1 provider of Electronic Design Automation (EDA) solutions, Synopsys is the market leader in Hardware-Assisted Verification (HAV), accelerating the logic simulation of complex systems. Our Bangalore R&D center is a hub of talented engineers pushing the boundaries of HAV for ever-increasing design sizes.
You Are:
You are a passionate and inventive engineer eager to tackle complex technical challenges at the forefront of silicon design. You thrive in collaborative, fast-paced environments and have a deep curiosity for how things work. Your solid foundation in C++ programming and discrete algorithms enables you to quickly analyze problems and architect solutions that scale. You find joy in optimizing logic, mapping technology, and understand the nuances of timing in digital systems. You are comfortable with multi-threading and distributed computing concepts, and always looking for ways to accelerate and optimize workflows. Communication is your strength—you articulate ideas proactively and succinctly, making you a valued team member and a trusted resource. You see feedback as an opportunity to grow and are driven by an intrinsic motivation to deliver world-class EDA solutions. Your ability to balance technical depth with strategic thinking helps you anticipate future challenges and propose innovative solutions. Above all, you are committed to making an impact, contributing to projects that redefine what’s possible in hardware verification and logic optimization.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Designing and developing advanced algorithms for logic optimization and technology mapping in EDA tools.
Implementing high-performance C++ code to accelerate simulation and verification workflows.
Collaborating with multidisciplinary engineering teams to refine HAV solutions for increasingly complex designs.
Integrating multi-threading and distributed computing techniques to improve scalability and performance.
Analyzing system bottlenecks and proposing innovative solutions for faster hardware-assisted verification.
Actively participating in code reviews, knowledge sharing sessions, and technical discussions.
Engaging with global stakeholders to understand user requirements and deliver impactful solutions.
The Impact You Will Have:
Accelerate verification processes for industry-leading semiconductor companies worldwide.
Enable customers to realize larger and more complex digital designs through optimized HAV technology.
Drive improvements in chip design productivity and reliability, influencing the next generation of smart devices.
Contribute to patented innovations and performance breakthroughs in EDA software.
Enhance the scalability of Synopsys’ HAV solutions, supporting diverse customer needs and applications.
Strengthen Synopsys’ leadership in the semiconductor industry through continuous technical excellence.
What You’ll Need:
Proven expertise in C++ programming, including advanced language features and performance optimization.
Strong understanding of discrete algorithms, especially graph theory and data containers.
Experience or familiarity with technology mapping, logic optimization, and timing analysis.
Knowledge of multi-threading and distributed computing architectures.
Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze and resolve complex technical challenges.
Who You Are:
An effective communicator—clear, proactive, and succinct in both written and spoken interactions.
A collaborative team player, eager to learn and share knowledge with others.
Detail-oriented and quality-driven, always striving for excellence in deliverables.
Adaptable and resilient, able to thrive in a dynamic, fast-changing environment.
Customer-focused, with a passion for delivering impactful solutions that address real-world needs.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
Join a high-performing team of engineers dedicated to designing cutting-edge technologies in logic optimization and hardware-assisted verification. You’ll work alongside experts in EDA, software engineering, and hardware design, collaborating on challenging projects that drive Synopsys’ leadership in the industry. Our Bangalore team values innovation, continuous learning, and a supportive culture where everyone’s contributions are recognized.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

With a track record of steering large, multidisciplinary teams, you excel at navigating complex technical landscapes and driving innovation. Your expertise in analog IC architecture and hands-on experience with transistor-level circuit design sets you apart as a subject matter expert, especially in high-speed IO, DDR, and HBM interfaces. You are motivated by the opportunity to make a significant impact—enhancing team efficiency, influencing product strategy, and delivering innovative solutions that shape the future of semiconductor technology. Partnering with leadership and peers to continuously update design methodologies in response to evolving technical requirements.
Leading the adoption and integration of AI technologies into engineering workflows to drive innovation and operational efficiency.
Strategically managing resources across a large, mixed talent pool—including full-time staff and contractors—spanning 10+ parallel projects.
Collaborating independently and with design teams to conduct rapid studies of design issues, evaluating solutions and trade-offs.
Driving cross-functional initiatives across analog, digital, layout, and hardware domains to develop novel solutions to technical challenges.
Providing mentorship, technical direction, and strategic guidance to multi-level, multi-discipline engineering teams.

Significantly improving the execution efficiency of the memory interface analog IP team.
Delivering measurable improvements in performance, power, and area (PPA) for key product lines.
Enhancing Synopsys' reputation as a global leader in analog and mixed-signal design innovation.
Contributing to customer success by providing state-of-the-art solutions that address their unique needs.
Expanding Synopsys’ portfolio of intellectual property via patents, technical publications, and thought leadership.

MSc or PhD in Electrical Engineering or related field, with 15+ years of practical analog IC design system architecture experience.
Deep expertise in transistor-level circuit design and strong CMOS design fundamentals.
Extensive hands-on experience with sub-circuits relevant to high-speed IO, DDR, and HBM interfaces.
Demonstrated experience leading multi-level, multi-discipline engineering teams.
Proficiency in managing large-scale, parallel projects and driving cross-functional collaboration.
Who You Are:
An innovative thinker with a passion for technology and continuous improvement.
A collaborative team player who thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
An outstanding communicator with strong presentation and documentation skills.
A detail-oriented problem solver who can navigate and resolve complex technical challenges.
A leader who inspires and influences through expertise, vision, and empathy.
A lifelong learner committed to staying current with industry advancements and emerging technologies.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a passionate and driven Physical Design Engineer with a strong foundation in RTL2GDSII flows and a proven ability to independently own and deliver complex designs. With at least 5 years of hands-on experience in advanced technology nodes such as 7nm, 5nm, or even 3nm, you thrive in fast-paced, innovative environments and are eager to tackle new technical challenges. Your expertise spans the entire physical design spectrum—from synthesis, place & route, and clock tree synthesis (CTS) to timing optimization, static timing analysis (STA), timing closure, EMIR, and physical verification. You have experience in both block-level and full-chip floor-planning, and you’re adept at navigating timing constraints and closing timing on aggressive schedules. Your toolset includes industry-leading Synopsys solutions like Design Compiler, IC Compiler II, and PrimeTime, allowing you to deliver optimal results for high-frequency, low-power designs.
Beyond your technical skills, you are a collaborative team player who communicates effectively across global teams, valuing diversity of thought and experience. You are motivated by problem-solving, have a keen analytical mindset, and are always seeking opportunities to automate and optimize workflows using Python, PERL, TCL, or other scripting languages. You take ownership of your work and pride yourself on delivering high-quality, robust solutions that drive organizational success. If you are excited about contributing to leading-edge silicon design and want to make a tangible impact, Synopsys is the place for you.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Independently own and drive full RTL2GDSII physical design implementation for advanced process nodes (7nm/5nm/3nm), ensuring successful tape-outs.
Execute synthesis, place & route, clock tree synthesis (CTS), timing optimization, and static timing analysis (STA) to meet stringent performance and power targets.
Perform block-level and full-chip floor-planning, physical verification, EMIR analysis, and timing closure activities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across geographies to resolve complex design challenges and ensure design quality and schedule adherence.
Utilize and optimize Synopsys EDA tools, including Design Compiler, IC Compiler II, and PrimeTime, to deliver state-of-the-art silicon solutions.
Develop and maintain automation scripts in Python, PERL, TCL, or other relevant languages to streamline design flows and improve efficiency.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of design methodologies and best practices, sharing insights and mentoring junior engineers as needed.
The Impact You Will Have:

We’re looking for a collaborative, innovative leader to join our Digital IP Subsystems Team and help accelerate the Era of Smart Everything.
Why Join Us?
Work on industry-leading silicon IP and subsystem solutions that impact millions worldwide Lead and inspire high-performing, cross-functional teams, collaborate with talented engineers in a culture that values diversity, inclusion, and creativity.   Make a difference by delivering differentiated products faster and with reduced risk

You have strong, hands-on technical experience and thrive on rolling up your sleeves to solve complex challenges

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a dedicated and detail-oriented engineer with a passion for unraveling the complexities of high-speed, mixed-signal circuits. You thrive in collaborative environments, working seamlessly with diverse teams to overcome technical challenges and achieve shared goals. Your strong theoretical foundation is complemented by extensive hands-on experience in silicon validation, and you excel in both designing and implementing test methodologies that push the boundaries of what’s possible.
You are adaptable and resourceful, eager to tackle new problems and continually expand your technical repertoire. Your curiosity drives you to stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in validation technologies, and you are comfortable navigating the fast-paced, ever-evolving landscape of semiconductor innovation. Whether you’re analyzing intricate data sets, designing custom test hardware, or troubleshooting in the lab, you approach each task with meticulous attention to detail and an unwavering commitment to quality and reliability.
You communicate effectively, translating complex technical findings into actionable insights for colleagues and customers alike. Your organizational skills ensure that your projects run smoothly from conception through to completion, and your enthusiasm for hands-on lab work is matched by your drive to mentor and share knowledge with others. If you’re eager to make a tangible impact on the next generation of high-speed silicon solutions, we want you on our team.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Collaborating with cross-functional teams—including analog and systems designers, applications engineers, and customers—to resolve technical challenges and demonstrate leading-edge product performance.
Analyzing and characterizing circuit behavior and limitations in both silicon validation and characterization environments.
Developing and executing comprehensive test plans to ensure products meet rigorous standards and protocol specifications.
Specifying, sourcing, and implementing advanced test equipment and components to support innovative test methodologies.
Generating detailed test reports, meticulously documenting results, methodologies, and recommendations for internal and external stakeholders.
Designing and developing custom test boards and hardware solutions to facilitate robust product validation and evaluation.
Debugging and troubleshooting electronic circuits, investigating and resolving product non-conformance issues to ensure top-tier quality.
The Impact You Will Have:
Ensuring the delivery of high-performance, reliable silicon IP solutions that power next-generation technologies.
Driving continuous improvement in product quality and compliance with industry standards.
Accelerating time-to-market for cutting-edge mixed-signal IP by streamlining validation and verification processes.
Strengthening Synopsys’ reputation as an industry leader through exceptional technical execution and customer support.
Identifying and resolving critical bottlenecks in product development, leading to more robust and scalable solutions.
Contributing to a culture of innovation and knowledge sharing within the R&D team.
What You’ll Need:
Master’s degree in Electrical or Electronics Engineering (or equivalent field).
Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in post-silicon validation, lab instrumentation, characterization, and debug.
Strong knowledge of analog and mixed-signal circuit design and operation, including familiarity with ADC/DAC and SerDes architectures.
Proficiency in software programming (such as MatLab and Python) for test automation and comprehensive data analysis.
Demonstrated expertise in using advanced lab equipment (BERTs, oscilloscopes, VNAs, TDRs) for high-speed circuit validation.
Experience in schematic entry, PCB design, and layout as well as data analysis, data review, and data mining for test results.
Knowledge of signal integrity and power integrity principles, and familiarity with PAM-4 signaling test and debug.
Who You Are:
An analytical thinker with a passion for hands-on problem solving and continuous learning.
Proactive, adaptable, and eager to take on new challenges in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
Excellent communicator, capable of conveying complex technical details to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Collaborative team player who thrives on cross-functional teamwork and knowledge sharing.
Detail-oriented, with a commitment to delivering high-quality results and driving process improvements.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a high-performing R&D team based in Mississauga, renowned for its expertise in high-speed, mixed-signal IP development and validation. Our team is dedicated to technical excellence, continuous innovation, and collaborative problem-solving. Working closely with analog and systems designers, applications engineers, and customers, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the next generation of advanced silicon solutions. Our culture emphasizes mentorship, knowledge sharing, and professional growth, ensuring that every team member has the support and resources needed to thrive.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

Job Description and Requirements
You Are:
You are an accomplished technical leader with over 15 years of hands-on experience in semiconductor Signal and Power Integrity (SI/PI). Your expertise spans the full breadth of interface IP development and system-level implementation, making you a go-to authority for complex SI/PI challenges. You thrive in collaborative, global environments, and your track record shows a consistent ability to deliver strong results in multi-stakeholder settings. As an expert in high-speed interfaces, you are adept at defining product and interface requirements, guiding advanced SI/PI methodologies, and providing clear, actionable design support to customers.
You possess a unique blend of technical depth and customer empathy, enabling you to bridge the gap between engineering teams and client needs. Your system-level SI/PI knowledge encompasses silicon PHYs, packaging, and PCB integration, allowing you to proactively identify and resolve bottlenecks in leading-edge designs. You are passionate about mentoring junior engineers and fostering a culture of innovation within your organization. Your communication skills—both written and verbal—are exceptional, ensuring clarity and alignment across diverse teams and customers. Driven by a desire to see both your team and customers succeed, you are ready to take ownership of complex technical projects and make a lasting impact on the future of technology.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Driving innovation in high-speed interface DDR IP products, facilitating the development of cutting-edge solutions and SI/PI methodologies.
Enhancing customer satisfaction by providing expert SI/PI support and guidance for interface IP integration at both pre- and post-sales stages.
Supporting management decisions by delivering in-depth insights into technical challenges, SI/PI methodologies, tool requirements, and customer needs.
Mentoring and developing junior talent within the engineering design organization, nurturing the next generation of technical leaders.
Fostering a collaborative and innovative R&D environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and continuous improvement.
Defining SI/PI requirements and methodologies for high-performance interface IP, ensuring seamless integration from silicon to system level.
The Impact You Will Have:
Lead complex technical projects with clear ownership and accountability, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery in multi-stakeholder environments.
Drive the development of advanced SI/PI modeling flows and system-level verification methodologies, reinforcing Synopsys’ leadership in high-speed DDR interface IP.
Strengthen the customer experience by ensuring functional correctness, physical feasibility, and seamless MSIP IP PHY integration across platforms.
Influence company strategy by providing actionable insights into emerging SI/PI trends and industry best practices.
Elevate the technical capabilities of the organization through mentorship, training, and the introduction of innovative methodologies.
Promote cross-functional collaboration, aligning engineering, product, and customer support teams to deliver exceptional value to Synopsys’ clients.
What You’ll Need:
Proven expertise in signal and power integrity for high-speed interfaces, including mixed-signal design and off-chip system signaling.
Deep experience with SI/PI modeling, analysis, debugging, and tools such as Ansys Nexxim/HFSS/SiWave and Synopsys PrimeSim Hspice (Keysight ADS is a plus).
Exceptional communication, organization, risk assessment, and time management skills, with the ability to abstract and communicate actionable conclusions.
Strong documentation skills for generating and supporting written specifications and effectively communicating them within design teams and to external customers.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical or Electronics Engineering, with a minimum of 15 years of relevant experience in supporting interface IP product development (preferably DDR), system integration, and SI/PI verification flows and methodologies.
Who You Are:
Collaborative technical leader who thrives in global, cross-functional teams.
Excellent communicator, able to distill complex technical topics for varying audiences.
Innovative thinker with a passion for mentoring and developing others.
Empathetic, customer-focused, and dedicated to delivering impactful solutions.
Proactive problem-solver who demonstrates ownership and accountability in all aspects of work.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join a highly skilled, supportive, and globally distributed team dedicated to pushing the boundaries of technology in interface IP. Our team collaborates to develop high-performance solutions, define SI/PI requirements and methodologies, and deliver innovative results to our customers. We foster a culture of excellence, inclusivity, and shared success, where every team member’s contributions are valued.
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, system verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a motivated and talented Junior Engineer with a passion for high-speed communication systems and a strong foundation in electrical engineering principles. You have a solid understanding of control theory, stochastic processes, and probability theory, and you possess programming skills in MATLAB or Python. Your analytical and problem-solving abilities are top-notch, and you excel in a collaborative environment where teamwork and communication are key.
With a keen interest in SerDes technology, you are eager to develop and refine models, automate processes, and contribute to the design and validation of cutting-edge ICs. You are curious, innovative, and ready to tackle the challenges inherent in high-speed data communication. Your background may include hands-on experience with SerDes design or modeling, knowledge of machine-learning techniques, and familiarity with high-speed data communication standards and protocols.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Develop and refine analog and mixed-mode SerDes models.
Automate model extraction and correlation procedures.
Perform channel simulations to validate model accuracy.
Identify optimal model structures for new scenarios.
Document modeling processes and results for internal and external stakeholders.
Collaborate with the R&D team to design and validate high-speed communication systems.
The Impact You Will Have:
Enhance the performance and reliability of our SerDes products.
Contribute to the development of high-speed communication solutions for various markets, including Mobile, Automotive, Cloud Computing, HPC, AI, and Storage.
Drive innovation in chip-to-chip communication technology.
Support the optimization and verification of designs before tapeout.
Help Synopsys maintain its leadership in the semiconductor industry.
Foster collaboration and knowledge sharing within the system architecture team.
What You’ll Need:
M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering.
Strong knowledge of control theory and its application to electrical engineering.
Proficiency in stochastic processes and probability theory applied to electrical engineering.
Programming skills in MATLAB or Python.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Who You Are:
Innovative and curious, with a passion for learning and development.
A strong communicator and team player.
Detail-oriented and methodical in your approach to problem-solving.
Adaptable and able to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Committed to excellence and continuous improvement.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join our innovative and multidisciplinary system architecture team, where we are at the forefront of high-speed SerDes technology. Our team works on cutting-edge ICs up to 64Gbps, both in NRZ and PAM4 modulation formats. We collaborate closely to develop and refine SerDes models, optimize designs, and ensure the highest performance and reliability of our products. Together, we drive innovation in the semiconductor industry and shape the future of high-speed communication systems.

We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

Descriptions & Requirements
Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are an experienced analog circuit designer with a passion for solving complex engineering challenges and advancing high-speed connectivity technology. You thrive in dynamic, collaborative environments and are motivated by working at the forefront of semiconductor innovation. Your expertise spans the full spectrum of analog and mixed-signal design, and you’re adept at translating SerDes standards into robust, high-performance IP blocks. You are comfortable working across disciplines, bridging the gap between analog, digital, and layout teams, and you bring a proactive approach to problem-solving and continuous improvement.
You are detail-oriented, methodical in your approach, and always eager to share your knowledge and mentor others. You value teamwork, diversity, and open communication, recognizing that a variety of perspectives leads to better solutions. You are committed to delivering quality, reliable silicon, and you possess the adaptability required to respond to evolving technology and customer needs. Your technical leadership and hands-on expertise make you a trusted resource for your peers and a driving force behind successful product development at Synopsys.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Reviewing SerDes standards to define and develop analog sub-block specifications for Multi-Gbps NRZ & PAM4 SERDES IP.
Identifying, evaluating, and refining circuit architectures to optimize for power, area, and performance.
Proposing and implementing design and verification strategies using advanced simulation tools to ensure robust and high-quality designs.
Overseeing physical layout efforts, focusing on minimizing parasitics, device stress, and process variation for high-speed circuits.
Presenting simulation results and design data for peer and customer reviews, facilitating collaborative problem-solving and design validation.
Documenting design features, test plans, and technical justifications to support internal and external stakeholders.
Consulting on electrical characterization and proposing solutions for post-silicon design updates within SerDes IP products.
The Impact You Will Have:
Enable the development of next-generation high-speed connectivity solutions used in advanced computing, networking, and AI applications.
Drive innovation in analog and mixed-signal design, contributing directly to Synopsys’ leadership in silicon IP for FinFET process nodes.
Improve product quality and reliability through meticulous design, verification, and documentation practices.
Mentor and support junior engineers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and technical excellence.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver integrated solutions that meet demanding customer requirements.
Advance the scalability and performance of SerDes IP, enhancing Synopsys’ reputation as a trusted technology partner.
Shape the future of semiconductor technology by contributing to industry standards and best practices.
What You’ll Need:
BE + 10 years / MTech + 8 years of relevant experience in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related fields.
Deep expertise in transistor-level circuit design and sound CMOS design fundamentals.
Hands-on design experience with at least two SerDes sub-circuits (e.g., equalizers, samplers, drivers, serializers, deserializers, PLLs, DLLs, bandgap reference, ADC/DAC).
Familiarity with ESD design techniques, custom digital design for high-speed logic paths, and reliability-focused design (EM, IR, aging).
Proficiency in schematic entry, physical layout, and design verification tools; experience with SPICE simulators and Verilog-A modeling.
Knowledge of scripting languages such as TCL, Perl, C, Python, or MATLAB is highly desirable.
Who You Are:
Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communicator, capable of presenting complex technical concepts clearly to diverse audiences.
Collaborative team player who values diversity, inclusion, and sharing knowledge.
Adaptable and eager to learn, with a proactive approach to challenges.
Committed to quality, reliability, and continuous improvement.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join a fast-growing analog and mixed-signal R&D team at Synopsys, dedicated to developing high-speed, cutting-edge IP in the latest FinFET technologies. Our team brings together experts in analog, digital, and software/CAD design, fostering an environment of innovation, collaboration, and technical excellence. You’ll have access to state-of-the-art IC design tools, custom in-house solutions, and the support of experienced colleagues who are passionate about advancing semiconductor technology.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

With a robust background in Static Timing Analysis and hands-on experience with Synopsys PrimeTime, you thrive in collaborative environments where cross-functional teamwork is key. Recommend and drive improvements in implementation and validation processes, leveraging feedback from field teams and customers.
Provide technical recommendations, diagnose and troubleshoot issues, and propose solutions to ensure product readiness for deployment.
Conduct risk assessments and develop mitigation strategies to address potential validation challenges.

Prepare and present detailed validation reports to multi-functional teams and management.
Demonstrate meticulous attention to detail and accuracy in all validation activities.

Enable customers to deploy cutting-edge chip designs with confidence, accelerating their time-to-market.
Drive continuous improvement in validation processes, raising the standard of product excellence across teams.
Reduce customer-reported issues by proactively identifying and addressing potential product weaknesses.
Foster collaboration between engineering, product, and field teams, ensuring alignment on quality and customer needs.
