Deep domain expertise in Static Timing Analysis, with practical experience in Synopsys PrimeTime.
Proficiency in timing analysis, ECO flows, Extraction, power analysis, SDC constraints, advanced OCV concepts, derates, PBA timing, distributed and hierarchical STA flows, and/or physical design closure.
Strong debugging skills, with the ability to quickly identify and resolve complex technical issues.
Advanced software and scripting abilities, including Perl, Tcl, and Python.
A Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or related field with at least 5 years of relevant experience, or a Master’s degree with a minimum of 3 years’ professional experience.
Who You Are:
Self-motivated and proactive, with a drive to achieve excellence in product quality.
Collaborative and inclusive, thriving in diverse, cross-functional teams.
Analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail and a methodical approach to problem-solving.
Effective communicator, able to convey complex technical concepts to a variety of stakeholders.
Adaptable and resilient, embracing change and seeking continuous improvement.

Together, you’ll tackle complex technical challenges, drive process improvements, and set new benchmarks in product excellence.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are an accomplished analog and mixed-signal design engineer, passionate about pushing the boundaries of high-speed interface technology. With a strong foundation in Electrical, Electronics, or VLSI Engineering, you have hands-on expertise in custom analog circuit design, particularly in the nanometer CMOS domain. You thrive in collaborative, cross-functional environments, drawing energy from working with talented colleagues across the globe. Your analytical mindset, attention to detail, and relentless pursuit of quality drive you to deliver robust, high-performance solutions that meet demanding specifications.
You have a keen interest in the latest advancements in high-speed SERDES and PHY IP, and you are adept at translating complex requirements into innovative circuit architectures. Your experience with simulation, verification, and layout optimization enables you to create designs that are not only functional but also efficient in terms of power, area, and performance. You excel at communicating technical concepts, documenting your work, and engaging in peer reviews. Above all, you are motivated by the opportunity to make a tangible impact on next-generation technologies that power the smart, connected world.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Designing and developing high-speed analog and mixed-signal (AMS) circuit macros, including analog front-end transceivers, voltage/current-mode drivers, PLLs, DLLs, regulators, equalizers (CTLE, FFE, DFE), impedance calibrators, serializers/deserializers, VCOs, phase interpolators, bandgap references, CDR circuits, and injection-locked loops for High-Speed PHY IP in planar and FinFET CMOS technologies.
Collaborating with global teams to architect, simulate, and verify high-performance circuits that adhere to SERDES standards and meet stringent power, area, and performance goals.
Developing and refining circuit implementations, leveraging advanced simulation tools to ensure robust functionality and manufacturability.
Overseeing the physical layout process to minimize parasitic effects, device stress, and process variation, ensuring first-time-right silicon.
Presenting simulation data, analysis, and design decisions in both internal peer reviews and external customer engagements.
Documenting design features, test plans, and collaborating on the electrical characterization and validation of your circuits within the SERDES IP product portfolio.
Contributing to the continuous improvement of design methodologies, verification strategies, and best practices within the team.
The Impact You Will Have:
Enable the development and delivery of industry-leading high-speed PHY IP that powers global innovations in data centers, networking, storage, and consumer electronics.
Accelerate customers’ time-to-market by providing robust, optimized analog circuit solutions that meet or exceed performance targets.
Ensure the highest quality and reliability of silicon products, directly contributing to Synopsys’ reputation for excellence.
Drive technological advancements in analog and mixed-signal design, influencing future product roadmaps and industry standards.
Mentor and collaborate with fellow engineers, fostering a culture of technical excellence and continuous learning.
Represent Synopsys’ commitment to innovation and customer success in both technical forums and client interactions.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree (BE) plus 3+ years or Master’s degree (MTech) plus 2+ years of relevant experience in mixed-signal analog/custom circuit design, preferably in Electrical/Electronics/VLSI Engineering.
Strong expertise in CMOS circuit design fundamentals, device physics, layout, parasitic extraction, and SPICE simulation for nanometer technologies.
Experience in designing multi-Gbps high-speed circuits and familiarity with specs such as PCIe, Ethernet, SATA, and USB.
Proficiency in full custom design of high-speed datapaths using digital/CMOS logic cells, and in verifying timing margins with advanced simulation tools.
Knowledge of ESD and latchup design verification, crosstalk analysis, and the impact of mixed-signal integration on circuit performance.
Who You Are:
Detail-oriented with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for solving complex technical challenges.
Collaborative team player who thrives in multicultural, cross-site environments.
Effective communicator, able to clearly articulate technical concepts to peers, management, and customers.
Self-motivated, proactive, and committed to delivering high-quality results within tight timelines.
Adaptable and eager to learn, keeping pace with rapid technological advancements in the semiconductor industry.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join the High-Speed SERDES Analog Design team, a diverse group of talented engineers dedicated to developing world-class analog and mixed-signal IP. Working closely with digital, layout, and verification specialists, you’ll collaborate across global Synopsys sites, leveraging collective expertise to deliver innovative solutions that set industry benchmarks.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

With more than 15 years of hands-on experience, you thrive in dynamic environments and possess a deep understanding of high-speed protocol design and verification. Lead and mentor a team of design and verification engineers, ensuring high performance and professional growth.

Collaborate closely with architects, designers, and VIP teams to deliver robust, functionally correct designs.
Identify design issues, propose corrective actions, and resolve inconsistencies in documented functionality.
Champion best practices in verification, continuously improving methodologies and execution efficiency.
Support customer issues through in-depth reproduction and analysis, delivering timely resolutions.
Balance multiple priorities and projects, adapting to new challenges and requirements as they arise.

Elevate team capabilities through mentorship, fostering a culture of learning and technical excellence.
Drive innovation in verification methodologies, enhancing product reliability and reducing time-to-market.
Facilitate seamless cross-functional collaboration, bringing together diverse expertise for superior outcomes.
Strengthen Synopsys’ reputation as a leader in ASIC verification and IP integration.
Deliver fully verified designs that empower customers and partners to build groundbreaking products.
Shape the strategic direction of verification practices, influencing industry standards and best practices.
What You’ll Need:
Extensive experience (15+ years) in ASIC design and verification, with a focus on high-speed protocols.
Strong proficiency in Verilog, VHDL, and/or SystemVerilog for hardware design and verification.
Hands-on knowledge of verification methodologies such as UVM, including environment architecture and coverage analysis.
Experience with scripting languages (BASH, TCSH, PERL, PYTHON, TCL) for automation and workflow optimization.
Proven ability to manage and lead high-performing engineering teams in fast-paced environments.
Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Who You Are:
An inclusive leader who values diverse perspectives and fosters a collaborative team environment
Effective communicator, skilled in both written and verbal English
Proactive and adaptable, comfortable with multitasking and shifting priorities.
Mentor and coach, dedicated to developing junior engineers and sharing expertise
Driven by curiosity and a desire to learn new technologies and methodologies.
Organized, reliable, and committed to delivering the highest quality results.

You will join a forward-thinking engineering team at Synopsys in Noida, dedicated to advancing ASIC verification for next-generation silicon solutions. The team is composed of talented engineers and technical leaders who work collaboratively across design, architecture, and verification functions. Our focus is on delivering fully verified, high-performance designs that set new industry benchmarks. You are a relationship-driven technical professional who thrives on solving complex challenges and building lasting partnerships. Your background in engineering and deep understanding of simulation software enable you to connect with customers at every level, from technical teams to C-suite executives. You excel at listening to client needs, translating business goals into actionable technical strategies, and delivering exceptional customer experiences. Establishing and nurturing long-term, sustainable relationships with key automotive industry clients, serving as the single point of contact for all technical activities.
Collaborating with the Enterprise Account Manager to identify, plan, and prioritize strategic technical activities aimed at expanding Synopsys’ footprint within customer accounts.
Mapping customer technical requirements to Synopsys solutions, leveraging your expertise to address both immediate and future needs.
Coordinating resources across technical, training, and consulting teams globally to execute account growth plans and deliver exceptional customer experiences.
Driving technology adoption and proliferation campaigns, including leading account-based marketing strategies and steering committees.
Ensuring seamless communication between customers, Synopsys development teams, and support managers to resolve defects, address enhancement requests, and maintain high-quality standards.
Advising on opportunity qualification, leading technical campaigns for complex engagements, and supporting market sizing initiatives.
Representing Synopsys in industry working groups, committees, and at key customer and partner meetings to drive strategic solutions and foster industry leadership.
The Impact You Will Have:
Deepening customer trust and satisfaction by serving as a reliable partner and advocate for their technical needs.
Expanding Synopsys’ presence within the automotive segment through strategic account development and solution alignment.
Driving adoption of advanced engineering tools and methodologies that accelerate customer innovation and competitiveness.
Facilitating cross-functional collaboration between Synopsys and customer teams, ensuring successful project delivery and technology integration.
Enhancing Synopsys’ value proposition by identifying and capitalizing on opportunities to displace competition, introduce new products, and scale solutions globally.
Championing customer feedback to inform product enhancements and influence Synopsys’ technology roadmap.
Shaping industry standards and best practices through active participation in industry committees and working groups.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering or a related field (BS+12, MS+10, or PhD+7 years of experience minimum).
Expertise in engineering software environments, with demonstrated use of Ansys or other commercial CAE, CAD, EDA, or PLM tools.
Deep understanding of the automotive industry, including its main drivers, ecosystem, and technical challenges.
Fluency in both German and English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong organizational, time management, and project coordination abilities, with a readiness to travel domestically up to 25% (and up to 50% preferred).
Experience interacting with senior business managers and C-level executives in technical contexts.
Proficiency in building and leading cross-functional teams across multiple global sites.
Who You Are:
A strategic thinker with business acumen and a passion for customer success.
Collaborative, adaptable, and comfortable working in fast-paced, multinational environments.
Logical problem-solver who approaches challenges with creativity and resilience.
An effective communicator, able to distill complex technical information for diverse audiences.
Driven, proactive, and results-oriented, with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
Committed to continuous learning, professional growth, and fostering innovation.

You will join a high-impact, customer-focused engineering team dedicated to supporting the automotive industry’s digital transformation. Together, we champion innovation, share knowledge, and work toward common goals in a supportive, inclusive environment.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a passionate and experienced Field Application Engineer who thrives at the intersection of advanced technology and customer success. Your deep technical expertise in semiconductor library characterization, coupled with a strong understanding of modern EDA flows, makes you a trusted advisor to customers and colleagues alike. You excel in collaborative environments, enjoy tackling complex challenges, and are known for your ability to translate intricate technical concepts into actionable solutions for diverse audiences. Your proactive approach and curiosity drive you to stay ahead of industry trends, and you eagerly share your knowledge through training, documentation, and thought leadership. As a natural communicator, you build strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels and are comfortable representing your team at industry events and technical forums. Your hands-on experience with advanced process nodes, scripting for automation, and troubleshooting technical issues ensures you can deliver high-impact support and guidance. Above all, you are dedicated to continuous learning, personal growth, and making a positive impact on both customer outcomes and the broader technology ecosystem.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Serve as the primary technical interface for strategic customers leveraging PrimeLib for advanced library characterization and modeling.
Provide expert guidance on integrating PrimeLib into diverse EDA flows, ensuring optimal performance and accuracy.
Lead product demonstrations, evaluations, and proof-of-concept projects that showcase PrimeLib’s capabilities in real-world scenarios.
Assist customers in optimizing PrimeLib usage for various different technologies nodes including cutting-edge process nodes such as 3nm and 2nm technologies.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical challenges related to timing, power, and signal integrity modeling.
Collaborate with R&D and product teams to influence the PrimeLib roadmap, advocating for customer needs and emerging technology trends.
Develop and deliver technical training, best practices, and documentation to empower both customers and internal teams.
Represent Synopsys and PrimeLib at industry conferences, technical forums, and customer workshops.
The Impact You Will Have:
Accelerate customer adoption and success with PrimeLib, directly influencing the design of next-generation semiconductor products.
Drive technical excellence and innovation by bridging customer requirements and R&D advancements.
Enhance Synopsys’ reputation as a trusted technology partner and thought leader in library characterization and EDA solutions.
Shape the evolution of PrimeLib by capturing and relaying key customer insights to product development teams.
Facilitate knowledge sharing and best practices that elevate the capabilities of customers and colleagues alike.
Promote the adoption of advanced semiconductor process technologies through expert technical support and guidance.
Build lasting relationships with Tier-1 semiconductor companies and industry leaders.
What You’ll Need:
BS/MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field (PhD preferred).
8+ years of experience in semiconductor design, library characterization, or EDA application engineering.
Strong background in timing, power, variation, and signal integrity analysis for standard cell libraries.
Hands-on expertise with characterization tools such as PrimeLib, Liberate, or SiliconSmart, and SPICE simulators.
Advanced scripting skills (Python, Perl, TCL) for automation and flow customization.
Familiarity with advanced process technologies, variation modeling, and Liberty format (including LVF/CCS/CCSN/CCSP models).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with a proven ability to present complex technical concepts to varied audiences.
Who You Are:
A collaborative team player who excels in cross-functional environments and values diverse perspectives.
Detail-oriented, analytical, and resourceful problem-solver with a passion for tackling technical challenges.
Strong communicator who can build trust and rapport with customers, partners, and internal stakeholders.
Adaptable and eager to learn, with a growth mindset and commitment to continuous improvement.
Customer-focused and proactive, always striving to deliver exceptional service and solutions.
Comfortable with ambiguity and able to thrive in fast-paced, dynamic settings.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join a dynamic, high-impact Customer Application Services team focused on enabling customer success with Synopsys’ PrimeLib product. Our team works closely with R&D, product management, and global customers to deliver technical excellence, foster innovation, and drive the adoption of industry-leading library characterization solutions. We value open communication, knowledge sharing, and a collaborative spirit that empowers each member to make meaningful contributions.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a passionate and highly skilled engineer with deep expertise in Design-for-Test (DFT) RTL coding and pattern generation, backed by more than a decade of hands-on experience. You thrive in collaborative, cross-functional environments, working seamlessly with R&D teams, customers, and product managers to develop and deploy robust silicon lifecycle management solutions. Your technical proficiency spans DFT domain standards such as IEEE 1149.1, 1687/1500, SCAN, ATPG, and MBIST methodologies, and you bring a strong understanding of flow automation using TCL.
You possess a keen analytical mind, enabling you to dissect micro-architecture, debug complex issues, and optimize test coverage and silicon health monitoring throughout the product lifecycle. Your experience in customer-facing roles allows you to confidently guide and educate clients, translating their requirements into actionable solutions and ensuring their success. You value continuous learning, keeping up with the latest industry advancements, and actively contributing to the development of next-generation SLM IPs and solutions.
Interpersonal skills, clear communication, and a proactive attitude define your approach. You are adept at multitasking and thrive in multi-site, global teams. You are motivated by the opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, making meaningful contributions to the field of high-performance silicon and driving innovation at scale.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Collaborating closely with world-class R&D teams to develop and deliver end-to-end Silicon Lifecycle Management (SLM) solutions for a diverse customer base.
Engaging directly with customers to capture detailed requirements and translate them for robust product development.
Validating SLM solutions internally and in customer environments to ensure quality and reliability prior to deployment.
Driving the deployment and seamless execution of SLM solutions in customer projects, ensuring successful adoption and performance.
Enabling customers to leverage silicon health monitoring throughout the lifecycle, from bring-up and validation to in-field operations.
Automating DFT flows using TCL and supporting post-silicon bring-up activities in collaboration with tester teams.
Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support to both internal teams and customers.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a passionate and resourceful software engineer with a strong background in systems-level programming, eager to solve complex challenges in software security and licensing. You thrive in environments where innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning are valued. Your curiosity drives you to keep pace with the latest advancements in software security, cryptography, and licensing technologies, and you’re motivated by opportunities to make impactful contributions to cutting-edge products. You bring a meticulous attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and robustness in everything you build. Comfortable balancing multiple demands in a fast-paced setting, you are self-driven, proactive, and adept at using sound judgment to deliver results. You have a natural ability to break down intricate problems, design state-of-the-art solutions, and communicate your insights clearly with your peers. You are committed to excellence, always striving for high performance, reliability, and customer satisfaction in your work. You’re excited to be part of a team that values collaboration, diversity, and shared success, and you’re ready to help set new standards in software security for Synopsys and its global customers.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Designing, developing, and maintaining core licensing and security modules for Synopsys products, ensuring seamless operation across diverse Unix environments.
Implementing and supporting new releases of the Synopsys Common Licensing code, from initial concept through to deployment and ongoing support.
Identifying and formulating key technical challenges in software security and licensing, and developing innovative, robust solutions to address them.
Debugging complex internal and external issues related to licensing, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to drive resolutions.
Staying updated on current trends in licensing technologies, software security, cryptography, and cloud-native architectures, and applying this knowledge to enhance Synopsys products.
Contributing to the establishment of common licensing standards across all Synopsys products, helping to prevent software piracy and ensure compliance.
Participating in code reviews, knowledge sharing, and mentoring activities within the team to foster continuous improvement and technical excellence.
The Impact You Will Have:
Enable Synopsys to deliver unified and secure licensing solutions across its expansive product portfolio, enhancing customer experience and trust.
Drive the development of robust, high-performance software that safeguards Synopsys’ intellectual property from unauthorized use and piracy.
Streamline licensing processes for both internal teams and external customers, reducing support costs and improving operational efficiency.
Advance the state of Synopsys' security infrastructure by introducing modern, scalable solutions that keep pace with industry trends.
Empower engineering and product teams to innovate rapidly by providing reliable, adaptable licensing frameworks.
Play a key role in ensuring compliance and supporting customer acclimation to new licensing models and technologies.
What You’ll Need:
2-7 years of software development experience, with a focus on C/C++ systems-level programming on Unix platforms.
Strong understanding of Unix signals, multi-threading, synchronization mechanisms, socket programming, Unix system calls, and debugging tools.
Proficiency in Unix shell scripting and scripting languages such as Python and Perl.
Solid grasp of data structures, algorithms, and software design principles.
Experience working with multiple variants of Unix and developing portable, robust code.
Bonus: Experience in application security, cryptography, assembly programming, or developing with FLEXlm or similar licensing frameworks.
Bonus: Familiarity with UI/UX web development frameworks, cloud-native application design (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), and database technologies (NoSQL, relational, distributed).
Who You Are:
Analytical and detail-oriented, with a knack for problem-solving and debugging complex technical issues.
Quick learner, adaptable to new technologies and evolving requirements.
Effective communicator, able to articulate technical concepts to diverse audiences.
Collaborative team player who values diversity, inclusion, and knowledge sharing.
Self-motivated, proactive, and resilient in the face of challenges.
Driven by a commitment to quality, security, and customer satisfaction.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join Synopsys’ core Licensing R&D team, a diverse and highly skilled group dedicated to developing, maintaining, and innovating licensing and security solutions for all Synopsys products. This team is instrumental in establishing common licensing standards, detecting and preventing software piracy, and ensuring seamless customer experiences. Collaboration and knowledge sharing are at the heart of how we work, and you’ll have ample opportunity to influence the future of software security at Synopsys while growing your own technical expertise.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Job Description and Requirements
You Are:
You are a passionate, detail-oriented Senior Software Engineer with a drive to build solutions that seamlessly bridge hardware and software. You thrive in environments where cross-disciplinary collaboration leads to breakthrough products, and you possess a deep curiosity for how things work at the signal and protocol level. Your technical expertise is matched by your ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and to mentor others, fostering a culture of learning and innovation.
You are not just a coder—you are a systems thinker. You understand the nuances of embedded software, appreciate the intricacies of hardware bring-up, and excel at debugging challenging integration issues. You embrace the fast pace of high-tech development, welcome ambiguous challenges as opportunities to innovate, and take pride in delivering robust, scalable solutions. You believe in continuous improvement, leveraging automation and modern development practices to drive efficiency and quality.
Above all, you are energized by working with talented people who share your commitment to excellence. You value diversity of thought and perspective, enjoy exchanging ideas, and are motivated by the prospect of seeing your work enable next-generation PCIe IP and test chips. If you’re excited to shape the future of high-speed silicon solutions, this is the place for you.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Design, develop, troubleshoot, and debug software programs focused on evaluation tools for PCIe IP and test chips on Synopsys evaluation boards.
Create software tools, APIs, and components that support evaluation, validation, and performance analysis for PCIe solutions.
Collaborate cross-functionally with hardware, firmware, and software teams to develop and debug both software and hardware.
Implement test suites, diagnostic tools, and automation to validate PCIe protocol compliance, performance, and reliability.
Support user interface and API development for evaluation and debugging of PCIe IP features.
Analyze hardware-software interactions, troubleshooting issues, and assisting in root-cause analysis across board, chip, IP, protocol, and software layers.
Pre-test Software Evaluation Kits, preparing evaluation boards for demos, and providing technical support during customer demonstrations.
Design and deploy novel automation solutions (including CI/CD) to improve software development and release flows.
The Impact You Will Have:
Empowering customers and internal teams to rapidly evaluate and deploy next-generation PCIe IP solutions.
Enabling robust validation flows that ensure performance, reliability, and protocol compliance.
Accelerating hardware bring-up and troubleshooting, reducing time-to-market for cutting-edge silicon products.
Driving innovation in evaluation and automation tools, shaping best practices for the industry.
Supporting customer success through technical expertise and hands-on demonstration support.
Enhancing Synopsys's reputation as a leader in high-speed IP and evaluation technology.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree with 3+ years of related experience, or a Master’s degree with at least 1 year of relevant experience.
Proficiency with version control systems such as Git.
Strong familiarity with CI/CD concepts and workflows.
Expertise in Python, C++, or similar languages, with experience in embedded, driver, or system-level software development.
Experience using and interpreting results from lab instrumentation (e.g., BERTs, oscilloscopes) for high-speed signal validation and analysis.
Understanding of test automation, software revision control, continuous integration, protocol analyzers, and lab measurement tools.
Demonstrated ability to debug and resolve hardware/software integration issues.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
Preferred
: Experience developing evaluation software or test automation frameworks for high-speed IP, knowledge of signal integrity, compliance testing, and PCIe ecosystem tools, and experience supporting board bring-up or evaluation processes.
Who You Are:
Innovative problem-solver who thrives in cross-functional environments.
Strong communicator, able to articulate technical concepts and collaborate across disciplines.
Detail-oriented and methodical, with a commitment to quality and continuous improvement.
Proactive learner who embraces new technologies and practices.
Team player who values diverse perspectives and fosters an inclusive culture.
Customer-focused, dedicated to delivering practical solutions and exceptional support.
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
The Team You’ll Be Part Of:
You’ll join a highly skilled, collaborative team dedicated to developing the evaluation software that enables customers and internal engineers to assess Synopsys’s latest PCIe IP and test chips using cutting-edge evaluation boards. Our team is passionate about architecting and delivering robust, high-performance software tools that facilitate hardware bring-up, protocol validation, and performance analysis for next-generation PCIe solutions. We thrive on innovation, technical excellence, and a shared commitment to shaping the future of silicon design and verification.
Rewards & Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.
In addition to the base salary, this role may be eligible for an annual bonus, equity, and other discretionary bonuses. Synopsys offers comprehensive health, wellness, and financial benefits as part of a competitive total rewards package. The actual compensation offered will be based on a number of job-related factors, including location, skills, experience, and education. Your recruiter can share more specific details on the total rewards package upon request. The base salary range for this role is across the U.S.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
The Fluids Business Unit (FBU) is at the forefront of simulation technology, powering products like Ansys Fluent, Ansys CFX, and Ansys TurboGrid. Our team pioneers advanced meshing algorithms, enabling engineers to solve the most complex turbomachinery and fluid dynamics challenges. We foster a collaborative, inclusive, and dynamic environment where every team member’s voice is valued.
You Are:
You are a passionate and driven R&D Engineer with a strong foundation in software engineering and a keen interest in computational geometry, mesh generation, or numerical methods. You thrive on solving challenging technical problems and are excited by the opportunity to help develop industry-leading simulation tools that impact a broad range of industries, from aerospace to energy. Your programming skills, particularly in C++, Python, and object-oriented design, are matched by your curiosity and desire to learn new technologies and approaches. You are an effective communicator, able to work well within a geographically distributed team, and you value collaboration, knowledge sharing, and diversity of thought. You take pride in rigorous, high-quality work and are motivated by seeing your contributions directly influence cutting-edge products used by engineers worldwide. Adaptable and resourceful, you embrace new challenges and seek out opportunities to innovate and improve. Whether you are collaborating with QA, supporting customers, or designing the next generation of meshing algorithms, you bring a proactive, solutions-focused mindset and a genuine enthusiasm for advancing technology. If you are looking for a role where your technical expertise, creativity, and teamwork will help shape the future of simulation software, we encourage you to join us at Synopsys.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Designing, implementing, and maintaining advanced meshing algorithms for simulation models used in Ansys TurboGrid and related products.
Participating in all stages of the software development lifecycle, including requirements gathering, prototyping, coding, testing, and documentation.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including QA, product support, and other development groups, to ensure robust and high-quality product releases.
Engaging in defect verification and resolution, ensuring that solutions meet customer expectations and performance criteria.
Understanding and translating market requirements, such as target environments and competitive benchmarks, into technical solutions and product features.
Staying up to date with advances in computational geometry, numerical methods, and meshing technology to continuously improve our product offerings.
Contributing to code reviews, design discussions, and knowledge sharing sessions within the team.
The Impact You Will Have:
Empowering engineers and scientists worldwide with cutting-edge meshing tools that enable accurate and efficient simulation of complex turbomachinery systems.
Driving continuous improvement in simulation software performance, scalability, and usability, directly impacting customer success.
Helping Synopsys maintain its leadership position in computational fluid dynamics (CFD) and engineering simulation software markets.
Reducing time-to-market for customers by delivering innovative, reliable, and easy-to-use meshing solutions.
Strengthening the technical capabilities of the Fluids Business Unit through your expertise and collaborative spirit.
Contributing to the development and maintenance of flagship products used across a wide range of industries, from energy to aerospace.
Building and nurturing a diverse and inclusive team culture that values innovation, learning, and mutual support.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field with at least 2 years’ experience, or a Master’s degree.
Solid programming skills in C++ and Python, with a strong understanding of software design and development principles.
Experience with mesh generation algorithms, computational geometry, or numerical methods.
Familiarity with CAD systems, CAD topology, and geometry basics.
Working knowledge of GUI toolkits such as QT and experience in large-scale commercial software development environments.
Who You Are:
An effective communicator with strong interpersonal skills.
Collaborative and open-minded, able to work effectively within a distributed team.
Proactive and eager to learn, with a willingness to take on new challenges and share knowledge.
Detail-oriented and committed to producing high-quality, reliable software solutions.
Resourceful, adaptable, and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join the Ansys TurboGrid team within Synopsys’ Fluids Business Unit—a group of dedicated R&D professionals focused on advancing meshing technology for world-class simulation products. Our team values innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement. We work closely with colleagues across development, QA, and product support, and are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone’s contributions are recognized and valued.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a passionate and innovative software developer driven by curiosity and a desire to solve complex real-world problems. With a strong background in Electro-Optical InfraRed (EO/IR) systems and a keen interest in simulation and mission modeling, you thrive in dynamic, collaborative environments where you can make a tangible impact. Your expertise in C++ and Visual Studio is complemented by a solid understanding of computer graphics, physics (especially radiometry), and mathematical principles. You have hands-on experience in the commercial software development lifecycle, ideally within aerospace and defense domains, and are comfortable working with advanced imaging systems, optics, and image processing.
Your approach to work is analytical and detail-oriented, always seeking out best practices and innovative solutions to technical challenges. You are a fast learner, eager to engage with subject matter experts and cross-functional teams, and value open communication and knowledge sharing. Your commitment to quality, reliability, and continuous improvement ensures that the products you help develop meet the highest standards. You are excited by the opportunity to support a globally recognized product like STK, contributing to projects that enable customers to achieve extraordinary feats, from satellite navigation to lunar exploration. Most importantly, you are motivated by a sense of purpose and a desire to be part of a company that values diversity, collaboration, and personal growth.
This position is based in Exton, PA and it is not eligible for immigration sponsorship.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Contributing as a core member of the capability development team, designing, developing, testing, and documenting new features for the STK software platform.
Investigating and resolving complex technical issues discovered by QA or product support, ensuring a robust and reliable user experience.
Championing and implementing best practices in commercial software development, with a focus on maintainability, scalability, and performance.
Working to reduce the backlog of existing bugs and driving architecture improvements for long-term product evolution.
Collaborating closely with multidisciplinary teams, including PhD-level experts in aerospace, imaging, radar, and related fields, to deliver innovative solutions.
Engaging in continuous learning and knowledge sharing, staying up-to-date with advancements in EO/IR systems, simulation techniques, and software engineering methodologies.
The Impact You Will Have:
Enhancing the capabilities and reliability of STK, a mission-critical tool used by thousands of organizations worldwide in aerospace, defense, and research.
Enabling customers to solve complex challenges such as communication link analysis, mission planning, and celestial navigation.
Accelerating the development of new features that expand the range of STK’s applications, from Earth observation to deep space missions.
Improving the user experience and confidence in STK through timely resolution of issues and proactive product improvements.
Contributing to a culture of technical excellence, innovation, and knowledge sharing within the team and across the organization.
Empowering future advancements in simulation and modeling that drive the next generation of aerospace and defense technologies.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field with 2 years' experience or Master's degree.
Strong proficiency in C++ and experience with Visual Studio development environments.
Solid understanding of computer graphics, physics (with an emphasis on radiometry), and mathematical modeling.
Experience with the commercial software development lifecycle, including design, implementation, testing, and documentation.
Familiarity with imaging systems, optics, detectors, electronics, and image processing techniques.
Simulation experience, particularly in aerospace and defense applications, is highly desirable.
Who You Are:
A collaborative team player who communicates effectively and values diverse perspectives.
Analytical, detail-oriented, and committed to delivering high-quality work.
Adaptable and eager to learn new technologies and methodologies quickly.
Proactive in seeking feedback and continuously improving both technical and interpersonal skills.
Motivated by curiosity, creativity, and a desire to make a real-world impact.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a dynamic, multidisciplinary team of engineers and scientists dedicated to advancing the capabilities of STK, Synopsys’ flagship mission modeling and simulation product. Our team thrives on collaboration, innovation, and a shared commitment to solving some of the most challenging problems in aerospace, defense, and research. You’ll have the opportunity to work alongside industry experts and contribute to a product that is trusted by organizations around the world.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.
In addition to the base salary, this role may be eligible for an annual bonus, equity, and other discretionary bonuses. Synopsys offers comprehensive health, wellness, and financial benefits as part of a competitive total rewards package. The actual compensation offered will be based on a number of job-related factors, including location, skills, experience, and education. Your recruiter can share more specific details on the total rewards package upon request. The base salary range for this role is across the U.S.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
Ansys Government Initiatives (AGI), part of Synopsys, is at the forefront of Digital Mission Engineering (DME) for space systems. Our team builds and supports ODTK (Orbit Determination Tool Kit), a powerful product enabling highly accurate orbit estimation from real or simulated tracking data. ODTK is trusted by engineers and mission planners throughout the mission lifecycle—from design to operations—making critical impacts in aerospace, defense, and research sectors.
This position is based in Exton, PA and it is not eligible for immigration sponsorship.
You Are:
You are a passionate and driven software developer eager to make a real-world impact in the field of space systems and digital engineering. Your curiosity pushes you to explore the intricacies of orbital mechanics and trajectory optimization, and your commitment to excellence ensures the creation of robust, reliable, and innovative software solutions. With a background in computer science, engineering, or a related discipline, you thrive in collaborative, high-performing teams where your ideas and expertise help shape mission-critical products.
You are motivated by the opportunity to solve challenging problems, working alongside subject matter experts and leveraging modern development tools. You bring a growth mindset, continuously seeking to expand your knowledge in both domain-specific areas and software engineering best practices. Your adaptability and eagerness to learn make you a valuable contributor to an agile team, and you take pride in writing clean, efficient code that stands up to rigorous testing and real-world applications. You communicate effectively, value diverse perspectives, and foster an inclusive environment where everyone is empowered to innovate. Above all, you desire to play a key role in advancing the future of space exploration and digital mission engineering.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Design, develop, test, and document new features for the ODTK product, enhancing its capabilities for mission planning and operations.
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to integrate advanced algorithms and optimize software performance.
Investigate and resolve issues identified by QA or product support, delivering timely and effective solutions.
Apply and promote best practices in commercial software development, including code reviews, version control, and continuous integration.
Contribute to backlog reduction by addressing existing bugs and implementing architecture improvements.
Engage with PhD-level experts to understand complex requirements and translate them into robust software implementations.
Participate in agile development cycles, providing feedback and ideas to continually improve team processes and product quality.
The Impact You Will Have:
Directly enhance the accuracy and reliability of orbit determination for critical space missions.
Enable engineers and mission planners to make informed decisions using advanced modeling and simulation tools.
Accelerate the development of innovative features that support both government and commercial customers in the aerospace sector.
Contribute to the reduction of technical debt, improving the long-term stability and scalability of our software products.
Foster a culture of excellence and continuous improvement within the team and broader organization.
Drive adoption of modern engineering practices, raising the bar for software quality and maintainability.
Support the success of high-profile space missions by delivering reliable tools used throughout the mission lifecycle.
What You’ll Need:
BS in Aerospace Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or related field with 2 years’ experience, or MS degree.
Strong proficiency in software development, with hands-on experience in C++, C#, and Visual Studio.
Understanding of commercial software development lifecycle, including agile methodologies.
Knowledge of one or more domain areas such as trajectory optimization, optimal control, attitude control & determination, or orbit determination.
Experience in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues in complex software systems.
Ability to document code and technical solutions for future reference and team collaboration.
Who You Are:
Collaborative team player who thrives in fast-paced, innovative environments.
Excellent communicator with strong interpersonal skills.
Quick learner who adapts to new technologies and domain-specific challenges.
Detail-oriented problem solver, able to analyze complex issues and deliver effective solutions.
Inclusive and open-minded, valuing diverse perspectives and fostering a welcoming team culture.
Proactive contributor who takes ownership of tasks and follows through to completion.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join the Digital Mission Engineering Space Products Development Team, a diverse and dynamic group of engineers and scientists passionate about advancing space systems technology. The team collaborates closely with subject matter experts, product managers, and QA professionals to deliver best-in-class solutions for orbit determination and mission analysis. Together, we support the full lifecycle of space missions, driving innovation and excellence in everything we do.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.
In addition to the base salary, this role may be eligible for an annual bonus, equity, and other discretionary bonuses. Synopsys offers comprehensive health, wellness, and financial benefits as part of a competitive total rewards package. The actual compensation offered will be based on a number of job-related factors, including location, skills, experience, and education. Your recruiter can share more specific details on the total rewards package upon request. The base salary range for this role is across the U.S.

digital design and verification
, eager to advance your career and make an impact in the semiconductor industry. You thrive in a collaborative environment, working alongside a diverse team of analog and digital IC design engineers. Your academic foundation in
electronics engineering or computer science
is complemented by hands-on experience with IC design flows. You have a knack for breaking down complex technical challenges, applying both analytical thinking and creativity to deliver innovative solutions.
You are comfortable engaging in verification activities and silicon debugges, learning from more experienced colleagues, and actively contributing your insights. project management
acumen allow you to balance multiple priorities efficiently, ensuring that deliverables meet the highest standards. If you are excited by the prospect of developing high-speed interface IP and contributing to cutting-edge SoC solutions, this role is your opportunity to shine.

Collaborating within a Digital and Verification Development team to design and validate complex digital mix-signal high-speed interface IP;
Engaging in hands-on verification tasks, leveraging guidance from senior engineers and applying best-in-class methodologies;
Building and nurturing productive working relationships across analog and digital design teams:
Participating in product and project reviews, providing technical input and feedback to drive project success;
Preparing and presenting comprehensive reports that summarize technical project outcomes, milestones, and challenges.
Opportunities to be part of firmware developing team for silicon debugges;
Contributing to project management efforts, ensuring timelines and deliverables are met efficiently.

Accelerating the development of next-generation SoC solutions by delivering high-quality digital design and verification expertise;
Enabling leading semiconductor companies to integrate high-precision, silicon-proven IP into market-defining products;
Enhancing the reliability and performance of PCIe and other high-speed interface IP products used across global industries;
Supporting Synopsys’ reputation as the partner of choice for advanced semiconductor IP solutions;
Driving technical excellence and innovation within the IP Design Team and broader engineering community;
Facilitating knowledge sharing and continuous improvement through collaboration and effective communication.

University degree in electronics engineering or computer science;
At least 5 years in the same field/role;
Deep knowledge of IC design flows and methodologies, particularly for semiconductors;
Experience with digital and analog design principles; familiarity with verification tools and environments;
Demonstrated ability to prepare and present technical reports and project documentation;
Project management skills, with the ability to coordinate multiple technical deliverables.

Curious and eager to learn new technologies and methodologies;
Strong team player who values collaboration and open communication;
Highly organized, able to manage time and priorities effectively;
Analytical problem solver with a proactive and adaptable mindset;
Excellent communicator in English, both written and verbal.

Our extensive IP portfolio is licensed to leading semiconductor companies across all major markets, with particular emphasis on delivering high-precision and leading-edge PCIe products. The team values innovation, collaboration, and continuous technical growth.

Job Description and Requirements
You Are:
You are an accomplished engineer with a passion for digital and mixed-signal verification. Your career is marked by a relentless drive to excel in complex environments, where your expertise in SystemVerilog and UVM-based testbench development sets you apart. You thrive in collaborative settings, actively contributing to cross-functional teams and fostering an inclusive, supportive culture. Your strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and creative problem-solving abilities enable you to navigate intricate verification challenges and deliver robust solutions.
What You'll Be Doing:
Develop comprehensive testplans for complex mixed-signal IP, detailing verification strategies and coverage goals.
Design and implement UVM-based testbenches using constraint-random verification methodologies to ensure thorough validation.
Enhance and modify testbench components such as scoreboards, agents, and sequences to support evolving product features.
Write advanced SystemVerilog tests to validate digital and mixed-signal interaction, addressing edge cases and system-level scenarios.
Run RTL and GLS regressions, analyze failures, and drive issue resolution working closely with design and architecture teams.
Achieve code and functional coverage goals, ensuring verification completeness and regulatory compliance.
Explore opportunities for AI adoption to optimize verification flows and improve efficiency.
The Impact You'll Have:
Ensure the delivery of high-performance, reliable mixed-signal IP for next-generation products in networking, storage, and connectivity.
Enable rapid time-to-market for Synopsys solutions by streamlining verification processes and resolving technical challenges.
Drive quality and compliance, reducing risk of field failures and ensuring customer satisfaction.
Contribute to the advancement of verification methodologies, introducing innovative approaches and leveraging emerging technologies.
Mentor and support team members, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and technical excellence.
Collaborate with global teams, enhancing Synopsys’ reputation as a leader in semiconductor IP and verification.
What You'll Need:
2+ years of ASIC verification experience, with a strong foundation in digital and mixed-signal domains.
Hands-on experience writing complex SystemVerilog testcases for advanced verification scenarios.
Proven expertise in developing UVM-based testbenches and leveraging constraint-random methodologies.
Proficiency with scripting languages such as Python to automate tasks and enhance verification efficiency.
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities, with a track record of resolving technical issues.
Excellent organizational and communication skills, enabling effective collaboration and project management.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively across multiple design teams and disciplines.
Who You Are:
Innovative thinker, always seeking new ways to improve processes and methodologies.
Collaborative team player who values diversity and inclusion.
Detail-oriented, with a commitment to delivering high-quality, error-free results.
Adaptable and resilient in dynamic, fast-paced environments.
Strong communicator, able to translate complex technical concepts for diverse audiences.
Proactive problem solver who takes initiative and ownership of outcomes.
Who We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
The Team You'll Be Part Of:
You’ll join a highly experienced mixed-signal design and verification team based in Mississauga, Ontario. Our team is responsible for delivering cutting-edge solutions for Backplane Ethernet, PCIe, SATA, USB 2/3, DisplayPort, MIPI MPHY, CPHY, and DPHY SerDes. We foster a collaborative, inclusive culture where every member’s expertise is valued and innovation is encouraged. Expertise in optimization and design workflows for electric machines, including electromagnetic, thermal, and NVH analysis in high-tech sectors.
Knowledge of control integration and system modeling for e-motors and drivetrains.
Strong foundation in physics phenomena and simulation methods related to magnetic design, power loss, and efficiency.

Logical problem-solving skills, excellent interpersonal and communication abilities, fluent in English.

Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a passionate engineering professional with a deep understanding of structural mechanics and simulation-driven product development. With a strong academic background in Mechanical, Chemical, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field, you have honed your expertise through years of hands-on experience in the engineering software industry, particularly within the Aerospace & Defense sector. You thrive in collaborative, multidisciplinary environments and are eager to serve as a trusted advisor for both internal teams and external customers.
Your technical proficiency is matched by your ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively, in both English and German. You take pride in delivering innovative solutions that address real-world challenges, leveraging your advanced knowledge of Ansys or similar CAE tools. Your analytical mindset, organizational skills, and drive for excellence equip you to manage multiple priorities and deadlines efficiently.
You are motivated by opportunities to expand your technical horizons, develop customer relationships, and contribute to the evolution of cutting-edge simulation solutions. Whether leading technical presentations, developing best practices, or collaborating with product development teams, you bring energy, curiosity, and a commitment to delivering value at every stage of the customer journey. You are ready to travel as needed and are excited to represent Synopsys in both technical and business settings.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Lead and coordinate all technical activities throughout the sales cycle, including discovery, technical negotiations, product demonstrations, and evaluations.
Engage directly with customers to understand their product development requirements and provide expert guidance on utilizing Ansys solutions to achieve superior performance metrics.
Develop and deliver professional services, including training sessions and hands-on workshops, to enhance customer productivity and adoption of simulation methodologies.
Collaborate with product development teams to translate customer needs into new features and participate in testing and validation of new software releases.
Support marketing initiatives by creating promotional materials, authoring conference presentations, and participating in industry events.
Contribute to the development of application best practices and lead the implementation of Ansys solutions into customer design workflows.
Serve as a subject matter expert, providing technical mentorship to colleagues and customers, and staying current with advancements in structural mechanics and simulation technology.
The Impact You Will Have:
Accelerate customer innovation by integrating advanced simulation solutions into their engineering workflows.
Drive customer satisfaction and loyalty through expert technical guidance and responsive support.
Influence the evolution of Ansys products by channeling customer feedback into actionable development initiatives.
Expand Synopsys’ footprint in the Aerospace & Defense industry through successful project delivery and thought leadership.
Enhance the technical capabilities of customer teams, empowering them to achieve breakthrough results in product design and optimization.
Strengthen Synopsys’ reputation as a trusted partner in engineering simulation and digital transformation.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Mechanical, Chemical, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years (BS), 3 years (MS), or relevant (PhD) professional experience in an engineering software environment.
In-depth experience with Ansys or equivalent CAE, CAD, EDA, or PLM software packages.
Proven expertise in Mechanical Linear and Nonlinear Finite Element Analysis (FEA).
Fluency in English and German, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Demonstrated experience (2+ years) in the Aerospace & Defense industry as a simulation engineer.
Some experience accumulated on Automation and Scripting (Python preferred)
Ability to travel up to 25% (and potentially up to 50%) of the time.
Who You Are:
Logical problem-solver with strong analytical and organizational skills.
Excellent interpersonal communicator, comfortable presenting to both technical and business audiences, including C-level executives.
Professional, driven, and business-savvy, with a proactive and customer-focused mindset.
Adaptable team player who thrives in multidisciplinary, multicultural environments.
Self-starter with a sense of urgency and a passion for continuous learning and improvement.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a dynamic, multidisciplinary team of engineering and application experts who are passionate about simulation-driven design. The team collaborates closely across product development, technical sales, and customer success functions to deliver transformative solutions for leading-edge industries. Together, you’ll drive innovation, support professional development, and contribute to Synopsys’ leadership in engineering simulation.

You Are:
You are a seasoned frontend engineer with a passion for crafting seamless, intuitive, and visually stunning web applications. Your expertise in Angular and TypeScript is matched only by your commitment to building robust, scalable, and maintainable codebases. You thrive in collaborative environments, eagerly sharing your insights and learning from others while championing best practices in UI/UX design. Your keen eye for detail ensures that every interface you build is not only functional but also delightful to use.
You approach challenges with curiosity and creativity, always seeking innovative solutions to complex problems. Your communication skills enable you to articulate technical concepts clearly, whether you’re collaborating with designers, backend engineers, or stakeholders. You take ownership of your work and are driven by a desire to make a positive impact—both on your team and on the end users of your products. Your proactive, growth-oriented mindset means you’re always looking for opportunities to improve your skills and contribute to the team’s success. Above all, you value diversity, inclusivity, and a workplace where all voices are heard and respected.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Designing, developing, and maintaining sophisticated web applications using Angular and TypeScript for our flagship Materials Information products.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams—including product managers, designers, and backend engineers—to create engaging user experiences tailored for the Aerospace & Automotive sectors.
Championing best practices in UI/UX, ensuring that usability, accessibility, and visual appeal are at the forefront of every project.
Writing clean, maintainable, and reusable cross-browser code that scales efficiently across platforms and devices.
Drafting UI designs and collaborating to ensure technical feasibility, iterating on feedback to achieve optimal results.
Implementing and evolving comprehensive unit test coverage using tools such as Jest for reliable, high-quality releases.
Optimizing web applications for maximum speed and scalability, proactively identifying and addressing performance bottlenecks.
Participating in code reviews, mentoring junior engineers, and fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation.
The Impact You Will Have:
Delivering industry-leading user interfaces that empower customers in the Aerospace and Automotive sectors to make smarter, data-driven decisions.
Elevating the overall user experience of Synopsys' flagship products, driving user satisfaction and customer retention.
Contributing to the technical excellence and scalability of our web applications, ensuring long-term maintainability and performance.
Setting high standards for code quality, testing, and documentation, influencing best practices across the engineering organization.
Mentoring and supporting your peers, fostering a collaborative and inclusive team culture.
Advancing innovation by integrating new technologies and approaches that keep Synopsys at the forefront of web development.
Helping shape our product roadmap through thoughtful feedback and technical expertise.
What You’ll Need:
Extensive experience building frontend web applications with Angular and TypeScript.
Strong proficiency in HTML, CSS, and modern browser APIs.
Proven ability to design and implement reusable UI components using established design patterns.
Demonstrated experience optimizing applications for speed, scalability, and cross-browser compatibility.
Solid understanding of automated testing tools and frameworks such as Jest, with a commitment to maintaining high test coverage.
Experience drafting, communicating, and refining UI/UX designs in partnership with designers and product teams.
Who You Are:
Detail-oriented with a strong sense of visual aesthetics and user-centric design.
Excellent communicator, able to convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.
Collaborative team player who thrives in fast-paced, agile environments.
Self-driven and conscientious, with a commitment to delivering high-quality, innovative solutions.
Open-minded and adaptable, always eager to learn and embrace new challenges.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a talented, multidisciplinary R&D team dedicated to building world-class Materials Information products at Synopsys. The team values creativity, inclusivity, and continuous learning, working closely together to deliver solutions that have a real impact in industries such as Aerospace and Automotive. You’ll collaborate with passionate engineers, designers, and product managers who are committed to innovation, quality, and making a difference.

Descriptions & Requirements
Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a seasoned analog design professional with a passion for pushing technology boundaries. With over a decade of hands-on experience in analog IC design, you thrive in fast-paced, collaborative environments and are motivated by technical challenges. Your expertise in Multi-Gbps NRZ & PAM4 SERDES IP and familiarity with the latest FinFET and gate-all-around process nodes set you apart as a leader in the field. You are adept at translating complex SerDes standards into innovative, high-performance circuit architectures and are comfortable navigating the intricacies of transistor-level design, system-level budgeting, and analog/digital co-design.
You excel at mentoring peers, sharing knowledge, and advocating for design excellence. Your strong analytical skills allow you to quickly identify architectural bottlenecks and propose effective solutions. You are detail-oriented, balancing deep technical focus with a strategic view of project goals and timelines. Communication is one of your strengths—whether presenting simulation data, documenting design features, or collaborating across multidisciplinary teams, you articulate complex ideas clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Beyond your technical expertise, you are committed to continuous learning and growth, staying abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies. You value diversity and inclusion, recognizing that great ideas come from a variety of perspectives. Your proactive and adaptable approach ensures you thrive in dynamic, innovative environments where your contributions drive meaningful impact.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Reviewing SerDes standards to develop novel transceiver architectures and detailed sub-block specifications.
Investigating and architecting circuit solutions that address performance bottlenecks, enabling significant improvements in power, area, and speed.
Collaborating with cross-functional analog and digital design teams to streamline design and verification processes for optimal efficiency and quality.
Overseeing and guiding the physical layout to minimize parasitics, device stress, and process variations, ensuring robust silicon performance.
Presenting and reviewing simulation data with internal teams and external stakeholders, including industry panels and customer reviews.
Documenting design features, test plans, and results, and consulting on electrical characterization and post-silicon analysis for product enhancements.
Analyzing customer silicon data to identify design improvement opportunities and proposing solutions for post-silicon updates.
The Impact You Will Have:
Drive innovation in high-speed analog/mixed-signal design, enabling next-generation connectivity solutions.
Shape the architectural direction of SERDES IP, influencing industry standards and future product offerings.
Enhance the performance, power efficiency, and reliability of Synopsys’ silicon IP portfolio.
Mentor and elevate the technical capabilities of team members, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous learning.
Directly contribute to successful customer deployments by addressing post-silicon challenges and ensuring robust field performance.
Strengthen Synopsys’ market leadership in advanced process nodes and high-speed communication technologies.
What You’ll Need:
MTech/MS with 2+ years or BTech/BS with 4+ years of practical analog IC design experience in Electrical or Computer Engineering (or related field).
Proven expertise with FinFET technologies and CMOS tape-outs.
Deep understanding of Multi-Gbps high-speed designs (PAM4, NRZ) and SERDES architectures.
Extensive design experience with SERDES sub-circuits (e.g., TX, RX, adaptive equalizers, PLL, DLL, BGR, regulators, oscillators, ADC/DAC).
Skilled in analog/digital co-design, calibration, adaptation, and timing handoff for optimized circuit performance.
Familiarity with ESD protection, custom digital design, and design for reliability (EM, IR, aging, self-heating).
Proficient with schematic entry, physical layout, design verification tools, and SPICE simulators.
Experience with scripting languages (TCL, PERL, MATLAB) for post-processing simulation results.
Understanding of system-level budgeting (jitter, amplitude, noise) and signal integrity (packaging, parasitics, crosstalk).
Excellent communication and documentation skills.
Who You Are:
Collaborative and open-minded, eager to share knowledge and learn from others.
Detail-oriented and thorough, with a commitment to delivering high-quality results.
Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving abilities and a proactive approach.
Excellent communicator, able to convey complex technical concepts clearly.
Adaptable and resilient in fast-paced, dynamic environments.
Committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative, and supportive workplace.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a world-class analog and mixed-signal R&D team at Synopsys, working alongside experts in high-speed IC design, verification, and CAD tool development. The team is collaborative, diverse, and passionate about innovation, with a focus on developing cutting-edge SERDES IP for advanced process nodes.
