Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a motivated and engaging professional who thrives in a dynamic, customer-centric environment. You possess a strong drive to build lasting relationships, understand complex customer needs, and deliver tailored solutions that propel business growth. You’re passionate about technology and eager to make a tangible impact by connecting customers to innovative products that shape the future of the semiconductor and technology industries.
You appreciate the value of teamwork and are adept at collaborating across functions to deliver a seamless customer experience. You approach challenges with curiosity and problem-solving acumen, leveraging your organizational skills to manage multiple priorities with confidence and clarity. Fluent in both English and German, you are comfortable engaging with a diverse range of clients and colleagues, whether in-person, over the phone, or through digital channels.
As someone who relishes continuous learning, you are excited to deepen your understanding of engineering analysis, technology, and the sales process. You are resilient, adaptable, and energized by the prospect of travel and face-to-face interactions. Above all, you are committed to delivering results through integrity, empathy, and a relentless focus on customer success.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Establishing, developing, and maintaining strong business relationships with current and prospective customers within your assigned territory or set of accounts.
Conducting sales activities through a combination of face-to-face meetings, phone calls, and digital communications to maximize account growth and retention.
Identifying customer pain points, understanding their business objectives, and presenting Synopsys solutions using data-driven proof points to differentiate from competitors.
Creating and maintaining detailed account plans that highlight opportunities for growth, value delivery, and increased share of wallet.
Researching and identifying new prospects, expanding business within existing accounts, and developing tailored proposals and quotations.
Coordinating closely with marketing, technical, legal, and account teams to ensure seamless execution of sales activities and customer engagements.
Delivering accurate sales forecasts, supporting renewal and new business targets, and participating in trade shows, conventions, and training seminars to build your network and skill set.
The Impact You Will Have:
Drive revenue growth by securing new business and expanding existing customer relationships in a key geographic region.
Act as a trusted advisor to customers, helping them achieve their business outcomes with Synopsys’ industry-leading solutions.
Accelerate the adoption of innovative chip design, verification, and IP integration technologies across the semiconductor and software industries.
Contribute to the overall sales strategy by providing valuable market insights and competitive intelligence.
Enhance customer satisfaction and retention by proactively addressing needs and ensuring seamless post-sale support.
Strengthen Synopsys’ reputation as a partner of choice for technology leaders, driving long-term business success and market leadership.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in technical, engineering, business, or a related field, with 1+ years professional experience, or 3+ years of related experience.
Fluency in both English and German, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Basic understanding of engineering analysis and technology, with a willingness to learn more about Synopsys’ products and solutions.
Ability to manage multiple sales opportunities and priorities simultaneously, tracking progress and adapting as needed.
Strong presentation, persuasion, and proposal development skills, with a focus on customer value and differentiation.
Who You Are:
Customer-focused and solutions-oriented, with a passion for helping others succeed.
Excellent communicator, able to build rapport and trust with diverse stakeholders.
Organized, detail-oriented, and adept at managing multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Resilient and adaptable, with a growth mindset and a willingness to travel up to 50% of the time.
Collaborative team player who thrives in cross-functional settings and values continuous learning.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a high-performing Sales team that is passionate about building strong customer relationships and driving the adoption of cutting-edge technology solutions. The team values collaboration, diversity, and innovation, working closely with marketing, technical experts, and business leaders to deliver exceptional value to our clients. Together, you’ll help shape the future of technology in a supportive and growth-oriented environment.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process

Job Description and Requirements
RTL Design- Sr Engineer
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a driven and forward-thinking digital design engineer who thrives in a collaborative and innovative environment. You possess a deep understanding of ASIC digital design flows and are passionate about working on the forefront of high-speed serial interfaces such as USB, PCIe, Ethernet, DP2.0, and HDMI2.1. With a keen eye for detail and a commitment to quality, you proactively seek out solutions to complex challenges and are eager to expand your expertise in both established and emerging technologies. Your experience in HDL coding, synthesis constraints, and digital verification tools is complemented by your adaptability to new tools and protocols.
You value teamwork and open communication, and you’re motivated by the opportunity to contribute to industry-leading products. You are equally comfortable working independently or as part of a diverse team, and you’re always looking for ways to improve processes and outcomes. Your background in scripting languages and understanding of digital design best practices equip you to excel in a dynamic, fast-paced setting. Above all, you are eager to make a tangible impact on next-generation semiconductor technologies while growing your career alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Implement RTL designs in Verilog for high-speed SERDES interfaces and IP cores.
Run Spyglass CDC/RDC/Lint and Tmax for code quality, clock domain crossing, and reset domain crossing checks.
Develop and optimize synthesis constraints to ensure robust and high-performance ASIC implementations.
Collaborate with experienced team members to refine digital design flows and methodologies.
Participate in the integration and verification of complex digital blocks within next-generation SERDES architectures.
Utilize scripting languages (Perl, Shell, Python, Tcl) to automate design and verification tasks, enhancing team efficiency.
Stay up to date with evolving industry standards and best practices for high-speed digital design.
The Impact You Will Have:
Advance the development of cutting-edge high-speed SERDES IP, powering next-generation connectivity solutions.
Ensure industry-leading quality and reliability through rigorous design, verification, and synthesis processes.
Help Synopsys maintain its leadership in the semiconductor industry by contributing to critical IP used worldwide.
Drive innovation by identifying opportunities to optimize design flows and methodologies.
Support cross-functional teams by providing insights and solutions for challenging digital design problems.
Enhance the scalability and performance of complex ASIC designs, enabling our customers’ success in competitive markets.
What You’ll Need:
B.E/B.Tech/M.Tech in Electronics & Communication Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related field.
3+ years of hands-on experience in ASIC digital design, with a strong foundation in HDL coding (Verilog).
Proficiency in synthesis constraints and basics of Static Timing Analysis (STA).
Experience with linting and verification tools such as Spyglass CDC/RDC/Lint and Tmax.
Working knowledge of scripting languages like Perl, Shell, Python, or Tcl for design automation.
Familiarity with high-speed SERDES protocols and RTL implementation is a strong advantage.
Who You Are:
Innovative thinker with a passion for technology and continuous learning.
Effective communicator, able to share ideas and feedback constructively within a diverse team.
Detail-oriented and committed to delivering high-quality results.
Collaborative team player who thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Proactive problem-solver with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a highly experienced and collaborative digital design team focused on advancing high-speed SERDES technology. The team is passionate about innovation, quality, and continuous improvement. Together, you will work on challenging projects that push the boundaries of connectivity and performance, learning from and supporting each other in a culture of mutual respect and shared success.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a passionate and inquisitive engineer eager to ensure that cutting-edge simulation technologies meet rigorous standards for accuracy and usability. With a background in engineering and a keen interest in computational tools, you thrive on exploring how products perform in real-world scenarios. You bring a blend of technical expertise and a collaborative mindset, always ready to engage with cross-functional teams to solve complex challenges. Your natural curiosity drives you to investigate deeply, uncovering subtle issues and contributing to robust solutions. You are comfortable navigating ambiguous requirements and relish the opportunity to turn them into actionable test plans that safeguard product quality.
You value diversity and inclusivity, recognizing that great ideas come from varied perspectives. You communicate clearly and effectively, whether you’re discussing technical details or collaborating on process improvements. Your organizational skills keep you on track in fast-paced environments, and your attention to detail ensures nothing slips through the cracks. You are adaptable, eager to learn new skills—be it advanced testing techniques or the latest in CAE software—and you see feedback as an opportunity for growth. Ultimately, you are committed to delivering software that empowers engineers and researchers to solve the world’s toughest problems.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Designing, specifying, and maintaining comprehensive test cases and test scripts for Ansys applications.
Applying your knowledge of CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) and FEA (Finite Element Analysis) to perform manual and automated functional, regression, and performance testing.
Creating detailed test plans, managing defects, and contributing to testing metrics to drive quality improvements.
Utilizing a variety of computing environments—including Windows, virtual machines, and cloud platforms—to execute and validate tests.
Collaborating closely with product creation teams to analyze requirements and develop automated tests for new features.
Participating in design and code reviews, providing actionable feedback to enhance product quality.
Assessing product usability and functionality from a customer-centric perspective, ensuring solutions meet real-world needs.
Investigating and troubleshooting product issues, working with technical specialists to resolve complex challenges.
The Impact You Will Have:
Directly influence the reliability and accuracy of industry-leading simulation software used by engineers worldwide.
Enhance product quality, helping customers innovate faster and with greater confidence.
Drive usability improvements that make advanced engineering tools accessible to a broader audience.
Strengthen Synopsys’ reputation for excellence in software verification and quality assurance.
Contribute to the development of robust automated testing frameworks that streamline future releases.
Support the delivery of new features that address evolving market needs and maintain technological leadership.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement and learning within the team.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree (in Mechanical Engineering preferred) with at least 2 years of relevant experience, or a Master’s degree with no experience.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C#, C++, or Visual Studio.
Understanding of CFD and/or FEA principles and their application in testing environments.
Experience creating and executing test cases, including both manual and automated testing.
Ability to work across multiple computing environments (Windows, VMs, Cloud).
Familiarity with defect management, test metrics, and QA processes.
Who You Are:
Strong analytical thinker with a solution-oriented mindset.
Exceptional communicator and collaborator, comfortable working in geographically distributed teams.
Detail-driven and highly organized, with a commitment to quality and accuracy.
Quick learner, open to feedback and new ideas.
Adaptable and resilient, thriving in dynamic environments.
Passionate about continuous improvement and professional growth.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a diverse and forward-thinking group within the Design Business Unit (DBU), focused on developing and verifying world-class simulation software such as Ansys Discovery. The team is collaborative, innovative, and dedicated to delivering products that empower customers in academia and industry alike. You’ll engage with software developers, domain experts, and other verification engineers to drive excellence across the product lifecycle.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

You have a strong passion for working with embedded processors or processor-based systems. You bring knowledge of HDL design, with a preference for experience in RISC processor architectures, DSP, AI (Neural Processing Unit), and multi-core systems. You are familiar with design and verification languages such as Verilog and SystemVerilog, and have experience with RTL simulation tools, such as VCS. Scripting or programming skills in languages such as assembler, C, Tcl, Csh, and Python is desirable. Experience with embedded software related to DSP or AI reference models is a plus. Develop and maintain microprocessor hardware IP including specification, implementation, verification, and FPGA validation, with an emphasis on validating system architecture and performance for DSP processor IP or Neural Processing Unit (NPU) IP.
Optimize designs for performance, area, and power efficiency.
Create and enhance tests for hardware IP verification and validation, improving functional coverage and performance through the application of state-of-the-art methodologies.
Collaborate with global teams in tools, modeling, and simulation to deliver optimized solutions for our customers.
The Impact You Will Have:
Contribute to the development of highly optimized hardware IP for the ARC family of configurable processors.
Enable customers to create sophisticated and efficient embedded designs.
Support the delivery of world-class microprocessors used in advanced applications.
Help improve functional coverage and performance of processor IP through advanced verification methods.
Collaborate globally to deliver customer-focused solutions.
Drive continuous improvement in processor system verification.
What You’ll Need:
Passion for embedded processors or processor-based systems.
Knowledge of HDL design, preferably in RISC processor architectures, DSP, AI (NPU), and multi-core systems.
Familiarity with Verilog and SystemVerilog.
Experience with RTL simulation tools (e.g., VCS).
Scripting or programming skills in assembler, C, Tcl, Csh, or Python.
Experience with embedded software for DSP or AI reference models is a plus.
Who You Are:
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Proficient in English.
Capable of detailed status reporting and presenting results to program management teams.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
Join our dynamic team dedicated to developing highly optimized hardware IP for the ARC family of configurable processors, enabling customers to create sophisticated and efficient embedded designs.

Championing best practices in software engineering and serving as a technical resource for the project team.

Accelerate the development of cutting-edge EDA tools that enable the design of next-generation silicon chips.
Enhance software performance and reliability, directly influencing the success of customer projects worldwide.
Streamline and improve internal processes, raising the bar for code quality and maintainability.
Mentor and support teammates, fostering a culture of technical excellence and knowledge sharing.
Drive innovation by implementing new features and capabilities that keep Synopsys at the forefront of the semiconductor industry.
Contribute to the scalability and extensibility of core technologies, ensuring long-term success for both the team and the company.
Facilitate cross-functional collaboration, bridging gaps between teams and ensuring seamless integration of new solutions.

B.E./B.Tech. or M.E./M.Tech. degree in Computer Science, Electroncs Engineering, or a related field, with up to 4 years of relevant experience.
Proven expertise in C++ with a broad and deep understanding of the language.
Strong working knowledge of the Linux operating system.
Solid background in data structures, algorithms, and debugging techniques.
Sound understanding of electronic design at the gate level and/or transistor level.
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to complex systems.
Track record of delivering high-quality work on time.
Preferred: Experience in large-scale commercial software development, distributed systems, Python programming, EDA databases, geometric data processing, and IC physical design.
Who You Are:
Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills.
Excellent communicator, both written and verbal.
Highly collaborative and supportive team player.
Detail-oriented and organized, with a commitment to quality.
Self-motivated, eager to learn, and proactive in proposing solutions.
Open-minded and inclusive, valuing diverse perspectives and backgrounds.

The team values innovation, technical excellence, and collaboration, working together to solve some of the most challenging problems in chip design and verification. Drive improvements in software quality, scalability, and performance, setting new standards for simulation products in the market.

Job Description and Requirements
Verification Architect
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a visionary and highly experienced engineering professional, passionate about verification and digital design methodologies. With at least 15 years of solid experience in IP and SoC verification, you have consistently demonstrated technical excellence and leadership in your career. You thrive in challenging environments and are adept at architecting robust verification infrastructures from the ground up, particularly within the EDA ecosystem.
You possess deep hands-on knowledge of industry-leading tools such as Synopsys VCS, Verdi, VMS Execution Manager, Verdi Planner (HVP), and VIPs. Your expertise enables you to design unified reference flows and scalable methodologies that empower teams and accelerate project success.
You excel at independently owning and delivering on complex assignments, while also being a collaborative team player who enjoys mentoring and elevating junior engineers. Your communication skills are outstanding, allowing you to articulate technical concepts to diverse audiences and influence cross-functional teams. You have a proven ability to multi-task, manage priorities, and drive technical initiatives with a strategic mindset.
Your academic foundation includes a bachelor’s degree in electronics, electrical, or computer engineering, and you continuously seek to expand your knowledge and impact in the field of digital IP verification. You are ready to take on a leadership role, shaping methodology and best practices for the next generation of high-performance silicon designs.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Architecting and implementing reference and unified verification flows for Synopsys digital IP products using leading EDA tools such as VCS, Verdi, VMS Execution Manager, Verdi Planner (HVP), and VIPs.
Building robust, scalable verification infrastructures from the ground up to support diverse and complex IP and SoC projects.
Partnering with global engineering teams to define, document, and propagate best-in-class verification methodologies and standards.
Leading and mentoring junior engineers, fostering a culture of technical growth, innovation, and collaboration within the team.
Driving technical initiatives and independently managing high-impact assignments, ensuring timely and high-quality deliverables.
Collaborating closely with tool development teams to influence product evolution and optimize verification workflows for maximum efficiency.
Supporting customers and internal stakeholders by troubleshooting, optimizing, and refining verification processes and flows.
The Impact You Will Have:
Elevate Synopsys’ digital IP verification capabilities by delivering robust, unified, and scalable methodology solutions.
Accelerate time-to-market for high-performance silicon products by streamlining and standardizing verification processes.
Empower global verification teams with best-in-class flows, tools, and practices, driving consistent project success.
Shape the verification strategy for next-generation Synopsys IP and SoC offerings, directly influencing product quality and customer satisfaction.
Mentor and develop the next wave of verification engineers, fostering a culture of learning and technical excellence.
Contribute to the evolution of Synopsys’ EDA tool ecosystem by providing critical feedback and championing innovative solutions.
Enhance Synopsys’ leadership position in the semiconductor industry through continuous improvement and adoption of cutting-edge verification methodologies.
What You’ll Need:
Minimum 15 years of hands-on experience in IP/SoC verification, with a proven track record of technical leadership.
Strong expertise in using Synopsys verification tools such as VCS, Verdi, VMS Execution Manager, Verdi Planner (HVP), and VIPs.
Demonstrated ability to architect and implement verification flows and infrastructure for complex digital designs.
Solid programming and scripting skills (SystemVerilog, UVM, Tcl, Python or similar languages).
Bachelor’s degree in electronics, electrical, or computer engineering (advanced degrees a plus).
Experience with multi-tasking and managing technical projects independently.
Ability to document, communicate, and propagate technical methodologies across global teams.
Who You Are:
Innovative problem solver who thrives in dynamic, fast-paced environments.
Excellent communicator, able to distill complex technical topics for diverse audiences.
Natural mentor and team player, passionate about knowledge-sharing and team development.
Strategic thinker with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to quality.
Self-motivated leader who takes initiative and drives projects to successful completion.
Adaptable, resilient, and eager to learn and grow alongside industry leaders.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will be a core member of the newly established Digital IP Verification Methodology (COE) team, a group of forward-thinking engineers dedicated to advancing verification excellence at Synopsys. The team collaborates across global sites, driving innovation in methodology, tool integration, and best practices. Together, you will shape the future of digital IP verification, enabling Synopsys and its customers to deliver world-class silicon solutions.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Mapping RTL designs into FPGA environments, leveraging deep verification and implementation knowledge.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to interpret customer requirements and deliver innovative solutions.
Debugging and optimizing software using tools like gdb, valgrind, and collect to ensure robustness and scalability.
Proposing and integrating new technologies and methodologies to enhance existing product offerings.

Enabling Synopsys to maintain its leadership in the EDA industry through continuous innovation.

Contributing to an inclusive and collaborative engineering culture that values diverse perspectives.
Supporting the transformation of industries such as automotive, AI, IoT, and cloud computing through advanced design solutions.

Bachelor’s in EE/CS/CE with 10+ years, or Master’s/PhD with 8+ years of relevant experience in software engineering or related fields.
Expertise in C/C++ programming, with a strong grasp of object-oriented and multi-threaded development.
Deep understanding of computer science fundamentals, including data structures and algorithms.
Proficiency in debugging and optimizing complex software using tools such as gdb, valgrind, and collect.

Background in EDA/CAD tool development, with knowledge of logic synthesis and FPGA synthesis as a plus.

Innovative problem-solver with a growth mindset and a drive to learn new technologies.

Flexible and adaptive, thriving in fast-paced, dynamic environments.
Champion of inclusion and diversity, contributing to an equitable workplace.

Designing, implementing, testing, and maintaining software modules with a focus on integrating AI capabilities into physics-based simulation workflows.
Collaborating with senior engineers and domain experts to translate technical requirements into functional, robust software components.
Refining prototypes for AI-driven features, assisting in their transition from concept to production-ready code.
Staying current with the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and simulation technologies, and proposing innovative ideas to enhance product capabilities.
Participating in code reviews and technical discussions to ensure high-quality deliverables and adherence to best practices.
Working under the general supervision of a development manager, while proactively contributing to team goals and project milestones.
The Impact You Will Have:
Accelerate the integration of AI technologies into next-generation simulation products, making advanced engineering tools more usable and accessible.
Enable customers to tackle complex simulation challenges through intuitive, AI-powered features.
Drive innovation in physics-based modeling, contributing to the democratization of simulation for diverse industries and user groups.
Enhance the performance and scalability of simulation software, supporting applications in automotive, aerospace, and electronics design.
Help shape the future direction of Synopsys’ simulation products through your technical expertise and creative problem-solving.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement, learning, and collaboration within a high-performing engineering team.
What You’ll Need:
BS in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field with 2 years of experience, or MS in a relevant discipline.
Demonstrated experience in technical software development (academic, research, or industry projects).
Familiarity with modern software development practices, including agile methodologies, version control, and code review.
Strong background in AI/ML frameworks, including experience with large language models.
Proficiency with Python and frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Preferred: Knowledge of physics-based simulation tools (LS-DYNA, Ansys), CAD modeling, CFD, real-time simulation, optimization workflows, or generative design.
Who You Are:
Collaborative and communicative, able to work effectively in distributed, multidisciplinary teams.
Adaptable and comfortable with ambiguity, thriving in fast-paced, dynamic environments.
Curious and passionate about continuous learning and technological innovation.
Detail-oriented, with a focus on delivering high-quality, reliable software solutions.
Proactive in sharing ideas and contributing to team success.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are an accomplished engineer passionate about advancing simulation technologies that power the next wave of intelligent products. With a strong foundation in software development and a deep understanding of physics and numerical methods, you thrive on solving complex engineering problems. You have hands-on experience in C++ and Python, and you are adept at working with data serialization tools. Your curiosity drives you to explore new algorithms, optimize performance, and ensure accuracy in simulation results. You excel in collaborative environments, communicating effectively with cross-functional teams, and you possess the resilience to tackle technical challenges head-on. Your attention to detail, commitment to best practices, and eagerness to stay current with industry advancements set you apart. You are motivated by the opportunity to shape tools that engineers worldwide depend on for innovation, and you are excited to contribute to a culture of excellence, learning, and impact.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Designing, implementing, and maintaining high-performance software modules for numerical simulation.
Collaborating with product managers, QA, and support teams to understand and address user needs and challenges.
Participating in bug verification, release testing, and beta support to ensure product robustness and reliability.
Researching and resolving problems discovered by QA or product support, delivering innovative and effective solutions.
Documenting code, modules, and processes to facilitate knowledge sharing and future development.
Employing and advocating for best practices in software development, including code reviews and continuous integration.
The Impact You Will Have:
Empower engineering teams by delivering reliable simulation tools that accelerate product development cycles.
Enhance product performance and accuracy, enabling customers to design with confidence and precision.
Drive innovation by implementing new algorithms and methodologies in numerical simulation software.
Contribute to Synopsys’ reputation for technical excellence and customer success.
Support cross-functional collaboration, ensuring our solutions meet evolving market demands.
Help shape the future of simulation technology for critical industries ranging from automotive to aerospace.
What You’ll Need:
Strong programming skills in C++ and Python, with proven experience in software development.
BS in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field with 5 years' experience, MS with 2/3 years' experience, or PhD.
Solid understanding of physics, numerical methods, and computational algorithms.
Experience with Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and CAD systems.
Ability to perform rigorous testing, debugging, and performance optimization.
Familiarity with best practices in software engineering, including version control and documentation.
Who You Are:
Analytical thinker with exceptional problem-solving abilities.
Effective communicator and collaborator, open to feedback and new ideas.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to quality and continuous improvement.
Self-driven with a passion for learning and technical excellence.
Resilient and adaptable in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join a dynamic engineering team based in Lyon, dedicated to developing cutting-edge simulation software for global industries. The team is composed of experts in computational physics, software architecture, and product development, working collaboratively to deliver robust, high-impact solutions. You will be supported by experienced mentors and have opportunities to contribute to cross-disciplinary projects, ensuring your work has a direct impact on Synopsys’ product portfolio and customer success.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are an intellectually curious, forward-thinking software engineer who cares deeply about the impact of your work on both technology and the world. You’re passionate about building robust, scalable systems that help engineers and designers make smarter, more sustainable choices in materials selection. You thrive in collaborative, cross-functional teams and find satisfaction in tackling complex technical challenges. With a strong foundation in C# and the .NET framework, you understand the importance of writing clean, maintainable code and adhering to best practices. You’re eager to engage with stakeholders, value constructive code reviews, and welcome opportunities to learn from others as well as to mentor. Your communication skills enable you to translate technical concepts for both technical and non-technical audiences, and you are energized by the opportunity to work with geographically distributed colleagues. Above all, you are motivated by the opportunity to contribute to products that make a positive difference—products that help reduce environmental impact, support sustainability, and advance high-performance engineering.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Collaborating with product stakeholders to gather, clarify, and refine technical requirements for Granta MI’s server-side components.
Designing, developing, and maintaining scalable backend solutions using C# and the .NET framework to extend the capabilities of our flagship materials information management system.
Performing rigorous code reviews, providing and receiving constructive feedback to ensure high code quality and maintainability.
Investigating, diagnosing, and resolving issues identified by QA or reported by users, ensuring robust and reliable performance.
Researching new technologies, methodologies, and best practices to continuously enhance product performance and sustainability features.
Writing automated tests and contributing to a culture of test-driven development and continuous integration.
Documenting solutions and sharing knowledge with team members to foster a collaborative and innovative environment.
The Impact You Will Have:
Empowering engineers and designers to make more sustainable, environmentally friendly material choices through enhanced data management capabilities.
Contributing to the reduction of resource usage, pollution, and waste in product design by enabling smarter materials decisions.
Advancing the reliability, scalability, and user experience of Granta MI, the industry-leading materials information management platform.
Driving innovation in materials informatics, supporting the next generation of high-performance, sustainable products.
Collaborating with a global team to deliver solutions that have a direct, positive impact on manufacturing industries worldwide.
Helping Synopsys maintain its leadership in sustainable technology solutions and materials data management.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.
Professional experience in software development, with a focus on backend or server-side engineering.
Strong technical proficiency in C# and a solid understanding of the .NET framework.
Experience with modern software development methodologies, including agile practices and test-driven development.
Demonstrated ability to write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code.
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development workflows.
Who You Are:
Effective communicator who can collaborate across functions and locations.
Detail-oriented and committed to high-quality results.
Analytical thinker with a problem-solving mindset and a passion for learning.
Adaptable, open to feedback, and eager to work in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
Team player who values diverse perspectives and actively contributes to a positive culture.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join the Cambridge-based Materials Business Unit, a dynamic team dedicated to developing Granta MI—Synopsys’ flagship materials information management system. This multidisciplinary group brings together software engineers, materials scientists, and product experts, all united by a mission to deliver solutions that make a real difference in sustainability and product performance. Collaboration, continuous learning, and a shared passion for technology and environmental impact define how we work.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

Descriptions & Requirements
Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a seasoned engineer with deep expertise in high-speed serial communication and transceiver design, blending theoretical rigor with hands-on laboratory proficiency. You thrive in dynamic, cross-disciplinary environments, collaborating with analog, digital, and hardware teams to realize innovative solutions. Your background includes advanced modeling, signal processing, and hardware validation, making you a pivotal contributor to projects involving PCIe and Ethernet protocols. You have a natural inclination for mentoring, guiding junior engineers, and sharing your technical wisdom. Your analytical mindset and attention to detail help you anticipate challenges and craft robust architectures. As an adaptable problem solver, you excel at troubleshooting complex systems and supporting customers through technical challenges. You are passionate about advancing connectivity technologies and are eager to lead simulation and sign-off activities that ensure best-in-class product reliability. With your strong communication skills, you foster transparency and alignment across teams, and your commitment to excellence drives Synopsys’ continued leadership in high-performance connectivity solutions. You are motivated by opportunities to innovate, empower others, and make a tangible impact on next-generation silicon products.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Collaborating closely with analog, digital, and hardware teams to ensure holistic design and verification coverage.
Developing and maintaining comprehensive simulation and verification plans for IP, aligning with reliability and performance targets.
Reviewing execution against verification plans through regular meetings with multiple verification teams (analog, cosim, DV, GLS, formal, emulation).
Establishing, monitoring, and reporting on key verification metrics such as functional, code, and assertion coverage.
Coordinating with Firmware & Algorithms Lead and Digital FW Developers to develop hardware regression plans for successive FW releases.
Delivering high-quality verification collateral including test plans, test cases, coverage reports, and sign-off documentation.
The Impact You Will Have:
Advance high-speed connectivity for enterprise and hyperscale applications worldwide.
Ensure robust and scalable solutions for a diverse global customer base.
Drive innovation in SerDes design, modeling, and validation methodologies.
Accelerate time-to-market for cutting-edge silicon products.
Empower customers by delivering expert technical support and troubleshooting.
Strengthen Synopsys’ reputation as an industry leader in high-performance connectivity IP.
Enable successful silicon implementation by catching issues early through rigorous simulation and verification.
Facilitate cross-team collaboration that enhances product quality and reliability.
What You’ll Need:
MSc or PhD in Electrical/Computer Engineering, with 10+ years of relevant industry experience.
Deep expertise in high‑speed protocols—PCIe and Ethernet.
Proficiency in SystemVerilog, object‑oriented verification, UVM/VMM/OVM, and assertion‑based verification, coverage closure expertise.
Strong scripting/programming: Python, TCL, Perl, C/C++.
In-depth knowledge of high-speed analog and digital design principles.
Familiarity with verification flows: analog, cosimulation, digital verification, GLS, formal methods, and emulation.
Proven leadership: testbench architecture, planning, cross‑site collaboration, and mentoring.
Who You Are:
Innovative and forward-thinking, always seeking new solutions to technical challenges.
Detail-oriented, with a rigorous approach to analysis and validation.
Collaborative and effective in cross-functional team settings.
Strong communicator and mentor, able to share knowledge and guide others.
Adaptable, thriving in fast-paced and evolving environments.
Customer-focused, dedicated to delivering high-quality support and solutions.
The Team You’ll Be a Part Of:
You’ll join a world-class engineering team focused on developing, verifying, and delivering industry-leading high-speed connectivity IP. Our team is a blend of domain experts in analog and digital design, modeling, and hardware validation, working collaboratively to push boundaries in SerDes and transceiver technologies. Together, we drive innovation, tackle complex challenges, and ensure our products empower customers to achieve their goals in enterprise, data center, and networking applications.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are an accomplished engineering leader with a passion for driving complex projects to successful completion. With a solid academic foundation (MSEE/BSEE or MSCE/BSCE) and over 15 years of hands-on experience in ASIC design and project management, you thrive in fast-paced, dynamic environments at the forefront of technology. You have a proven track record of leading cross-functional teams through the complete ASIC design flow, from RTL to physical implementation, delivering high-quality results under tight deadlines.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Understanding and documenting project scope, requirements, and deliverable dependencies across multiple cross-functional teams.
Leading regular and ad hoc sync-up meetings with internal teams and customers to align goals, clarify requirements, and drive progress.
Tracking schedules and milestones, proactively identifying risks and issues, and implementing mitigation plans to ensure timely, high-quality project delivery.
Acting as the central point of contact for both internal stakeholders and external customers, facilitating clear and effective communication.
Developing, deploying, and enforcing standardized processes in project execution to optimize efficiency and quality.
Collaborating with engineering, design, and product teams to ensure seamless hand-offs and integration across project phases.
Providing leadership, mentorship, and guidance to team members to foster a culture of excellence and continuous improvement.
What You’ll Need:
MSEE/BSEE or MSCE/BSCE with 15+ years’ experience in ASIC design and project management.
Deep understanding of ASIC design flow (RTL to physical implementation) and familiarity with advanced EDA tools (e.g., Synopsys EDA tools).
Proficiency with industry-standard data formats: Verilog, GDS, LEF, DEF, SDF, LIB, UPF, CPM, CMM, SDC, etc.
Demonstrated experience managing customer-facing projects and collaborating with cross-functional teams.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to organize and convey information effectively at different levels of abstraction.
Strong operational skills, including developing and enforcing processes for complex project execution.
Who You Are:
Strategic thinker and proactive problem solver.
Natural leader with the ability to inspire, mentor, and drive cross-functional teams toward shared goals.
Detail-oriented and highly organized, capable of managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communicator, comfortable interfacing with both technical and business stakeholders.
Self-motivated, adaptable, and resilient in the face of challenges.
The Impact You Will Have:
Accelerating the delivery of high-speed interface IP and high-performance computing subsystems that power industry-leading products worldwide.
Enhancing operational excellence through process innovation and enforcement, setting new standards for project execution at Synopsys.
Building lasting relationships with customers by providing consistent, transparent, and effective project leadership.
Driving risk management strategies that minimize project delays and maximize customer satisfaction.
Contributing to Synopsys’ reputation as a trusted partner and technology leader in the semiconductor industry.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join a world-class engineering and program management team focused on delivering best-in-class high-speed interface IP and high-performance computing subsystem solutions. The team values collaboration, innovation, and operational excellence, working closely with customers, design, and engineering teams across Synopsys to deliver projects that set industry standards. You’ll have the opportunity to work alongside experts who are passionate about pushing the boundaries of semiconductor technology.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
#LI-NK4
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.
In addition to the base salary, this role may be eligible for an annual bonus, equity, and other discretionary bonuses. Synopsys offers comprehensive health, wellness, and financial benefits as part of a competitive total rewards package. The actual compensation offered will be based on a number of job-related factors, including location, skills, experience, and education. Your recruiter can share more specific details on the total rewards package upon request. The base salary range for this role is across the U.S.

At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a seasoned engineering leader with a passion for driving complex programs to successful completion. Combining deep technical expertise with a strategic mindset, you thrive in environments where ambiguity is the norm and collaboration is key. Your experience spans the full lifecycle of program and project management—initiating, planning, executing, monitoring, and closing—with a knack for optimizing outcomes against challenging constraints. You have managed large-scale, cross-functional engineering initiatives, particularly in semiconductor or high-tech domains, and are recognized for your ability to build trust and influence stakeholders at all levels.
You are skilled at identifying and managing risks, balancing priorities, and ensuring that project deliverables align with organizational goals. You take pride in fostering a culture of accountability, innovation, and continuous improvement within your teams. Your communication style is clear and adaptive, enabling you to bridge technical and non-technical audiences alike. You are committed to mentoring others, championing best practices in project management, and driving consistency across teams. Above all, you’re motivated by the opportunity to make a tangible impact—delivering programs that push the boundaries of technology and set new industry standards.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Managing the entire program engineering lifecycle—including initiation, definition, planning, execution, and closure—across multiple interconnected projects.
Monitoring and controlling program budgets, schedules, risks, issues, and scopes to ensure successful delivery of key milestones and customer commitments.
Implementing and refining program and project management standards, tools, and methodologies to drive operational excellence.
Identifying organizational needs, managing stakeholder expectations, and building strong, trust-based relationships with internal and external partners.
Leading regular status meetings with cross-functional teams, project managers, sponsors, and stakeholders to provide clear updates and align on priorities.
Coaching and mentoring other Project Engineering Managers, fostering a culture of collaboration, learning, and high performance.
Coordinating cross-project activities within the SerDes project management department for maximum synergy and impact.
Providing internal and external reporting to senior leadership and external entities, supporting strategic decision-making and performance visibility.
The Impact You Will Have:
Enable the successful delivery of high-impact programs that drive Synopsys’ leadership in semiconductor technology and IP solutions.
Enhance stakeholder satisfaction through proactive management of expectations, risks, and communication.
Elevate project management maturity by championing standards, tools, and best practices across the organization.
Improve cross-functional collaboration, ensuring that technical and business objectives are met efficiently and effectively.
Support organizational agility by identifying and resolving roadblocks, enabling teams to adapt to evolving requirements.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Applied Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
5+ years of experience in project/program management within engineering, ideally in semiconductor, IP, or ASIC design environments.
Formal project management certification or demonstrable experience (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2, or similar).

Collaborative by nature, you work seamlessly with peers, customers, and R&D teams, building strong relationships and fostering open communication. You are eager to learn, excited by new challenges, and motivated to make a tangible impact on both product quality and customer satisfaction.

Driving advanced product capabilities and innovations in emulation runtime performance for industry-leading platforms.
Engaging in the full product lifecycle, from feature definition and implementation to rigorous testing, quality measurement, and customer deployment.
Collaborating closely with internal stakeholders, including Application Engineering peers and R&D teams, to deliver superior outcomes for customers.
Providing technical leadership and product evaluation support to key emulation customers across the globe.
Leading comprehensive root cause analyses to resolve and prevent emulation performance bottlenecks.
Ensuring the highest standards of verification for SoC designs, contributing to the creation of robust and reliable products.
The Impact You Will Have:
Elevating emulation runtime performance through the development and deployment of cutting-edge technologies.
Delivering effective root cause analysis that drives measurable improvements in performance and customer satisfaction.
Enhancing verification processes for SoC designs, ensuring the delivery of high-quality, reliable silicon products.
Building strong, collaborative relationships that drive customer success and foster innovation.
Contributing to the global deployment of advanced performance technologies in ZeBu platforms.
Driving a culture of continuous innovation and technical excellence within the team and broader organization.
What You’ll Nee
d:
Minimum 8 years of experience in emulation methodology, spanning early RTL verification to software bring up.
Proven expertise in verification, with a focus on System on Chip (SoC) design bring-up and validation. This includes an extended knowledge of most frequent bus and memory protocols, and a good understanding of OSes booting sequence.
Comprehensive knowledge of the architecture of emulation / FPGA prototyping platforms and their eco-systems.
A good understanding of the compilation and runtime flows on these emulation platforms.
Demonstrated experience in using debug features of these emulation platforms, and in conducting root cause analysis for emulation runtime performance issues.
Strong collaborative skills, with a track record of working effectively with cross-functional teams to drive product and customer success.
Who You Are:
A collaborative team player who thrives in dynamic, fast-paced environments.
Detail-oriented and analytical, with exceptional problem-solving skills.
Curious, adaptable, and eager to embrace new challenges and responsibilities.
An effective communicator, skilled at conveying complex technical information to diverse audiences.
An innovative thinker with a passion for continuous improvement and learning.

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a strategic and dynamic leader with a passion for technology and innovation. You thrive on building and nurturing relationships across the semiconductor and embedded systems landscape. With a deep understanding of processor architectures, you can easily navigate the complexities of CPUs, DSPs, NPUs, and the rapidly evolving RISC-V ecosystem. You are adept at collaborating across engineering, marketing, and business development teams, and have a proven track record of bringing together partners, customers, and internal stakeholders to drive ecosystem growth and product adoption.
You are comfortable representing your organization as an industry thought leader, skilled at public speaking, and enjoy engaging with both technical and non-technical audiences. Your analytical mindset enables you to anticipate market trends and translate them into actionable strategies. You are energized by fast-paced, cross-functional environments and are motivated by a desire to deliver results and exceed expectations. You possess a global perspective, are willing to travel, and are highly adaptable to diverse work cultures. Your experience in product or partner marketing, especially within AI, ML, or automotive domains, gives you a unique edge in understanding customer needs and competitive dynamics. Above all, you are driven by curiosity, ambition, and a collaborative spirit that inspires those around you to achieve more.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Building and cultivating strategic relationships with industry leaders, partners, and key stakeholders to drive adoption of Synopsys’ ARC and ARC-V Processor IP.
Developing and executing a comprehensive ecosystem strategy to strengthen Synopsys’ position in the embedded processor market.
Negotiating and managing partner agreements to expand hardware and software support for ARC and ARC-V processor portfolios.
Creating and delivering sales training materials, outbound marketing collateral, and thought leadership content to promote ecosystem solutions.
Conducting in-depth market research, competitive analyses, and demand creation activities to anticipate trends and customer requirements.
Collaborating with the RISC-V community and aligning ecosystem initiatives with open standards and industry best practices.
Advising product development teams and executive leadership on technical and business issues to facilitate processor IP deployment and differentiation.
Representing Synopsys at industry events, conferences, and customer meetings as a principal point of contact for ecosystem matters.
The Impact You Will Have:
Accelerate the adoption and integration of Synopsys ARC and ARC-V processors across diverse embedded applications, including mobile, IoT, digital home, automotive, and storage sectors.
Shape the strategic direction of the processor IP ecosystem, ensuring Synopsys remains a leader in CPU, DSP, and AI workload solutions.
Enable customers and partners to innovate faster by providing robust ecosystem support, tools, and resources.
Drive competitive differentiation and market growth through ecosystem expansion and strategic partnerships.
Influence processor product roadmaps and feature sets based on real-world market insights and customer feedback.
Foster a collaborative environment that connects internal and external stakeholders, driving innovation and business success.
Enhance Synopsys’ visibility and reputation as a trusted partner and technology leader in the embedded processor domain.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or related field; advanced degree (MBA or similar) and/or software development experience is a plus.
Proven experience in product marketing or partner marketing for CPU, DSP, or NPU products.
Solid technical understanding of CPUs, DSPs, NPUs, RISC-V architectures, and associated software development tools.
Background in artificial intelligence, machine learning, or automotive applications is highly desirable.
Exceptional communication, negotiation, and public speaking skills with experience engaging diverse, global audiences.
Familiarity with sales enablement, marketing collateral creation, and outbound marketing strategies.
Willingness and ability to travel worldwide as needed.
Who You Are:
Strategic thinker with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent relationship builder and influencer, comfortable networking across technical and business communities.
Highly collaborative, adaptable, and able to thrive in fast-paced, cross-functional teams.
Self-motivated, ambitious, and passionate about driving results and continuous improvement.
Strong communicator, able to convey complex technical concepts to varied audiences with clarity and impact.
Global mindset with an appreciation for diverse perspectives and cultures.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You’ll join a dedicated and innovative Processor IP team at Synopsys, focused on advancing the ARC and ARC-V processor portfolio and its ecosystem. The team collaborates closely with engineering, marketing, and business development groups, as well as external partners and the broader RISC-V community. Together, you’ll drive the adoption of high-performance, configurable processor solutions that empower customers to innovate across a wide range of embedded applications, from IoT to automotive and beyond.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.
In addition to the base salary, this role may be eligible for an annual bonus, equity, and other discretionary bonuses. Synopsys offers comprehensive health, wellness, and financial benefits as part of a competitive total rewards package. The actual compensation offered will be based on a number of job-related factors, including location, skills, experience, and education. Your recruiter can share more specific details on the total rewards package upon request. The base salary range for this role is across the U.S.
Back to job list
Apply

Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
You Are:
You are a visionary and hands-on technical leader with a robust background in CPU and processor design. You thrive in complex, fast-moving engineering environments and are passionate about advancing the boundaries of digital design. With at least a decade of experience in digital frontend design or verification for IP businesses, you have earned a reputation for delivering high-quality results and elevating the capabilities of your team. Your expertise spans microprocessor, memory, and system architecture, and you’re adept at both RTL and high-level modeling. You have a proven track record of taking ownership of critical design blocks, guiding teams to successful project completion, and providing mentorship to junior engineers. Your communication skills enable you to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to stakeholders across functions, and you’re comfortable navigating multi-site, cross-functional collaborations. You are adept at balancing technical depth with strategic oversight, ensuring that projects not only meet but exceed quality and performance standards. Your leadership is characterized by a commitment to continuous improvement, fostering a culture of excellence, accountability, and innovation. Above all, you are driven by curiosity, resilience, and a desire to make a meaningful impact on the future of computing.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Taking full ownership and accountability for the quality of delivery of one or more design blocks within Synopsys’ leading-edge DesignWare processor IP products.
Authoring technical plans and specifications for assigned design functions while guiding and coaching team members through execution.
Leading architecture, micro-architecture, RTL design, performance analysis, and verification/validation processes for high-performance and energy-efficient processors.
Collaborating with cross-functional and cross-site teams on technical topics such as algorithms, methodologies, SoC prototyping, and system bring-up.
Implementing, analyzing, debugging, and optimizing processor architectures, ensuring robust and efficient designs.
Driving and managing project requirements, resource planning, risk assessment, and quality management to ensure on-time, high-quality deliverables.
Creating, modifying, and reviewing documentation including design/verification work plans, engineering quality processes, and test reports.
The Impact You Will Have:
Delivering industry-leading processor IP that powers next-generation AI, vision, and high-performance computing applications.
Elevating the technical competence and collaboration within the processor design team through leadership and mentorship.
Influencing architectural decisions that shape the performance, efficiency, and scalability of Synopsys’ core processor offerings.
Ensuring robust, high-quality product releases through rigorous verification and validation workflows.
Accelerating innovation by implementing best-in-class design methodologies and tools.
Contributing to Synopsys’ reputation as a global technology leader by consistently delivering high-impact solutions to worldwide customers.
What You’ll Need:
Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields from a reputed institution.
Minimum 10 years of hands-on experience in digital frontend design or verification for processor IP development.
Deep expertise in microprocessor, memory, and system architecture, with a strong grasp of both design and verification flows.
Proficiency in SystemVerilog, Verilog, C/C++, assembly languages, Perl, Python, and shell scripting.
Experience with industry-standard tools: RTL linters, simulators, synthesizers, formal verification, coverage analysis, and CI/CD systems.
Strong project management skills, including requirements profiling, resource allocation, schedule tracking, and risk assessment.
Proven ability to create and review technical documentation, and to present engineering solutions to diverse audiences.
Who You Are:
Inspirational technical leader and coach, able to motivate and elevate team performance.
Excellent communicator, adept at collaborating across teams and locations.
Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving abilities and meticulous attention to detail.
Self-motivated, proactive, and resilient in the face of technical challenges.
Adaptable and open-minded, with a passion for continuous learning and innovation.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. Your experience spans at least seven years in the semiconductor industry, where you have honed your ability to bridge the gap between complex processor IP technology and customer requirements. Drive adoption of Synopsys processor IP solutions, directly contributing to business growth and market leadership.
Empower customers to achieve faster time-to-market by providing expert technical guidance and support throughout the pre-sales process.
Enable innovative SoC designs for a wide range of applications, from AI/ML and automotive safety to wireless communication and sensor technologies.
Enhance the reputation of Synopsys as a trusted technology partner through exceptional customer engagement and technical excellence.

7~10+ years of relevant experience in SoC/ASIC design and architecture.

Hands-on experience with RTL (Verilog) coding, synthesis, and physical design flows.

Excellent communication, presentation, and technical problem-solving skills.

Collaborative and team-oriented, thriving in diverse, cross-functional settings.
Adaptable and resilient, able to navigate ambiguity and rapidly changing priorities.
Proactive and self-motivated, driven to learn and continuously improve.

Customer-focused, with a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for delivering value.
Analytical thinker with a passion for problem-solving and innovation.

You thrive in dynamic, fast-paced environments and are excited by the prospect of working on the front lines of innovation with leading-edge processor architectures. Lead technical discussions, product demonstrations, and customer training sessions to showcase the value and capabilities of Synopsys processor IP. Support customers through the evaluation process, addressing technical questions, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring a smooth adoption of Synopsys technology. Travel (up to 30% within Japan) to customer sites, industry events, and internal meetings to foster strong partnerships and stay at the forefront of technology trends. Job Description and Requirements
We Are:
At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
Our Silicon Lifecycle Management (SLM) business is dedicated to building next-generation intelligent in-chip sensors, advanced hardware/software capabilities, and analytics that integrate into technology products to manage and improve every stage of the semiconductor lifecycle. We offer the world’s first full hardware IP, test, and end-to-end analytics solution, helping customers accelerate integration, optimize performance, power, area, schedule, and yield, and enhance reliability. Our SLM solutions enable differentiated products to reach the market quickly and with reduced risk.
You Are:
You are an accomplished engineer with a deep passion for advancing semiconductor technology and a proven track record in static timing analysis and synthesis. With a minimum of 8 years’ experience in the industry, you thrive in dynamic environments where innovation, precision, and collaboration are paramount. You have honed your expertise through hands-on work with advanced process nodes, and you are adept at navigating the complexities of IP, subsystem, and chip-level STA. Your technical prowess in RTL2GDS physical implementation, signoff, and place & route is complemented by your ability to see the bigger picture—balancing technical excellence with project planning and execution.
You are a natural mentor, eager to share your knowledge and uplift those around you. Communication is your strong suit, enabling you to bridge gaps between cross-functional teams and external partners. You approach challenges with curiosity and creativity, always seeking new ways to enhance workflows and methodologies. Your adaptability and resilience allow you to excel in global, multicultural environments, and you are motivated by the opportunity to drive impactful change. If you are passionate about shaping the future of chip design and eager to work on cutting-edge SLM IPs and subsystems, Synopsys wants to hear from you.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Leading the development and execution of STA methodologies for advanced SLM IPs, controllers, and on-chip monitors across the latest process nodes (16nm to 3nm and beyond).
Designing and implementing comprehensive STA plans, checkers, and review processes at the IP, subsystem, and chip levels.
Overseeing the RTL2GDSII flow, including synthesis, place & route, timing closure, and signoff for both soft and mixed-signal IPs.
Collaborating closely with design, verification, and product teams to ensure successful project execution and timely delivery.
Driving innovation by developing custom scripts and enhancing flows to optimize execution and improve design methodologies.
Mentoring junior engineers and fostering a culture of technical excellence, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
Engaging with customers and internal stakeholders to resolve technical challenges and support successful tape-outs.
The Impact You Will Have:
Accelerate the delivery of high-performance, reliable SLM solutions to market, enabling customers to achieve faster time-to-market with reduced risk.
Enhance the quality and efficiency of physical design implementation through robust STA strategies and process improvements.
Drive successful timing closure and tape-outs for leading-edge semiconductor products across advanced process nodes.
Contribute to the evolution of Synopsys’ SLM product portfolio, ensuring state-of-the-art innovation and differentiation.
Support the integration of intelligent in-chip sensors and analytics, empowering customers to optimize performance, power, and yield.
Strengthen Synopsys’ leadership position in the global semiconductor ecosystem through technical expertise and customer engagement.
What You’ll Need:
12+ years of relevant experience
Strong experience in STA concepts, tools, and methodologies at the IP, subsystem, and chip level.
In-depth knowledge of standard ASIC RTL2GDS physical implementation and signoff flows.
Proven hands-on expertise in synthesis, pre-layout and post-layout STA, and clock tree synthesis (CTS) tools.
Mandatory experience with functional and DFT (scan-shift, scan-capture, at-speed) mode constraints development and MCMM timing closure.
Proficiency with EDA tools from any major vendor, preferably Synopsys PrimeTime, ICC2, Design Compiler, Fusion Compiler, or equivalent.
Strong understanding of OCV, POCV, derates, crosstalk, and design margins.
Advanced scripting skills in TCL/PERL for flow automation and process enhancement.
BS or MS in Electrical Engineering or related field, with 8+ years of relevant industry experience.
Track record of successful timing closure and tape-outs on advanced nodes (14nm, 10nm, 7nm, 5nm, 3nm, 2nm).
Who You Are:
Collaborative team player with excellent communication, mentoring, and interpersonal skills.
Analytical thinker with a detail-oriented approach and strong problem-solving capabilities.
Self-driven, proactive, and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Adaptable and resilient, thriving in global, multicultural teams.
Committed to continuous learning and sharing knowledge with others.
Customer-focused with a passion for delivering high-quality, innovative solutions.
The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:
You will join the rapidly expanding Hardware-Analytics and Test (HAT) business unit, specifically within the SLM Hardware Group. Our team is at the forefront of developing state-of-the-art SLM controllers, on-chip monitors, and infrastructure IPs for the most advanced process nodes. We embrace a collaborative, innovation-driven culture where each member’s expertise contributes to shaping the future of semiconductor lifecycle management. You’ll work alongside talented engineers and thought leaders who are passionate about delivering differentiated solutions that make a global impact.
Rewards and Benefits:
We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.
